loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea weaves and sews several handicraft items, including shawls and scarves.

Matea is 35 years old. She is married to her husband, Juan, and has five children. The three children that live with her help to contribute to the family’s outstanding success. Matea has worked hard to buy an electric sewing machine, quite a rarity in this area, and also has acquired a very efficient wooden loom. Most women work with much more basic equipment and thus produce less fabric. You can see in her eyes that she’s very proud of her success.

Her house and shop are connected and the shop is on a main street that tourists stroll by along the shores of Lake Atitlán. As you enter her airy shop you can see the half dozen workstations, where she and the children hand weave over 21 scarves per day.

This will be Matea’s seventh credit cycle, having successfully repaid six prior loans.

Her goal with this loan is to increase production to sell more and eventually purchase a different house. Most importantly, she wants to feed and educate her children. Though she never attended school she can speak Spanish as a second language, having learned it from her children. And speaking Spanish helps a lot in selling items from her store.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara A. S. is a Mayan woman who lives high above the beautiful Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. Such a beautiful place hides the reality of her poverty. She is 49, married and has ten children, the youngest being 6 years old. Her daily struggles to feed her family and to be able to send all the children to school are immense. Though her husband works as a driver, that does not provide enough to sustain them so they must both work hard to provide for their large family.

Ever since her first loan 6 years ago, she has been making cheese and selling milk. She started her business using her first loan to buy a cow. That cow grew to an enormous size and had a calf. With sadness, she explained that the mother cow died suddenly, leaving her with a 21-day-old calf, which she bottle-fed until it could make it on its own. This calf is now fully grown and has produced a calf of its own.

Besides making cheese and selling milk, she has bought 10 baby chicks. In three months, when they are grown, she will sell them for about US$13.

Though she never went to school or learned to read or write, she is able to speak two languages: Her native language is Quiche and she also speaks Spanish, which she learned as a young girl when she started working as a housekeeper at the age of 7.

With this next loan she will buy a male baby calf, raise it and sell it for meat when it is mature. With this increase in capital she rests assured that the business will prosper and expand, which will result in her being able to send all her kids to school and provide proper nutrition for her family.

loans.use: Buy a calf to raise

loans.name: Ana Glora

texts.es:
I have been selling delicacies, or golosinas as we call them in my country, for three years. I sell pastries stuffed with chicken and beef, enchiladas and tacos. My store is in front of my house and thanks to God my neighbors and other people near my village buy my products. With this business I help my family and I help to pay for my children’s schooling. My goal is to increase my sales and open a store to sell my golosinas and right now I need your help to be able to continue my business this month.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer

Hace tres años que tengo este negocio de venta de golosinas como lo llamamos en nuestro pais. el negocio es de venta de pastelitos de pollo y carne de res, enchiladas y tacos. Mi negocio lo tengo enfrente de mi casa, gracias a Dios mis vecinos me compran y otras personas cercanas a mi colonia. Con este negocio ayudo a mi familia y a mis hijos con gastos del colegio. mi meta es ingrementar mis ventas y poder hacer un lugar donde vender mis golosinas, ahora necesito que me ayuden para poder vender en este mes.

loans.use: To purchase meat, cabbage, corn, onions, green chili, etc.

loans.name: Manuela Cecilia

texts.en:
Manuela Cecila C. is 29 years old and has worked hard over the last 2 years to develop a well organized little store called Tienda Jimena, named after her only daughter. You could call her tienda the local "mom and pop" corner store. Manuela has grown her business from a small eatery, or comedor, into a store that has everything the neighbors need for their daily life, including milk, sugar, rice, beans, pasta, soap, and a small selection of candy. She recently expanded to taking orders for shoes and makeup from the two small catalogs that sit on her glass candy case.

The Mayan women of this area mainly speak their native language, Quiche. She is an exception to the norm as she also speaks Spanish and has a sixth grade education.

Her smile says it all. She works hard and is proud to have developed this business. She relies on loans to restock her inventory and grow little by little. Her big dream is to provide an education for her daughter and continue to grow a successful business, which someday will expand to the transportation of goods.

loans.use: Purchase increased inventory for the store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario S. A., 47, can be found seated on the earthen floor of her adobe home weaving a snow-white tapestry that she will turn into traditional pants for a young boy of her Mayan village. She, like many other Mayan women in the highlands of Guatemala, is a weaver of the traditional clothing, which is the village identity in the highland culture. These days, weaving is not enough to make a living, so Rosario also sells vegetables in the nearby village of San Juan La Laguna on the shore of Lake Atitlan.

She is separated from her husband and now struggles to support herself and her three children. She does have a small plot of land on which to grow corn and beans to feed her family, but that is not enough, so she does both the weaving and the vegetable sales.

She has been a member of her women's group "Mujeres Clareñas" for eight years. With the current loan she will buy more vegetables to sell as well increase her yarn inventory. She hopes someday to be able to plant vegetables to sell. Her long-term goal is to build a better home.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables and materials for weaving

loans.name: Maria Celestina

texts.es:
My business is a small ‘apulperia’ (Grocery store) where I sell various delicacies like Churros, candies, cookies, bottled drinks, bread, beans etc. My business has helped me to support my family and provide my children with a good education. I have run this business in my house for three years, so that I do not have to rent a space. Now I need to buy more products to give my customers, neighbors from my village, better service.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo este pequeño negocio que es un apulperia (Grocery store) donde vendo varias golosinas como; Churros, confites, galletas, refrescos de botella, pan jabon, frijoles etec. El cual, me ayudado mucho a mantener ami familia y mis hijos para poderles dar una buena educacion mandandols al colegio. Este negocio lo tengo hace 3 años en mi casa. ya que no tengo para pagar un local. Ahora nesecito comprar mas productopara pder dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes los cuales son mis vesinos de mi colonia.

loans.use: To purchase bread, churros, cookies, candy, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva I. Álfaro is a widow at the age of 57. She started her small store about four years ago at her husband's suggestion when he started to get sick. They knew that she needed a way to support herself when he was no longer able to provide for them. Now she has operated the store for four years, selling chips, noodles, sodas, dry goods, rice, beans, potatoes, and tamales.

Before she got credit from Friendship Bridge, she had to rely on her suppliers for credit, which significantly increased the cost of her goods. Now she's in her third loan cycle, and will use the credit to continue growing her inventory. Her next goal is to buy a larger refrigerator so that she can start to offer chicken and other meats for sale.

Genoveva has two grandchildren who live with her. They're too young to go to school, but they will go when the time comes, and she will help with the considerable cost of their schooling. When Genoveva was a child, she studied for only one year, but nevertheless can read and can do all the math necessary for her store in her head.

The biggest challenges that she faces are the hours that the establishment has to stay open, from early in the morning until the evening, with her minding it alone. In addition, it's always a struggle to come up with the cash to purchase the next round of inventory.

loans.use: Purchase increased inventory for store.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana O. P. makes and sells tortillas from her home. She has been making tortillas for four years; before that she used to weave handicraft items. She will use the proceeds of her loan to buy 300 pounds of corn which she requires every week, the firewood to fire the stove, and plastic bags in which to sell the tortillas. She’s a member of the group of women called “Caterina".

As a single 52-year-old woman, she has learned to be resourceful in her life. In 2005, the rains from Hurricane Stan caused her house and everything else she owned to be washed away. Her house slid down the mountainside along with everything she owned except for two of the traditional indigenous huipiles, or local blouses. She decided to sell the shirt off her back in order to start over, and sold one of her two huipiles. Since then she has built a new house, which shares a patio with her son’s house. As she tells the story of her experience with the hurricane, tears come to her eyes. She says that her health is good, but that since the hurricane she is more nervous and afraid, and that life has not been the same. Although she’s recuperated somewhat from the hurricane, she still doesn’t have much in the way of clothes, and often wears a t-shirt around the home, although she puts on her huipil to go to the market or into the village.

She has 7 children. Two of her children and her sister help her with her growing business.

Like so many indigenous people, Sebastiana is enormously resourceful. She is a local midwife, delivering babies in her village. Some of the parents can pay and some cannot. Those who can, will pay up to 150 quetzals or about US$20 for her services. In her medical bag are lubricant, prenatal vitamins, metal pans, and a few bandages. Currently, she is in need of gloves to wear during the delivery. When asked where she learned the art of midwifery, she replied in Cakchiquel, that although she has never gone to school and never learned to read or write, she has just always known how to do this.

loans.use: She will use the proceeds of her loan to buy the 300 pounds of corn she requires every week, the firewood to fire the stove, and plastic bags to sell the tortillas in.

loans.name: Maria Estanislada

texts.en:
I’ve been selling clothes and domestic appliances for 2 years within my community. This business helped me to buy my medications and help my family with monthly expenditures. In my country, it is impossible to find a job when someone is old as I am, therefore this business is my way to earn my living.

I need now to buy more products because I have several orders from my clients. I need your help to do these purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 2 años que me dedico a la venta de ropa y electrodomesticos en mi comunidad. Este negocio me ha ayudado para comprar mis medicinas y ayudar mi familia con los gastos de consumo mensual. A mi edad es imposible encontrar un trabajo en mi pais, asi que este negocio es mi sustento de vida.

Ahora necesito comprar mas productos ya que tengo varios pedidos de mis clientes. Ahora necesito la ayuda de ustes para poder hacer estas compras.

loans.use: To buy clothes (blouses, skirts, nightdresses, pants etc…)

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Graciela Velazquez, 32 years old, lives in the Trinidad neighborhood of Asuncion and has two school-aged children, one of whom lives with her and the other with a grandmother. Dona Graciela is a seamstress who works, on her own, making all kinds of garments, exclusively for women. She's been doing this work for 13 years, relying on two old-model sewing machines, both of which need to be replaced. She dreams of opening a shop, something that will involve a big investment and is impossible for her now. Her immediate plan is to purchase a sewing machine and hire a person to help her so that she can work with the best possible chance to get ahead. For that, she’s asking for credit of USD 200 and promises to pay it back monthly.

This business forms part of the group of CME micro-businesses, “Women in Action”. Formed by 20 people who take responsibility for the loan with solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Graciela Velázquez, de 32 años vive en el barrio Trinidad de Asunción, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, uno de sus hijos vive con ella y el otro con la abuela. Doña Graciela es costurera, se dedica, por cuenta propia, a la confección de prendas de todo tipo, exclusivamente para damas. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 13 años, cuenta con dos máquinas de coser modelos antiguos, las que necesita reponer. Sueña con abrir una boutique, lo que implicará mucha inversión y ahora le resulta imposible. Su proyecto inmediato es adquirir una máquina de coser, contratar un personal para ayudarla y así poder trabajar con mejores posibilidades de progresar. Para ello solicita un crédito de USD 200 y se compromete pagarlo mensualmente.

Este negocio forma parte del grupo de microempresas del CME “Mujeres en Acción”. Formada por 20 personas que responden por el préstamo solidariamente.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de coser

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus Amado Ramirez is a carpenter and makes furniture such as chests of drawers, chairs, and tables. He began his career as a carpenter working for someone else, but then decided to start his own business in order to make more money. Jesus started his microenterprise 10 years ago.

Jesus is 36 years old, married, and has 2 sons and 2 daughters ages 16, 11, 7, and 3. Jesus works from the back of his house. He has a large patio area that he has converted for his business, while in the front of the house, his wife runs a copetin, a small food store, that sells sandwiches and empanadas.

Jesus works from Monday to Saturday from 7 am to 5 pm and takes a 2 hour lunch break and siesta. He only makes furniture when he receives an order from his clients.

Jesus needs this loan in order to buy more wood and supplies to complete an order he recently received.

loans.use: Purchase wood and supplies

loans.name: Melba Marina

texts.en:
For 3 years and a half, I have a small business selling soft drinks and cakes. It allows me to help my family because I’m too old to work.

Now, I need to buy more soft drinks, juices and flour to make cakes. My best clients are all my neighbors in my community. I’ll be grateful if you can help me to provide them a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos y pasteles desde hace 3 años y medio con el cual puedo ayudar a mi familia, ya que no puedo trabajar a mi edad.

Ahora necesito comprar mas refresco, jugos y harina para hacer pasteles. Mis mejores clientes son todos mis vecinos de mi barrio. Os agradeceré que me ayuden para poder dar un mejor servicio en mi negocio.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juices and flour to make cakes

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
I have a small grocery business in my home, which I've had for a few months. it helps me to be able to pay for my children's studies. But now I need to buy more products to be able to provide better service to my customers, who are very good to me, since they come to buy from me an help me, since I have very little. Thank you if you can help me so my business can grow.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo un pequeño negocio de una pulperia en mi casa, este negocio lo tengo hace unos meses, el cual me ayuda para poder pagar estudios a mis hijos. Pero ahora necesito comprar mas producto para poder dar un mejor servio a mis clientes los cuales son muy buenos conmigo ya que me vienen a comprar para ayudarme, ya que lo que tengo es muy poco. les agradesere si me puden ayudar para que mi negocio cresca.

loans.use: Purchase eggs, sodas, rice, sugaer, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Reina Ondina

texts.es:
I'm a travelling salesperson, selling cheese, butter, and pastries, etc. I have been working with this business for 1 year, and my best customers are all my neighbors in the community. This business helps me to be able to buy supplies for my children to take to school. Now I need to buy more products, since I don't have much to sell this month.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo soy vendedora ambulante de queso , mantequilla, rosquillas etec, me dedico a este negocio hace 1 años, mis mejores clientes son todos mis vesinos de la comunidad. Este negocio me ayuda para poder comprar utiles a mis hijos para que lleven a la escuela. Ahora necesito compar mas producto ya que no tengo mucho que vender en este mes.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese, butter, pastries, dulce de leche, quesillo, etc.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Hi, I'm Rufina, and I have this small business selling shampoo and creams and gold. I sell in the workshops near my town, and I have very good clients who work in those workshops and are neighbors. Now, I need to buy more products, since I have several orders. For 2 years, I have worked selling these products. My goal is to increase my inventory to have greater variety of products. With the earnings, I will be able to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola, yo soy Rufina tengo este pqueño negocio de de venta de shampoo y cremas y enchape de oro. Yo ahago mis ventas en las oficinas sercanas de mi pueblo, tengo muy buenas clientas las cuales son oficinsitas y vesinas. Ahora nesecito comprar mas producto ya que tengo varios pedidos. hace 2 años me dedico a la venta de estos productos. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor variedad de productos con las ganancias asi podre mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of shamoo. face and body creams, glasses and gold

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his spare part business

loans.name: Arzulla

texts.en: Arzulla is 47 years old and lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has a child. This man has been in this business for 9 years. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy  3 sacks of fertilizer and orchard medicines for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and orchard medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his milk selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his scrap selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her charcoal selling business

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin S. lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Elvin is 24 years old and single. Elvin has raised cattle for 5 years. He started out with one cow and then began to breed calves. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy fodder and  baling presses, and keep his cattle well fed. Elvin eventually hopes to increase the number of his cattle  to improve his business and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy feed and baling presses for his cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed for his animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish selling business

loans.name: Arzukhanim

texts.en: Arzukhanim Byramova is a 57-year-old widow, who has raised three children alone. Arzukhanim lives with her children in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. She has raised cattle for 5 years and finds this a good way to support her family. She would like a loan of $475 to buy 200 baling presses.

loans.use: To buy 200 baling presses

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal Rakhaimov is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Amal has his own vineyard and 8 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy  orchard medicines and fertilizer. He plans to develop his vineyard and increase his yields.

loans.use: To buy orchard medicines and fertilizer

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh A. is a single man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old and has 6 years of experience in this business. 
Taleh loves growing grape vines. He would like a loan of  $1200 to buy fertilizer and garden medicines to develop his orchard, especially the vineyard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and orchard medicines for his vineyard.

loans.name: Djamil

texts.en:
Djamil B. owns a  vineyard and has run his business for 15 years. 
Djamil is 47 years old and is married with two children. The B. family  lives in Yenikand, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Djamil would like a loan of $950 to buy 250 vine-props to improve the growing of his vines.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his vineyard

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif G. is 42 years old and is married, with three children.  Arif's family lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan.  Arif has had his orchard business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy  another plot of land and expand his business, which includes a small vineyard.

loans.use: To buy land to expand his orchard.

loans.name: Barat

texts.en:
Barat U. lives in Yenikand, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He is 35 years old and has three children. Barat has been raising sheep for 10 years. 
He would like to a  loan of $1200  to buy 10 sheep and 200 baling presses.

loans.use: To increase his flock of sheep and buy equipment for his livestock operation

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children, of whom two are in secondary school. Upon completion of secondary school, Anna was married to a taxi driver. Income from her husband alone could not meet all the family expenses, let alone school fees for the children.

That situation forced Anna to find a means to help her husband raise the family. She decided to join a training course in batik-making from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO). Since she started this business twelve years ago, she has acquired a lot of customers for her own batik. She now has both regular and new customers.

She needs USD 600 to add a stock of raw materials for batik-making. Anna M.’s cloth business is continuing to grow, in part because of the raw materials she was able to purchase with the money from her first loan with Kiva, which she has repaid in full.

loans.use: Adding to her stock of batik-making materials

loans.name: Dossy

texts.en:
Dossy runs two business: decorations for functions/ceremonies (weddings, business meetings, etc.) and a boutique. She was educated up to secondary school. She could not get a job because employment opportunities are limited, especially for girls. Her parents decided to send her for a tailoring course, which she completed and started her own tailoring mart. Later she discovered that during weekends there is high demand for decorations. She decided to learn the skill through apprenticeship. This new line of business keeps her busy, particularly on Fridays and Saturdays when weddings and other cerebrations takes place.

The loan of US$ 1200 will assist her to purchase up-to-date decoration materials and equipment. The materials are locally available through importers who normally get them from Far East. She thanks all the lenders of her first loan with Kiva, which she has paid in full.

loans.use: Purchase of decoration lamps, artificial flowers, table cloths

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three children.She has been in business for the past ten years. She runs a stationery and school supplies shop in Dar es Salaam. Her shop stocks general stationery (files, ball-point pens, marker pens, counter books, flip charts, office pins, paper clips, paper punches, etc.)

Mariam thanks all the lenders of her first loan with Kiva, which she has finished repaying. With the loan she was able to start selling primary and secondary schools textbooks. Mariam is pleased because the turnover of textbooks is high, especially in the months of January/December and June which are new semester months.

Mariam is requesting a second loan with Kiva of USD 1200 to replenish her stock of general stationery and textbooks. She has recently shifted to a new business location after the former premises she was renting was sold to a new owner. She had a hard time reorganizing herself in a new location.

loans.use: To add to her stock of stationery supplies

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo lives in a rented house in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the City of La Paz with his wife, Cecilia, and their 3-year-old child. Gonzalo is a member of the police at the lowest rank (public guard in the streets) and provides services in District 1 in the city of La Paz. His wife sells sweets at a kiosk in an elementary school.

When they got married, the Fernandezes left their parents' homes and currently rent a small home that just has one bedroom and a bath.

The credit they are requesting will be for them to acquire an anticretico (a special lease agreement used in Bolivia) which will allow them to improve their quality of life, and at the same time, to start a savings so they can consider the possibility of acquiring their own home in the future. This is their first loan, and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies them to be able to request the loan and honor their credit obligations.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Gonzalo vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, Cecilia y su hijo de 3 años. Gonzalo es miembro de la policía en el grado mas bajo( guardia público en las calles) y presta sus servicios en el distrito 1 de la ciudad de La Paz, en tanto que su esposa vende dulces en un Kiosco de una escuela primaria. Al contraer matrimonio, los esposos Fernández salieron de la casa paterna y actualmente pagan alquileres por una pequeña vivienda que solo tiene una habitación y un baño. El crédito solicitado será para que puedan adquirir un anticretico que les permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida y al mismo tiempo podrán iniciar un ahorro para que en el futuro puedan considerar la posibilidad de adquirir una vivienda propia . Este es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico los califican para poder solicitar el préstamo y honrar sus obligaciones crediticias.

loans.use: To acquire a special lease agreement for housing

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos owns a car that he uses to work as a radio taxi operator during the week (Monday-Sunday). He resides in the zone of Alto Obrajes in the city of La Paz. He has a daughtrer who is independent.

It is the second time that he applies for a loan. His credit history with our institution qualifies him as client 1, meaning that he has paid in good faith his previous commitment. The amount he asks wil be invested in buying new tires, fixing the motor, and general maintenance of his car.

His credit history and work experience in the transportation service enables him to apply for this loan. The loan in return will give him the income needed to cover this commitment.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Juan Carlos tiene una movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi de lunes a domingo. Su domicilio se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene una hija que es independiente.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de llantas, arreglo de motor y mantenimiento en general de su movilidad.

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el servicio de transporte, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto lives in a rented place located in the Feliciano Kantuta Street, Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He is 31 years old and single. He owns an auto shop which Alberto started 2 years ago. He has an assistant which he pays on a weekly basis and Alberto's income is a moderate one. He earns enough to survive but wishes to become a professional in the near future. That is the reason he goes to school at night.

The loan that he is asking for will be invested in buying a computer to work on his college projects and assignments as well as to continue his studies with adequate material.

This is his first loan application with Impro and the performed evaluation qualifies him to obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Translator

Alberto vive en alquiler en la calle Feliciano Kantuta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero. Tiene un taller de mecánica que funciona desde hace dos años y trabaja con un ayudante al cual le paga semanalmente. Los ingresos que el tiene son moderados. Le alcanza para subsistir pero el desea ser profesional en un futuro por tal razón por las noches estudia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora para efectuar sus trabajos universitarios y poder continuar sus estudios con material adecuado.

No tiene antecedente con Impro es su primer crédito, y la evaluación efectuada lo califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchasing a computer.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio lives in a rented place located on the Jaime Zudañes Street, Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He is 50 years old and is separated from his wife. He lives with his three daughters, two of them are minors who depend on him.

He has a woodworking shop located in his lot at the Pasankeri zone(west side of the city of La Paz). With the first loans that Impro provided him, he installed the small shop, the same one that toady is much bigger because of machinery and two employees that work with him as master carpenter and his assistant. Besides constructing furniture, he contracts with construction companies.

Patricio is a client since the year 2000 (he has been granted 8 loans already). His credit history qualifies him as good client and grants him access to a new loan. This new loan will be invested in buying raw materials (wood) to elaborate his products

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Translator

Patricio vive en alquiler en la calle Jaime Zudañes de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separado de la esposa y tiene 50 años de edad , vive con sus tres hijas dos de ellas menores de edad y dependientes de él.

Tiene un taller de carpintería que esta ubicado en un terreno de su propiedad en la zona de Pasankeri (ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz). Con los primeros créditos otorgados por Impro, instalo su pequeño taller el mismo que actualmente es mas grande, y ya cuenta con maquinaria y trabaja con dos empleados: un maestro carpintero y su ayudante. Además de elaborar muebles realiza contratos con empresas constructoras.

Es cliente desde el año 2000 (ha recibido ya 8 créditos), y sus antecedentes históricos lo califica como buen cliente y lo habilitan para acceder a un nuevo crédito. El nuevo credito sera destinado a la compra de materia prima (madera) para la elaboración de sus productos.

loans.use: Working capital for his carpentry and furniture business.

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
Olga is a very responsible and hard working woman. She has three children who are 2, 13, and 19 years old. Eight years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She started because Olga likes and loves this trade. Shortly after her husband left her, this activity became her only income souce to get the resources that her family needed. When she saw the hardships that her eldest son endured, she decided to leave school and started to work.

Olga wishes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a $250 dollars loan that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover the customers' demands. She commits herself to return back the amount in 3 months. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of their business. They will sincerely thank you for it

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Olga es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene tres hijos de 2, 13 y 19 años de edad. Desde hace ocho años comenzó a ofrecer sus servicios de costura a sus vecinos y conocidos, inició por el gusto que siente hacia este oficio pero después de que su esposo los abandonó esta actividad se convirtió en su única fuente de ingresos con la que ha obtenido los recursos que necesita su familia, al ver las necesidades por las que pasaban su hijo mayor abandonó sus estudios y comenzó a trabajar.

Olga desea que sus hijos puedan continuar sus estudios para lo que necesita que su negocio continúe creciendo. Con este fin solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ayuda a esta familia a mejorar su calidad de vida contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buying supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Maria Inés

texts.es:
Maria Inés is originally from Juárez in Nuevo León. She's married and has one child. Her husband is a taxi driver, so he doesn't have a secure income. To improve the economic situation of their family, Maria started out selling hamburgers four years ago. Thanks to the quality of the products she makes, little by little, her clientele grew, and to offer a good service, she incorporated other foods to sell, such as tacos, enchiladas and soups.

Now, to continue growing, she is requesting a loan of $250 which she will use to remodel her stand to give it a better appearance and offer better service to her customers. She is able to return this amount in 3 months. Be an important part of the development of this business, and they will thank you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria Inés es originaria de la localidad de Juárez en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo es taxista por lo que no cuenta con un ingreso seguro, para mejorar un su situación económica de su familia Maria inició con la venta de hamburguesas hace cuatro años, gracias a la calidad de los productos que elabora poco a poco fue incrementando su clientela y para ofrecer un buen servicio incorporó la venta de otros alimentos, como tacos, enchiladas y sopes.

Ahora para continuar creciendo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su puesto para darle una mejor apariencia y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, ellos agradecen mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: Remodelación y compra de insumos

loans.name: Lea Nellely

texts.es:
Lea is very hard-working and responsible. She is married, has five children between 1 and 11 years old, and her husband works as a taxi driver. This means he hasn't had a secure income to help with the home and children's expenses for three years. Lea is working with used clothing sales, and little by little has grown her client base, and her sales, considerably.

To be able to meet her customers' demand, Lea is requesting a loan of $250 which she will use to purchase merchandise, with which she hopes to have better variety and offer a good service. She is committed to returning this amount in 3 months. Lea and her family thank you very much for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Lea es muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene cinco hijos entre 1 y 11 años D. edad, su esposo se desempeña como taxista por lo que no cuenta con un ingreso seguro, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos desD. hace tres años Lea se dedica a L. venta D. ropa usada, poco a poco fueron incrementando sus clientes y sus ventas considerablemente.

Para poder cubrir L. demanda D. sus clientes Lea solicita un préstamo D. $ 250 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía, con lo que espera tener una mejor variedad y ofrecer un buen servicio, elL. se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Lea y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Karla Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karla is single and has four children, who are studying. She has never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for 10 years, she has been working with the sales of used clothing, and then she began making and selling pasteles (savory pastries). this has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day.

Thanks to the good quality of the pasteles she makes, she has grown her business and is now requesting a loan of $250 that will be used to purchase goods to increase her production and meet her clients' demand. She promises to return this amount in 3 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of her business, and they will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Karla es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, que se están estudiando. Nunca ha tenido la ayuda de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, después inició con la elaboración y venta de pasteles, este ha sido su único ingreso para sostener y dar educación a sus hijos, no ha sido fácil para ella tener toda la responsabilidad de su familia, pero el amor hacia sus hijos es lo que la impulsa día a día.

Gracias a la buena calidad de pasteles que elabora ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ayúdalos contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and has two children ages 11 and 15. Her husband is a rural police officer, but the salary he receives is not sufficient to meet the needs of their family. With this need, Juana started to sell shoes 13 years ago, and at the beginning her sister helped her, but as her children grew, the need to obtain a better income motivated her to become independent and start her own business.

Fortunately, thanks to the good service that she offers, she has been able to gain many customers and make her business grow, she now needs a loan of $250 that will go for the purchase of merchandise, to fulfill the orders she has and have a better variety. She is able to return this amount in 3 months. Be an important part in the life of this family. They will thank you sincerely for your help.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, su esposo es policía rural pero el salario que recibe no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, ante esta necesidad Juana comenzó a vender calzado desde hace 13 años, al principio le ayudaba a su hermana, pero al ir creciendo sus hijos las necesidad de obtener un mejor ingreso la motivo a independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio.

Afortunadamente, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado tener muchos clientes y hacer crecer su negocio, ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para surtir los pedidos que tiene y contar con una mejor variedad, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Elvia Minerva

texts.es:
Elvia is married and lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo León. Her huband is a teacher, and four years ago suffered an accident which prevented him from continuing his work. To be able to obtain the resources they needed, Elvia started to sell jewelery, beginning with her friends and family, but thanks to the good quality of products that she offers and her talent for sales, she soon was able to increase her number of customers.

Elvia is requesting a loan of $250 which will be used for the purchase of merchandise. This will allow her to fulfill the orders she has and continue growing her business. She is committed to returning this quantity in 3 months. She thanks you very much for the opportunity you provide with your support for growing and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Elvia es casada y vive en la localidad de Guadalupe, Nuevo León. Su esposo es maestro, hace cuatro años él sufrió un accidente que le impidió continuar con su trabajo y para poder obtener los recursos que necesitaban Elvia comenzó a vender joyería, inició entre sus conocidos y familiares pero gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y su gusto por las ventas pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes.

Elvia está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, esto le permitirá cubrir los pedidos que tiene y continuar creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de crecer y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is a very hard-working woman. She's divorced, with three children, ages 19, 22 and 25. Eight years ago, she started to have a lot of problems with her husband and didn't receive help from him towards the home expenses or their children's school costs. She decided to start selling shoes. Irma had to work a lot to be able to help her children progress, but their well-being is her best reward.

Thanks to the good service she offers, she has been able to increase her orders, to be able to fulfill them completely, she is requesting a credit of $925, which she will use to purchase merchandise. She is committed to returning this amount in 6 months. You can have an impact on this family's well-being. DeciD. to support them and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Irma es una mujer muy trabajadora, elL. es divorciada y tiene tres hijos D. 19, 22 y 25 años D. edad. Hace ocho años comenzó a tener muchos problemas con su esposo y no recibía ayuda D. él para cubrir los gastos D. su hogar y L. escueL. D. sus hijos, por lo que decidió iniciar con L. venta D. zapatos, Irma tuvo que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos pero su bienestar es su mejor recompensa.

Gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado incrementar sus pedidos, para poder surtirlos por completo está solicitando un crédito por $ 925 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía, elL. se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar D. esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos y mejorar su calidad D. vida.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives in a domestic partnership and has four children, all of them students. Her partner is a mechanical technician, but isn't able to help with all the home expenses and their children's school. She and the children go without many things they need and to improve their quality of life, Maria started to sell jewelry eight years ago. Little by little, she has increased her customers and incorporated the sales of linen, obtaining very good results.

To continue growing, Maria is requesting a loan of $650 which she will use to buy merchandise to be able to meet her customers' orders and offer good service. She will return this amount in 6 months. Be part of the growth of this business and help improve the life of this family. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos, todos ellos estudiantes, su pareja es técnico mecánico pero no le ayuda con todos los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, ella y sus hijos pasaban muchas necesidades económicas y para mejorar su calidad de vida Maria comenzó a vender joyería hace ocho años, poco a poco fueron incrementando sus clientes e incorporó la venta de lencería obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Para continuar creciendo Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella regresará esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy truck

loans.name: Aloys Odwori

texts.en:
Aloys is forty four years old and a father of three children; two boys and a girl. The boys are in class seven and five respectively and the girl still at home by the virtue of her age. His wife helps him at store. Aloys is a primary school dropout; he hasn’t taken any formal training but learnt the business through apprenticeship.
Aloys operates a general store on a rented premise in Chwele town in Bungoma district. His stock of about Kshs 25,000/- consists of goods ranging from house hold to farm products. He started it early last year and has been going home with a profit of Kshs 300/- to Kshs 400/- at the end of the day. He usually gets his stock twice a week from bungoma. In terms of clientel, Aloys mostly serves residents of Chwele centre and its environs and majorly travelers because Chwele is located on one of the main roads to Kitale.
With a young business, he says that he is only able to sustain his family, provide them with basic needs and plough back the rest of the profits.
With his first loan from PEMCI, Aloy intends to stock up the shop, he says that the shop still lacks many goods that attract customers and that’s where to invest in.

loans.use: To stock-up His store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up his store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: buy CAT tools

loans.use: buy software

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs Mom C. is 29 and lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. She is a garment worker and her husband is a construction foreman. They have two children and together they earn around 11 dollars per day. 
Mrs Mom C. would like to buy a motorcycle for her husband. She also wants to repair their house. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and to repair their house

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr Chin K. is 48 and lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. He is a driver and earn around 5 dollars per day. He has 5 children. His wife wants to sell rice and khmer foods at home. Therefore, they need tools to implement this new business. In the future, they would like to own a big shop where they could sell a wide variety of khmer food.

loans.use: To purchase tools to sell khmer foods.

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Mrs. Sing M. is 41 years old and lives in Pray Veng, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children.  Mrs. Sing M. is a grocer, while her husband is a construction foreman.  One of their children works in a garment factory, and the total income of the household is around $6/day.  Mrs. Sing M. is doing very well in her grocery business, but she does not have enough capital to purchase more goods.  She will use this loan to buy more groceries for her inventory so that she can build up her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin K. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  Her husband is a construction foreman, and her children are students. Mrs. Sin K. manages the family and their finances. Her family spends a lot of money on transportation for her husband to get to work.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorbike so that her husband can easily travel to different construction sites without paying motor taxi drivers. In the future, Mrs. Sin K. wants to own her own grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her family

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs Yin S. L. is 26 and lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia. She sells clothes near a factory. Her husband is a security guard. They have 3 children. 
Mrs Yin S. L. wants to purchase clothes to expand the inventory in her store. In the future she would like to open a bigger shop. In the picture, we can see her three children.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her clothing store

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs Ban L. is 39 and lives in Phnom Penh, in Cambodia. She takes care of her 5 children. Her husband is a securty guard.  He earns 3 dollars a day.
Mrs Ban L. would like to purchase  a motorbike for her husband who works far from their house. In the future, she would like to sell fruit. In the picture you can see Mrs Ban L. with three of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Ban Leap has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mr. Sang C. is 27 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with his wife (pictured here) and their 2 young children.  He and his wife both work at a hotel.  Together, they earn about $9/day.  This loan will be used for Mr. Sang to repair the leaks in his home in time for the coming rainy season.

loans.use: To repair his family's home

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sang Chunkea start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs Meas S. is 45 and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a construction worker and earns 2 dollars a day. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns 5 dollars a day. They have 4 children. Two of them are still students. They need to repair their house that leaks during the rainy season. In the future, they would like to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To repair her house which leaks during the rainy season

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S. is 22 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband.  Her husband earns $5/day working as a construction foreman.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Sang S. to purchase construction tools so her husband can expand his business.  He will be able to take on larger projects and hire more workers if he has these additional tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sang Samban start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs Ly N. is a widow of 46 years old. She lives in Phnom Penh and has four children. She earns 2 dollars a day and has to take care of her children alone. She would like to purchase a motorbike to go to work because her workplace is far from her house and it is expensive to go there everyday.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to go to work.

loans.name: Luth

texts.en: Mrs. Luth L. is 40 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home of the Angkor Wat temple.  Siem Reap has many tourists passing through, and Mrs. Luth L. has started a business buying and selling souvenirs.  She can earn about $2/day in this business, and her husband earns $2.5/day working in construction.  Together, the couple has 5 children to support.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Luth L. to purchase more souvenirs for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenir products for her tourist business

loans.name: Charoen

texts.en: Mrs Charoen C. is 33 and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a garment worker and her husband is a gardener. Together they earn about 7 dollars a day. They have 3 children. She would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband who works far from their home. In the future, they would like to sell vegetables at the market.

loans.use: to puchase a motorbike

loans.name: Umri

texts.en:
Umri started her business over 8 years ago. She is married and has three children. All of them help Umri in her activity.

From the beginning Umri baked her products herself. She baked pirogue, cakes, pastries, fancy cakes and so on. Her two daughters baked confectionery with their mother. Her son helped to bring her product to the market. Umri concluded an agreement with several food shops to sell her goods there. Gradually, she was able to save enough money to have her own stall in the confectionery section in Panjshanbe market. Today, Umri's stall has become one of the best known places in the market. She has a lot of clients who come back to her over and over. She sells her products in a short time and so has a fast turnover of her working capital.

Umri became a client of Micro Invest in May 2007. Her first loan was about USD 300, which she spent to purchase 2 sacks of flour. She hopes to spend this second loan from KIVA investors to rent another refrigerated case to display her baked goods.

loans.use: Renting another refrigerated display case for her baked goods

loans.name: Muyasar

texts.en:
H. Muyasar has been engaged in business since 1996. She is married and has 2 children. Her place of business is located on the first floor of Panjshanbe market.

Muaysar receives her products from chicken farms; she gets in about 4800 eggs every three days. She sells the eggs quickly, because her place is always very popular but her real problem at the moment is the condition of her sales area. She crushes about 100 eggs here every day.

H. wants to rent a stall in the corner of the market, where she would be able to sell her eggs without losses. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 900.

loans.use: Renting a stall to sell her eggs from

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio A. produces chipa, a very popular, typical snack in Paraguay. It is a very common type of corn bread sold in the streets, where vendors carry large baskets of chipa all day long, selling it on the streets and buses.

Rogelio is 57 years old, married, and has 5 children. The oldest son is 38 years old and the youngest is 17. Rogelio works Mondays through Fridays starting at 7 in the morning. He spends four hours every morning baking chipas, taking 25 minutes to complete each batch. He works behind his house where he has a large brick oven that he uses to bake the chipas.

Rogelio started his chipas business 20 years ago. At first, he bought the chipas from other people and sold them on the streets. Now his family helps him by selling the chipas in the streets after he finishes making them. They travel by bus an hour and half to Asuncion to sell their chipas.

Rogelio needs a loan of US$100 to buy more cheese and milk in large quantities to produce the chipas.

loans.use: Purchase cheese and milk in large quantities.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina L. is 75 years old and a widow. She has 6 children, one of whom still lives with her. Two of them live in other cities in Paraguay and 2 in Spain. It has been 16 years since she began her business. In her small store, she sells mostly domestic and food products such as bread, wine, empanadas (a typical fast food) and oil. Her small store is actually part of her house that she has converted to start her business. It is located directly in the entrance of her house. Most of her products are sold to neighbours.

Rosalina is currently recovering from an leg injury after falling down a few steps. She needs a loan of US$400 to buy more merchandise in large quantities to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more food products like oil, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and flour

loans.name: Pelgia

texts.es:
Ms. Pelagia P. Z., a thirty-year-old entrepreneur, has lived as a couple with Isabelino Amarillo, age 41, for the past 16 years. They have a 15-year-old son who attends a public school. Mrs. Pelagia is a beautician, and she has already formed a good clientele. In addition, about a year and a half ago, she opened a small poultry and hog operation next to her beauty shop, which is growing thanks to her effort and dedication. At the same time, she is putting together a vegetable patch on the same farm, owned by her mother-in-law. The requested loan will be used for the purchase of 150 chickens and 6 hogs.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Doña Pelagia P. Z., una emprendedora de 30 años, vive en pareja con Isabaelino Amarilla, de 41, desde hace 16 años y tienen un hijo de 15 que estudia en una Escuela Pública. La Sra. Pelagia es peluquera, cuenta con una buena clientela formada. Además hace aproximadamente un año y medio, abrió una pequeña despensa junto a su peluquería, que con el esfuerzo y dedicación va creciendo su negocio. Al mismo tiempo, está formando una huerta en la misma granja propiedad de su suegra. El crédito solicitado será utilizado para la compra de 150 Pollos y 6 cerdos.

loans.use: To buy 150 chickens and 6 hogs

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Gonzales, 55 years old, separated from her husband, has four children of which only one who is 14 years old lives with her and is in high school, the other children are already independent. Some years ago she had a well equipped hairdresser's shop, which she sold to go to Buenos Aires, Argentina, in search of better working conditions and to elevate her level of life. She did not complete her expectations and returned to her city, San Ignacio, to exert once more the work she had done before. Her business functions in her own home and the loan will be destined for the purchase of modern hairdressing equipment.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María G. de 55 años, separada de su marido, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales sólo una de 14 años vive con ella y que está cursando la secundaria, los demás hijos ya son independientes. Unos años atrás tenía una peluquería bien equipada, la que vendió para ir a Buenos Aires, Argentina, en busca de mejores condiciones laborales y elevar su nivel de vida. No se cumplió sus expectativas y volvió a su ciudad, San Ignacio, a ejercer nuevamente la labor que realizaba anteriormente. Su negocio funciona en su mismo domicilio y el crédito destinará para la compra de un moderno equipo de peluquería.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdressing equipment - Compra de equipos de peluquería

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. María R. is 52 years old, and she is separated from her husband. She has 7 children, of whom only two still live with her, one age 18 and one age 14. They attend a public high school in the city. María tells us that they are very dedicated to their studies and are excellent students.

María is the owner of a grocery store which is located in her own home, and with her effort and dedication it is growing from day to day. She wishes to diversify her merchandise, so the requested loan will be used to purchase footwear to sell, which will be a long-term investment.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La Sra. María R. tiene 52 años, está separada del marido y tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales sólo dos viven con ella, una de 18 años y otra de 14 que están estudiando en un colegio público de la ciudad; María nos cuenta que ellas son muy dedicadas a sus estudios y excelentes alumnas.

María es dueña de una despensa que está ubicada en su propia casa, la que con esfuerzo y dedicación hace crecer día a día. Desea diversificar su mercadería por lo que el crédito solicitado destinará a la compra de calzados para la venta, la que será una inversión a largo plazo.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Mr. Edgar B. is 30 years old and lives with his common-law wife. He doesn't own his own home, but lives in a rented house. He has two children ages 2 and 4. For the past 10 years he has been building a career that enables him to support his family. As a mechanic, he has a workshop where he dedicates himself to the repair of motorcycles, a profession which he first learned as an apprentice and later through courses and certifications. In order to maintain a stock and offer good service to his clients, he will use the requested loan to buy spare parts and accessories.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor Edgar B. de 30 años vive en pareja, no posee casa propia por lo que vive en casa alquilada, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 4 años. Desde hace 10 años desarrolla una actividad que le permite mantener a su familia. Como mecánico tiene un taller donde se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas; profesión que aprendió como ayudante y luego realizó cursos y capacitaciones. A los efectos de mantener un stock y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el crédito solicitado lo utilizará para la compra de repuestos y accesorios.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
Mr. Adelio C. is 44 years old. He is married to Mrs. Julia Bordón, 43, and they have 5 children. The oldest daughter, age 20, lives and works in Asunción; one of their children, age 18, lives with his parents and works in a workshop plating and painting cars. The youngest of their children is 3 years old, and the rest are adolescents who live with their parents and attend public schools. Mr. Adelio is a construction worker, but because he is not finding much work, right now he is working as a vendor selling notions like fashion accessories, scarves, handkerchiefs, and gloves, which he buys in Encarnación in order to get a better price. This loan will be used to diversify his merchandise and in that way increase his income and improve the quality of life for his family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. Adelio C. de 44 años de edad está casado con la Sra. Julia Bordón de 43 y tienen 5 hijos. La hija mayor, de 20 años, vive y trabaja en Asunción; uno de sus hijos, de 18 años, vive con sus padres y trabaja en un taller de chapería y pintura de automóviles. El más pequeño de los hijos tiene 3 años y los dos restantes son adolescentes que viven con sus padres y estudian en colegios públicos. El Sr. Adelio es constructor de obras, pero como no consigue mucho trabajo en ese ramo se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos de mercería como bijouterie, bufandas, pañuelos, guantes que los compra en Encarnación porque obtiene a mejor precio. El crédito destinará a diversificar sus mercaderías y así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy fashion accessories, scarves, handkerchiefs, and gloves

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia Z. works making and selling ice creams at the 16th of July Fair in the city of El Alto. As a creator of the famous "tocinillios" (homemade ice creams), Ms. Julia says that it's been over 10 years that she has dedicated herself to this business, which helped her to get by as a single mother to 4 children.

Today, Julia is grandmother to two children who live with her, along with two of her younger children, who also work in her business. Her principal objective is to establish a branch in the city of Cochabamba, where there exists an important market due to the climate and access to ingredients.

At the moment, Julia needs capital in order to supply herself with ingredients that come from Cochabamba, which she will use to prepare the ice creams she will sell at parades and gatherings for the next national holiday.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Julia Z., se dedica a la fabricación y venta de helados en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto; precursora de los famosos “tocinillos” (helados caseros), la señora Julia cuenta que son más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, mismo que le permitió salir adelante sola y con sus 4 hijos.

En la actualidad, Julia es abuela de dos nietos que viven con ella y con dos de sus hijos menores, dedicados al mismo negocio. Su principal objetivo es el establecimiento de una sucursal en la ciudad de Cochabamba donde existe un importante mercado por las condiciones climáticas y el acceso a la materia prima.

Por el momento, Julia necesita de capital para poder abastecerse de materia prima procedente de Cochabamba, para preparar la venta de sus helados en los desfiles y concentraciones a raíz de la proximidad de las fiestas patrias.

loans.use: Julia needs capital in order to supply herself with the ingredients she needs to make her ice creams.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela Ayllón, married, with two school-age children, lives in the Villa Adela neighborhood, where she works making pastries and "salteñas" (dumplings). To this end, she has installed a salteña shop in her home, with the help of a micro-loan from Pro Mujer.

For the past 6 years, Marcela has belonged to the Villa Adela association. Thanks to the last loan from Pro Mujer, she was able to buy the necessary supplies and an industrial oven, with which she was able to substantially increase her income.

At present, Marcela needs an investment to implement traveling employees, with the aim of expanding her business, establishing herself in the market, and assuring the basic necessities for the education of her children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Marcela Ayllón, casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar, vive en la zona de Villa Adela, donde se dedica a la repostería y la elaboración de salteñas. Para este fin, ha instalado una salteñería en su mismo domicilio con la ayuda de un microcrédito de Pro Mujer.

Con una antigüedad de 6 años, Marcela, pertenece a la asociación Villa Adela, gracias al último crédito aprobado en Pro Mujer, pudo realizar la compra de insumos necesarios y un horno industrial con el cual ha mejorado sustancialmente sus ingresos.

En la actualidad Marcela precisa de una inversión para la implementación de dependientes ambulantes, con el fin de expandir su negocio, establecerse en el mercado y asegurar las necesidades principales de educación de sus dos hijos.

loans.use: Marcela will use the investment to implement traveling employees, with the aim of expanding her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline C. R. lives in the May 1st neighborhood in the city of El Alto. She is single and the mother of three children. She has had an internet café business, located in her house, for the past five years.

She began 10 years ago by selling household appliances in the July 16th Market. Two years later she joined Pro Mujer and got her first micro loan, with which she increased her amount of merchandise and her sales until she was able to save up a small amount of capital. Her continued association with Pro Mujer allowed her to open her internet business.

Due to the demand in her neighborhood, Jacqueline needs to invest in more computer equipment and furniture, with the goal of expanding her business to meet existing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jacqueline C. R., vive en la zona 1º de Mayo de la ciudad de El Alto, soltera, pero madre de tres hijos, hace 5 años es propietaria de una sala de Internet ubicada en su domicilio. Comenzó hace 10 años vendiendo electrodomésticos en la Feria 16 de Julio, dos años después ingresó a Pro Mujer, accediendo a su primer micro crédito con el cual incrementó su mercadería y sus ventas hasta lograr reunir un pequeño capital, que asociada a su continuidad en Pro Mujer le permite la apertura de una sala de Internet. Debido a la demanda de salas en su zona, Jacqueline necesita invertir para la compra de más equipos de computación y mobiliario con el fin de ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment and furniture to expand her internet cafe business

loans.name: Jhanina

texts.es:
Jhanina L. Murguía has been married for 12 years and is the mother of four. She hawks used clothing at the "16th of July" Market in El Alto. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for 6 years and currently serves as president of the Villa Adela chapter. A new law will soon prohibit the importation and sale of used clothing which means Jhanina urgently needs to liquidate her inventory. She needs capital to rent a stall in the market and hire people in order to speed up sales. In the meantime, Jhanina will be searching for a new line of business with which to support her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Jhanina L. Murguía, hace 6 años socia de Pro Mujer y presidenta de la asociación Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto, casada hace 12 años y madre de 4 hijos, tiene un puesto ambulante de venta de ropa usada en la Feria 16 de Julio de esta ciudad. Jhanina necesita de capital para comprar un puesto dentro del campo ferial que le permita una mejor venta de su mercadería, tomando en cuenta que por nuevas disposiciones gubernamentales se prohibirá la importación y comercio de la ropa usada. A tal efecto, Jhanina necesita capitalizarse para la compra de un puesto y la contratación de dependientes que agilicen la venta de toda su mercadería mientras ella se capacita para incursionar en nuevos rubros que le permitan obtener el sustento diario para su familia.

loans.use: To rent a market stall and hire salespeople.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yoland R. F. is a mother of 4 children. She is the leader of a ProMujer women's group named "Futuro," and she has a long-established credit history. She is dedicated to the production of recycled doors that she sells in the market in the "16 de julio" neighborhood of El Alto.

7 years ago, Yolanda started borrowing with ProMujer with a loan of just $100. She used her first loan to but materials and launch her business in Pacajes, an neighboring area of the city. She has her own space in the market, and with help from her husband she runs her business and works hard to sustain her family.

Yolanda needs capital to invest in her business and meet the demand that exists for her product. With the help of ProMujer, she is also working to put aside enough savings to purchase a piece of land to build her own house and enter into new lines of work.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

Yolanda R. F., madre de 4 hijos, es jefa de grupo de la asociación comunal Futuro, perteneciente a Pro Mujer, socia antigua que se dedica a la fabricación de puertas con material reciclado (turriles) en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto.

Hace ya 7 años Yolanda comenzó con un crédito de 100 $us, con el cual compro materiales para iniciar su negocio en la zona de Pacajes. En la actualidad tiene un puesto propio en la feria ya mencionada que con la ayuda de su concubino, administra y lleva adelante para el sustento de su familia.

Yolanda necesita de capital para invertir en su negocio y abastecer la demanda existente, de esta forma y con la ayuda de Pro Mujer, reunir un monto de ahorro que le permita comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa propia y la incursión en nuevos rubros de trabajo.

loans.use: Yolanda needs the capital to invest in her business and meet the demand for her services

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
This loan for Musu M. was orginally posted for $1050 with a default loan term of 1 month. The loan term should have been 12 months. SMT apologizes for this error. The loan was disbursed as scheduled and her first payment made. SMT is now reposting the loan for the balance of 11 months of the original term at $975. SMT appreciates your patience as we continue to provide microcredit services to the economically active poor of Sierra Leone.

Musu M., a 31 year old mother of four children is a very dynamic woman. Musu and her husband learned soap-making skills in one of the local skills training centers. She manages a soap production business with eight employees and her husband assists with selling the product in the remote villages of Sierra Leone. The soap is made out of palm oil, caustic soda and some colors. Musu can produce more than 2,000 pieces of soap a week and distributes them to retailers in various villages. It takes a week to complete the selling and then her husband collects the cash for another round of production. This means Musu has to wait for more than a week before she can produce more soap. Musu will use the loan funds for more raw materials to ensure flow of production without waiting for sales to be completed.

loans.use: purchase raw materials to make soap

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph T. is twenty-eight years old and determined to make his life better. A school drop-out, he managed to establish a small grocery wholesale shop in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone. With his innovative business, Joseph has enabled many petty traders, specifically women who have little business capital, to buy items for resale such as tomato paste, onions, and peanuts within the town without traveling to Freetown or faraway villages. Many of the women appreciate his fair, good service that has saved them time and money.

Joseph would like to be able to provide his services to more vendors and therefore is requesting for a loan of $1050. This will enable him to import goods from Guinea which are cheaper than those from Freetown.

Joseph has been a good example to other youth that one can succeed through hard work and self-employment. He was also recently made the Assistant Head of the Traders Union, based his outstanding business and leadership skills.

loans.use: Increase  the inventory of grocery items he sells wholesale

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha is single and has three children: a 16-year-old son and two 13-year-old daughters. They have been the main reason that she began to sell food four years ago. She has never had anyone’s help supporting her children, and she started her business to be able to give them a better quality of life and a good education. Little by little, her clientele grew, and now she has a small restaurant in her home.

Martha prepares specialty meals and roast chickens. The high quality of her products has caused the business to grow quickly. She is now asking for a $375 loan to purchase ingredients to increase her production and meet the demand of her clients. She will pay the loan back in 6 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Support them. They will greatly appreciate it.

Martha es soltera y tiene tres hijos, uno de 16 años y dos mujeres de 13 años de edad, ellos han sido el principal motivo para iniciar con la venta de comidas hace cuatro años, nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación empezó su negocio, poco a poco fueron incrementándose sus clientes y ahora ya tiene un pequeño restaurante ubicado en su propio domicilio.

Martha elabora comidas especiales y pollos asados, la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece le han permitido crecer rápidamente, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos con lo que espera incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients

Compra de insumos

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
Maria Salome is married and has a young daughter. Her husband has a manual labor job, but his wages are very low and are not able to cover the family’s basic needs. To earn an extra income, Maria decided to begin working. She started as a kitchen helper, and a short time later, and with more experience and her savings, she started up her own business selling hamburgers, tamales and other foods. This business has flourished due to her good work.

The love she has for her daughter and her faithful commitment to her husband push her everyday to improve and expand her business. Maria is asking for a $200 loan which she will use to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes. She will pay the loan back in 3 months. Support Maria, she will greatly appreciate the opportunity you give her to keep expanding her business and improve the life of her family.

Maria Salome es casada y tiene una pequeña hija, su esposo trabaja como obrero pero su salario es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra Maria decidió comenzar a trabajar, inició como ayudante de cocina y poco después con la experiencia y los ahorros que pudo acumular empezó su propio negocio con la venta de hamburguesas, tamales y comidas, en donde ha logrado prosperar gracias al buen trabajo que realiza.

El gran amor que siente hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso que tiene con su esposo son lo que la motiva día a día a mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus comidas, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Maria, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le das de continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la vida de su familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients

Compra de insumos

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia is the mother of three children, ages 9, 11, and 15. She’s married and lives in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. When her oldest son began the secondary level of school, the cost of the school fees went up, making it very difficult to cover all the expenses with her husbands wages alone.
