This was why, three years ago, Silvia started up her business selling tostadas, tacos and soups from her home. Not long ago she was able to open a restaurant, causing business to grow faster.

Silvia would like to provide a better service to her customers to make sure they keep coming back. She is asking for a $200 loan so that she could buy furniture to make her business more comfortable. She will pay the loan back in 3 months. Play a key role in the growth of this business. Silvia and her family truly appreciate it.

Silvia tiene tres hijos, de 9, 11 y 15 años de edad, es casada y viven en la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Cuando su hijo mayor comenzó la secundaria los costos de las colegiaturas se incrementaron y fue muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos sólo con el salario de su esposo, esta fue la razón por la que hace tres años Silvia inició su negocio con la venta de tostadas, tacos y caldos, comenzó en su propio domicilio y hace poco logró abrir un local en el que ha hecho crecer su negocio más rápidamente.

Silvia busca ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y seguir contando con su preferencia para lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de muebles para acondicionar mejor su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Silvia y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use:
Remodeling

Remodelación

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is a very hard-working and responsible man. He started helping a relative in his auto painting and repair shop when he was very young; thanks to the experience he acquired for 20 years he open his own repair shop. He is married and he has two children who are 15 and 17 years old. He gets the resources needed to support his family from this business. Now, his children help him, together they have managed to improve the quality of service that they offer and increase the number of clients.

José wants to give a new push to his business to keep on growing, for this reason he needs a loan of $475 that he will use to buy car oil, additives, and spark plugs that he will be able to commercialize in his repair shop. He promises to repay the loan in 6 months. José is sincerely grateful for the opportunity that you offer to him. He will be able to improve his business and the life of his family with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

José es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, comenzó desde muy joven ayudándole a un familiar en su taller mecánico y de pintura automotriz, gracias la al experiencia que adquirió desde hace 20 años abrió su propio taller , él es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 15 y 17 años de edad, de este negocio es donde obtiene los recursos que necesita su familia, ahora recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, juntos han logrado mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrecen e incrementar sus clientes.

José desea darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio y continuar creciendo para esto necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de aditivos para autos, aceites y bujías que podrá comercializar en su taller, el ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. José agradece sinceramente la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda de mejorar su negocio y la vida de su familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: José Socorro

texts.es:
José Socorro is married and he has two children, age 22 and 33. The lack of employment in the country made it difficult for José to find a job, therefore he decided to begin selling toasts and snacks in his own house. Due to the demand of his clients he started selling grocery products and little by little he has manage to make his business grow. Now he store is better stocked and with the help of his wife and an employee have managed to improve the quality of the service that they offer. In order to increase to the variety of products that they offer, José is requesting a loan of $650 that he will use to buy merchandise, he promises to repay the loan in 6 months. You can be an important part in the development of this business. Don’t hesitate and help this family, they are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

José Socorro es casado y tiene dos hijos de 22 y 33 años de edad, la falta de empleo en el país dificultó mucho que José consiguiera un trabajo, por lo que decidió comenzar con las ventas de tostadas y botanas en su propio domicilio, ante la demanda de sus clientes fue incorporando la venta de productos de abarrotes y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio, ahora tiene un mejor surtido y con la ayuda de su esposa y un empleado han logrado mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrecen. Para incrementar al variedad de productos que ofrecen José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is married and has four children, they are natives of the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. Her husband is a city bus driver, nevertheless, the salary that he was earning wasn’t covering the basic needs of her family. In order to improve the quality of life of her family Beatriz started her own dressmaking shop, she learned this occupation very well studying dressmaking and fashion. The good quality of her service has allowed her to grow with her business and to increase the number of clients.

Beatriz wants to keep on growing with her business and she wants to make the most of the school starting classes soon to make school uniforms, therefore she is asking for a loan of $475 that she will use to buy fabrics and material that she needs. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Be an important of this business and help Beatriz, she and her family will be very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, ellos son originarios de la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es chofer de un autobús urbano, sin embargo, el salario que recibe no cubría las necesidades básicas de su familia y para mejora la calidad de vida de su familia Beatriz inició su propio taller de costura, oficio que aprendió muy bien al estudiar confección y modas, la buena calidad del servicio que ofrece le ha permitido crecer con su negocio e incrementar su número de clientes.

Beatriz desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y aprovechando que está próximo el regreso a clases quiere comenzar con la elaboración de uniformes escolares por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de telas y el material que necesita, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a Beatriz, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa C. has owned a grocery store located in Ciudadela Ferroviaria de Alto Pura Pura in the city of La Paz for the past 16 years. She lives with her husband and her two children in the home of her in-laws. She has been an associate of Pro Mujer for 3 years, which has allowed her the resources to provide goods for her business.

Felipa would like to establish a new business with her brother, dedicated to raising pigs and the construction of a farm in the region of Sorata.

In order to do so, she needs a loan to increase the variety of merchandise in her grocery store. By having this new merchandise, she will be able to increase her savings and build the capital necessary to realize her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 16 años es propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en la Ciudadela Ferroviaria de Alto Pura Pura en la ciudad de La Paz. Felipa C., vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus suegros. Es socia de Pro Mujer hace tres años, lo que le permite contar con recursos para proveer su negocio con mercadería.

Felipa desea consolidar una sociedad con su hermano para dedicarse a la cría de ganado porcino y la construcción de una granja en la región de Sorata.

Para este fin precisa un crédito para incrementar la variedad de mercadería en su tienda de abarrotes, de esta manera y a través del ahorro juntar un importante capital para la concreción de la sociedad ya mencionada.

loans.use: Felipa would like to develop a new business raising pigs, and build a farm.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Despite the intense cold, the treasurer of the Association of the Communal Union of Work and Progress leaves her house very early to install shelves and counters at her stand in the fair in El Alto. It is a very well-known position, she is one of the most dedicated to the sales of items for babies. Olga Flora Solis, a long-time associate in Pro Mujer, was at first more focused on plastics sales, but due to the competition and the costs that that business involved, she decided to change to a different field and dedicate herself to the sales of baby walkers, strollers, cradles, and other various baby products.

At present, she needs a larger investment in order to achieve her main goal, the opening of another sales stand during the fair that will help her business to expand. This growth will allow her to improve her quality of life and pay for basic necessities for her home, and also ensure that her children will be able to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

A pesar del intenso frío la Tesorera de la Asociación Comunal Unión Progreso y Trabajo, sale de su casa muy temprano para instalar los estantes y mostradores de su puesto en la Feria de El Alto. Un puesto muy conocido por ser uno de los más grandes dedicados a la venta de artículos de bebé. Olga Flora Solís, socia antigua en Pro Mujer, a un principio se dedicaba a la venta de artículos de plástico, pero a raíz de la competencia y los costos que este negocio representaba, decidió cambiar de rubro y dedicarse a la venta de andadores, cochecitos, cunas y otros.

Actualmente precisa una mayor inversión para ejecutar su principal objetivo, la apertura de otro puesto de venta dentro de la feria, que reditúe y permita mejorar su calidad de vida y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurando la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Olga needs a larger investment in oder to open another stand in the fair, which will increase her productivity and allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro lives in his own home in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz with his wife, Angelica Condori and their 7 and 10 year-old children. Teodoro is employed as a janitor by the municipal government of the city of La Paz and his wife works selling fish from a street cart. With their past loans they were able to build two rooms and a bathroom on their home that they are able to use, but those rooms do not offer them the comfort or convenience that they need. This loan would be dedicated to the construction of two new rooms that would improve the living conditions of their family. Their past experiences with Impro have proved them to be preferential clients and prove their ability to access new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Teodoro vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, Angélica Condori y sus hijos de 7 y 10 años; Teodoro es empleado barrendero en la empresa municipal de aseo de la Alcaldía de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende pescado en un puesto de venta ambulante. Con créditos anteriores en Impro construyeron dos habitaciones y un baño que actualmente ocupan, pero que no les brinda la comodidad necesaria, por ello el préstamo solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones nuevas que mejoraran las condiciones de hábitat de la familia. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Construction on his home

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.en:
Zenobia H. lives in Ayacucho, Peru, with her three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling groceries and household necessities. She opened her store about 5 years ago, and has had a growing client base ever since. This small business has become even more important in the last two years, when her husband abandoned her for another woman, leaving Zenobia as the sole provider for her family. Nevertheless, she has prioritized education for her children, making sure all three attend school.

Prior to her initial loan with FINCA Peru, granted 5 years ago, Zenobia spent over 2 hours a day commuting to and from the central market, where she operated a small fruit kiosk. Her first “préstamo” or loan allowed her to purchase the storefront that she now occupies. It is much closer to her home, and she is able to spend less time on a crowded bus and more time with her children.

Zenobia says that in her Village Bank she has learned not only financial management, but also the importance of punctuality and responsibility. Zenobia hopes to receive US$500 for her next loan, and plans to use the money to purchase a small refrigerator, so she can sell cold drinks during the summer.

loans.use: Zenobia hopes to receive US$500 for her next loan, and plans to use the money to purchase a small refrigerator, so she can sell cold drinks during the summer.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.en:
Andres B., 54, is married, with 5 children, one of whom died 4 years ago. He works every day producing chipas, a common street cornbread snack in Paraguay. He dedicates the time from 1 am to 4 am to make the chipas. He makes 20 kilo of chipas per day, about 400 chipas.

His wife and one of his daughters, aged 26, travels to Asuncion on an hour and half bus ride every morning to sell the chipas after Andres finishes baking the chipas.

Andres and his youngest daughter are shown in the photo. His wife is not in the photo because she is in Asuncion with her other daughter selling the chipas. Andres is requesting a $200 loan to buy more ingredients in larger quantities in order to keep his costs low. He needs to buy almidón, which is an essential ingredient to make chipas, cheese, and eggs.

Andres is member of a committee of men and women. This group lending system allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of almidón, cheese, and eggs.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina M. D. P., 47, is married and the mother of four children, aged 23, 20, 15, and 10. Delfina runs a small grocery store next to a very busy road. When her children are not in school, they also help her at the store.

Delfina started her business two years ago. Before starting her grocery store, she had a business where she sold meat. But due to high rental and transport costs, Delfina decided to open a grocery store located closer to her house. She works everyday from 6 am until 8 pm, closing later in the summer. Delfina is requesting a $200 loan to restock her inventory, particularly the items in highest demand: wine, milk, and bread.

In addition to her grocery store, Delfina also lends out money. She lends small amounts without charging interest, and only to people she knows very well. She lends to about 7 people per month.

Delfina is member of a committee of women. This group lending allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase wine, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira G. is 32 years old and has 3 children, ages 14, 12, and 2. She helps her mother, 74, run her small grocery store located at their house. They sell products such as wine, beer, pasta, bread, and household products. Most of the customers are neighbours. Elvira’s children also help out with the store. They started this business over 20 years ago.

Aside from the small store, Elvira also sells chipas, a type of cornbread street snack. Elvira only makes and sells the chipas on Sundays and at soccer games. Elvira is requesting a $250 loan to resupply her store and buy more products such as beer, which is the highest demanded product.

Elvira is member of a committee of women. This group lending allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase beer and wine.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda M. de Morales is 48 years old, married and the mother of 11 children, 5 of whom still live with her. She produces chipas, a very popular cornbread street snack in Paraguay. She produces about 200 chipas per day, but more during the colder season. She spends from 2 am to 7 am baking the chipas in a large brick oven behind her house. She can produce about 18-20 chipas on each tray.

Her husband is 51 years old and is a part-time taxi driver who also helps Hilda in her chipa business. After producing the chipas each day, both Hilda, her husband, and two of their sons, aged 22 and 13, travel to Asuncion to sell the chipas. They usually work until 8 in the evening.

Hilda is requesting a $250 loan to buy more ingredients, such as grated corn and cheese, from a store close to her house in order to make more chipas to sell.

Hilda is member of a committee of women. This group lending allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase grated corn and cheese

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.en:
Juan Ramon Garcia is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. His children are aged 13, 12 and 1. His wife is a pharmacist. Juan has been a shoemaker for 15 years. He initially worked for someone else and later started his own business 5 years ago. He works from Monday to Saturday from 7 am to 6 pm. Every day on average he makes and sells about 4 pairs of shoes. He makes formal leather dress shoes for men, women, and children. His customers mostly are employees and official workers from near-by towns.

Juan owns a small store that is just large enough to display a few of his shoes. Also, he makes his shoes at his store. Juan is requesting a $200 loan to buy more leather material to produce more shoes to sell at his store.

loans.use: Purchase leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.en:
Ladislao Cespesdes, 45, is married to Marta Rojas. They make and sell chipas, a very popular type of corn bread in Paraguay. They work 3 days a week and have been running their chipas business for 38 years now. They spend the mornings from 7 am until 12 pm making the chipas in the large brick oven they have outside of their house. Then Ladislao, Marta, and their 7 children all help in selling the chipas. They travel to Asuncion carrying their baskets filled with chipas to sell in the streets and on buses until they sell all the chipas, usually lasting until 7 pm. They make about 12 kilos of chipa everytime, which is about 320 chipas.

On the days that they are not working, Ladislao goes fishing that he uses for food for the family. The couple is seeking a $300 loan to buy more supplies to make chipas, such as cheese, milk, and eggs. They are also considering investing in a new oven.

Ladislao is also a member of a commitee for men and women. He is part of a group lending system where members provide collateral though a group repayment pledge and the incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members will be responsible for making up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, milk, eggs and a new oven.

loans.name: María Alcira

texts.en:
Maria F. is a 25 year old mother of 1 child, Patty, aged 10. María is a very hard worker. She runs a hairdressing salon that is open from 7 am until 10 pm everyday. Maria started as a hairdresser at a very young age. At first, she worked for a hairdresser down the street from where she lives before she started her own business. The number of clients per day may range from 5 to 15, with Saturdays as her busiest day of the week.

Aside from the hairdresser store, Maria also owns a small ice cream store that is attached to the hairdresser store. She converted the small space into an ice cream store about 1 year ago. Maria's business is basically a two-person operated business. When Maria is working in the hairdresser store, her older sister, Laura, watches over the ice cream store, and when Maria is over at the ice cream store, Laura works in the hairdresser store.

Maria's ice cream store and hair salon are very simple, and only contain the bare necessities to provide their services. Maria is requesting this $400 loan to purchase more hair products, including shampoo and conditioner, in order to continue the operation of her services.

loans.use: Purchase shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.en:
Maria Graciela C., 28, has a 6-year old daughter and 10-year old son. She owns a small kiosk located on the side of a busy road. She started her business 8 years ago. She sells fast food in her kiosk, mostly hamburgers, beer, and empanadas.

Her kiosk is only open from 5 in the afternoon until 4 in the morning. It is not opened during the day because it is not as busy. Most of her clients are from the university across the street, UTIC, and also truck drivers that pass by.

Maria is requesting a $150 loan to purchase more food supplies to run her business. She spends every afternoon replenishing her kitchen and purchasing products for that night. She buys mostly hamburger patties and buns.

Maria is member of a committee of women. This group lending allows members to guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group fails to repay their loan, the other group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase meat for hamburgers

loans.name: Yola América

texts.en:
7 ½ years ago, América C. Garcia started cooking and selling hamburgers in Ayacucho, Peru, to supplement her husband’s income and help support their 3 children. She was granted her first loan with FINCA Peru five years ago, and has been a model banker ever since. She cherishes the opportunity for conversation with friends at her weekly meetings, as well as the health, social, and economic lessons that are incorporated into each.

With the seed money loaned to her, América was able to expand her business, and began also selling beverages. A few years ago her husband joined her to help with the expanding business. What was once a small hamburger cart has expanded into a bustling, two-room restaurant with 14 tables. Now that América has so much more space, she would like to use the money from her next loan to make small repairs and improvements to her restaurant, such as fixing a broken door adjoining the two dining rooms.

loans.use: Yola would like to use the money from her next loan to make small repairs and improvements to her restaurant, such as fixing a broken door adjoining the two dining rooms.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and has four children. Her husband is electrician and his income is not sufficient to cover all the household expenditures. Faced with the need of an extra income to pay the studies of her children and improve their quality of life, Yolanda began selling second-hand clothes. She begun with the well preserved clothes that her family and friends did not use anymore and, noting she could make some money, she bought more goods and has been pretty successful so far.

To increase her sales, Yolanda now needs a $ 275 loan she plans to use buying clothes in bigger quantity to proviD. a better price to her clients. She pledges to reimburse this amount in 6 months. Yolanda and her family will be very grateful for your trust and the increase of their business.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Su esposo es electricista y su ingreso no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos D. su hogar. Ante la necesidad D. obtener un ingreso extra para pagar los estudios D. sus hijos y mejorar su calidad D. vida, Yolanda comenzó a vender ropa usada. Inició con la ropa en buen estado que ya no usaban sus hijos y sus familiares y ,al observar que tenía buenas ganancias, continuó su negocio comprando más mercancía. Ha tenido muy buenos resultados.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas, Yolanda ahora solicita un préstamo D. $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra D. ropa al mayoreo para ofrecer un mejor precio a sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia. Ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Yolanda y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo al crecimiento D. este negocio.

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel is married and has two children aged 24 and 26. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard to find a job and he thus began to help his mother-in-law selling clothes. He soon afterwards began his own business selling clothes and groceries on local markets. Fortunately, he made good sales and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides.

Miguel now needs a $ 250 loan he will use to buy goods to respond to his customers’ demand. He promises to reimburse this loan in 3 months. Miguel is very thankful to you to help him improve his service and the quality of life of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel Ángel es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 24 y 26 años de edad. Ante la falta de empleo que hay en el país le fue muy difícil conseguir un trabajo por lo que empezó a ayudarle a su suegra con la venta de ropa. Poco después inició su propio negocio en los mercados rodantes donde vende ropa y abarrotes. Afortunadamente ha tenido buenos resultados y ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que vende y al buen servicio que ofrece.

Ahora Miguel necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía con la que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. El se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en tres meses. Miguel agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Buy goods to sell on local markets

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia C. de Lozano is 70 years old, and lives in Ayacucho, Peru. She owns a small corner shop next to her home, and sells “bebidas,” or drinks, such as soda pop, beer, and bottled water. She established her business 27 years ago, to supplement her husband’s income. Her clients consist of people in her neighborhood, who know her as a reliable source for their beverages.

While she runs a successful business now, life has not been easy for Celia. She and her husband had 11 children, 3 of whom died. Furthermore, 21 years ago, her husband abandoned her for another woman, and Celia had to support her 8 remaining children by herself.

Celia´s first loan was for US $50, which she paid back $5 a week. This small amount allowed her to expand her product line, and now, in addition to drinks, she is able to sell candles for church service on Fridays and Sundays. She says that saving money informally in her house is very difficult, but in her Village Bank, Celia has established a savings account where she feels her money is safe. She plans on using her next loan to purchase another type of soda to add to her inventory.

loans.use: Celia plans on using her next loan to purchase another type of soda to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Jesús Alejandro

texts.es:
Jesús Alejandro is married and lives in Monterrey, Nuevo León. His brother-in-law had a small shoe business where Jesús learned how to repair shoes. He was afterwards left unemployed and decided to begin his own business providing this service. His work was increasingly recognized and he enlarged his number of clients thanks to the pleasure he takes doing this job and his willingness to improve his family’s situation.

To keep developing his affair, Jesús needs a $ 150 credit that he will use to buy tools he needs to improve the quality of his work. He promises to give back this money within 3 months. It is a good moment to help someone who needs it, Jesús will be very grateful to you to be given an opportunity to increase and improve his small business.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús Alejandro es casado y vive en Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su cuñado tenía un negocio de zapatería, donde él aprendió la reparación de calzado. Después, al quedarse sin trabajo, decidió comenzar su propio negocio ofreciendo este servicio. Poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y ha incrementado sus clientes gracias al gusto que siente por este oficio y sus deseos de salir adelante con su familia.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, Jesús necesita un préstamo de $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta que requiere para hacer reparaciones de mejor calidad. El se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Jesús agradece sinceramente la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy tools for shoe repair

loans.name: Sandra Alina

texts.en:
Sandra C. lives in Ayacucho, Peru, with her husband and two children. Since 2001, she has operated a small business selling cosmetic products from her home. Five years ago, Sandra was given a small loan of US $50 by FINCA Peru, which she used to expand her product line and grow her business. She paid the loan back $5 per week, using a portion of the profits from her business. Sandra now is able to sell a wide variety of beauty products, such as hand cream and shampoo, to her friends and neighbors.

Sandra is thankful to her Village Bank not just for the seed money to grow her business, but also for the savings program that has enabled her to put money away for the education of her children, as well as plan for future uncertainties. Sandra very much looks forward to her weekly banking meetings. She says that the “reuniones” are not only a time to manage her finances, but also considers them a form of therapy, in that she has the opportunity to socialize with friends and talk about their lives.

When Sandra receives her next loan, she plans to use the money to further expand her product line, and well as purchase a small amount of back-up inventory of her most popular products in the event she sells out.

loans.use: Sandra plans to use the money to further expand her product line, and well as purchase a small amount of back-up inventory of her most popular products in the event she sells out.

loans.name: Maria De  Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes is a single mother with four children aged 11, 12, 15 and 17. For them, she began her own business selling cosmetics. She began selling her products to her friends and family but she quickly gained new clients and she now has a large group of customers. Maria has had to make efforts to maintain her family but the comfort of her children is her motivation on a day to day basis.

To sustain increasing demand from her clients, Maria is asking for a $ 150 credit to buy products and she pledges to give this sum back in 3 months. It is important for her family as this will help Maria to increase her sales and improve overall quality of life.

Translated from spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Lourdes es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, de 11, 12, 15 y 17 años de edad, ellos fueron el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos. Comenzó vendiendo sus productos entre sus conocidos y familiares pero pronto fue ganando más clientes y ahora tiene una extensa cartera. Maria ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, pero el bienestar de sus hijos es lo que la impulsa a continuar día a día.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Maria está solicitando un crédito de $ 150 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Es importante en la vida de esta familia ayudando Maria a mejorar su calidad de vida y contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang K. N. is 29 years old and a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Leang stays at home, cooking meals and looking after her children, who are too young to attend school. Her husband, 28 years old, is the one who manages and provides for the family’s needs by working as a motor-taxi driver. However, he only earns about US$5 a day. 
To earn more income, Leang's husband would like to purchase and operate a tuk-tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motorcycle). The couple is therefore asking for a loan of US$550.

loans.use: Purchase of a passenger cart to operate a tuk tuk

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run R. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She is a housewife and a mother of 3 children. To cover the family’s expenses, her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and typically earns around US$5 a day. Run R. and her husband would like to make more income by breeding pigs and growing various vegetables in the small plot of land that they own. They are therefore requesting a loan of US$600 and are thanking all the lenders for their trust and support.

The picture features two of Run R.'s children.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and seeds for farming

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch L. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She has 8 children – 4 of whom are construction workers and the rest of whom are students. To cover all the famiL.’s expenses, Touch L. sells grocery products to the people in her community where she can typicalL. earn up to $10 each day. Moreover, her husband is a motor-taxi driver and makes an average of $5 to $6 each day, which is another source of income for his large famiL..

Touch L. hopes the $1,000 loan will help her purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate his business more efficientL. and to raise his earnings.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir C. is 65 years old. He has a sub-professional background as an installer. He is marred and has 6 children. Tahir's profession was very popular. In Tajikistan, there was a wide range of construction, and his position was well-paid. Tahir grew up in a village, and animal breeding skills were familiar to him from childhood. After the civil war when he was without a job, the animal breeding skills helped him. Now Tahir has a part-time farm, and he is increasing his livestock. He is going to buy three bull-calves to fatten and sell for the loan amount of $875. This loan helps to increase his number of cattle and give an opportunity to the village habitants where lives. Tahir buys the calves near his home for a low price. Tahir is going to pay off the loan amount in 10 months.

loans.use: To buy three bull-calves for fatting and selling

loans.name: Sham’Igul

texts.en:
Sham’igul K. is 42 years old. She has a secondary-level education. She is married and has 4 children. After secondary school Sham’igul got married so she did not have the opportunity to continue her education. She was a housewife and looked after her children. Six years ago her husband and she went to Russia for work. There in Russia, she learned the skills of business, and how to make money. Her husband is working in Russia.

When she came back to Tajikistan, she rented a sell-point in a market. Gradually her business increased, and now she has two sell-points in a market, where she trades with her son. She is selling material for dresses. Sham’igul has more than 6 years of experience. She is going to increase the sales turnover and the range of goods with the loan amount of $875. Summer is a wedding time, and many brides buy dress material for their dowries. This loan helps to increase the range of cloth for dresses. Usually village habitants need to go far away to buy those materials, so now they can save time and transportation costs. She is going to pay off the loan amount in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy cloth for dresses

loans.name: Giyosiddin

texts.en:
Giyosiddin S. is 52 years old, he has a secondary-level education, and he is a driver. He is married and has 6 children. He has a truck which he used for a long time and carried building materials. Now he has passed his truck to his son who continues his work. Giyosiddin has a big family, so he tries to earn as much as possible to feed his family.

With this purpose in mind, he is going to enlarge his business and increase his turnover. He has rented a shop in a central market of Vakhdat town for 4 years. He sells foods. With the loan of $1000, he is going buy foods to sell, increase the range of goods, and also buy kids' toys. He surveyed the market accurately and came to the conclusion that in the market, the range of toys is lacking. As Giyosiddin surveyed, women do the main shopping, so now women have the opportunity to buy food and toys in the same place. He is going to pay off the loan over 10 months.

loans.use: To buy food and kids' toys and to increase turnover

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.en:
Odiljon S. is 30 years old, and he has a secondary-level education. He is married and has 1 child. Odiljon grew up in a poor family, and his parents could not pay for his education, so he does not have any specialization. After his school graduation, he went to a market and provided his help as a loader. Everyday he saw how the sellers worked successful and earned income.

He decided to start his own business but did not have any money. Four years ago he started a small business, and first goods he sold were were men's socks. Gradually he learned skills in selling, and he increased the range of goods and turnover. Currently Odiljon sells kids' sport wear and men's underwear. With the loan amount of $575, Odiljon is going to buy a new range of kids' and men's clothes at lower prices than other sellers. This loan helps a poor person obtain goods at moderate prices. He is going to pay off the loan over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy and sell a new range of goods

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom S. is 36 years old, and she has a secondary-level education. She is married and has 5 children. After her school graduation, Gulandom got married. She was a housewife and looked after her children. As Gulandom did not have any skills, she did not take an interest in any job. But time and a hard life caused her to find a source of income.

Four years ago, she started her business. As she lives in a big village, she sells footwear, which has a great demand among the poor population. In the summertime flip-flops are very popular among men and women. These goods are very cheap, so Gulandom has a high turnover. With the loan amount of $575, she is going to buy a new range of goods: quality footwear for children and teenagers for a low price. As the school fair is coming, many parents need to go far away to buy school clothing. This loan gives them an opportunity to obtain what they need in the nearest market and save time and transportation expenditures. Gulandom is going to pay off the loan amount over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy and sell summer footwear (flip-flops)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia G. is 49 years old. She is married and has 5 children. When Sonia graduated from secondary school, she entered a copy-typist course and for many years worked as a copy-typist in an organization. Four years ago, she became interested in business. Sonia borrowed money from her sister and gradually started her own business selling men's clothes. Currently, she rents a stall in a market, where she sells various goods, mostly men's and kids' clothes. However, Sonia would like to buy a new range of clothes for sale and therefore needs a loan of US$1,000. Since Sonia sells summer clothes, for which there is currently a large demand, the loan will also help the village habitants in obtaining more diverse summer clothing. Sonia will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of various men’s and kids' clothes for sale

loans.name: Mayil

texts.en: Mayil A. lives in Beylagan. He makes his living repairing old and broken watches. Mayil has been engaged in this job since 1987 and currently has a small booth in the Beylagan city bazaar. He would like to increase the area of his booth, and has therefore asked the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of US$1,000.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar A. lives in Beylagan. He is 34 years old. Etibar is engaged in jewellery selling. He owns a small booth in the Beylagan city bazaar. He needs capital to purchase more diverse jewellery for sale. Etibar has therefore asked the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of US$500.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil A. lives in Beylagan. He is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. He owns a tea-house in the middle of Beylagan. Kamil established this business many years ago, and by now the chairs and tables in the tea-house are very old. To attract more clients to his tea-house, Kamil wants to buy new tables and chairs and has therefore asked the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of US$500.

loans.use: Purchase of  tables

loans.name: Nurida

texts.en: Nurida A. lives in Beylagan. She is married and has 3 children. She owns a small food market in front of her hoouse. Nurida sells sugar, tea, butter, beer, and other items at her market. She has been engaged in this business since 1996, when she only had a small booth. Later on, Nurida managed to expand her business and built a market. Normicro was very helpful to Nurida: in 2003-2006, Nurida borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch totaling US$2,000, and used these loans for her business. Now she needs a new loan of US$1,100 to expand her business and to increase daily sales.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Mrs. Hout T. is 48 years old and the mother of 4 children. She and her husband sell fish in an open air market where they make up to $10 each day on average. The couple has to get up early in the morning to purchase fish from a fishery dock far away.

Hout T. has spent much money on her public transportation every day, which is why she currently is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to reduce such a big expense. Futhermore, it will make it easier and quicker for her to get supplies for her business.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng S. O. is 29 years old and the mother of one child. She runs a small booth selling different kinds of grocery products to the people in her community. This business’s activity earns her around $2.50 each day, while her husband makes approximately $3.70 each day from working as a fisherman and construction foreman.

Currently, S. O. would like to add different kinds of products to her store to meet her clients’ needs but she faces a financial constrain. Therefore, she is requesting for a $1,000 loan to help her purchase greater varieties of goods to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to meet her clients'  needs.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi K. C. is 31 years old. She has a sweet home with a husband aged 34 and two lovely children aged 7 and 5. They live in Soc Son district, Hanoi capital. Her husband is an employee at Noi Bai airport, and she has a shop on her parents' land where she sells shoes and clothes while she looks after her smaller child. She has made clothes since she graduated from high school at the age of 18.

Thanks to her pleasant manner and professional skill, she receives many clients everyday. That is why this year she hired 3 people to make clothes with her. With a profit of $12-$24 per day from the shop, she and 3 employees can support themselves in this semi-urban area. However, she thinks that it is better to expand this business and create jobs for other neighbors, so she wants to borrow $1,200.00 to invest $430 on buying cloth and $770 on shoes. In addition, she wants to prove that a woman can succeed even though she doesn't have a chance to go to university.

loans.use: She wants to buy cloth and shoes for her tailoring and shoe shop.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil K. is thirty-seven years old and married with one child.  He was trained as a tailor in 1982 and was self-employed from 1986 until the civil war broke out in Sierra Leone.  After the war, he reorganized himself and started his business in 2002 in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone on a very small scale but could not progress due to lack of capital.  With his first loan from SMT, Khalil purchased some cotton fabric, buttons, etc. and then started getting more customers.  His business is improving and he is requesting a second loan of $175 to purchase more materials to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu T. is 45 years old and married with five children.  He sells second-hand clothes in the open air market in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With his previous loan from SMT, T. was able to increase his stock. He would now like a second loan of $175 so that he can include children’s clothes.  His hope is that his business profits will allow him to see that his children succeed with their education.

loans.use: Diversify his stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul K. is fifty-four years old, married with four children who are all in school. He started his business soon after the civil war ended, in 2002 in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone. Abdul has had to buy medicines from a wholesaler on credit which he says can be very expensive. With his previous loan from SMT, he was able to pay cash for 25% of the stock he needed but still had to get the balance on credit.

Abdul needs more capital to invest for the expansion of his business. He is therefore requesting a loan of $350 from SMT and feels sure he will be able to it pay back in 10 installments. The loan will enable Abdul to purchase the stock on a cash basis and at a lower overall cost.

loans.use: Purchase stock of medicines wholesale and on a cash basis

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S., 34, is married with four children. She runs her small business in a neighbor’s shop in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  She sells children’s clothes and cotton fabrics. She uses the profits for her four children's education and other school requirements while her husband provides food and clothing.  Mariama would like to expand her stock and is requesting a loan of $175.  This will also enable her to extend her sales activity to other close villages during village market days.

loans.use: Expand clothes and fabric stock to extend sales to close villages

loans.name: Isa Malado

texts.en:
Isa Malado K., 42, has three children. He is a hardworking man who started his business in 1986, but it was destroyed during the civil war. After the war, he started the business again selling food stuffs. After he made some profit, and with his previous loans from SMT, he diversified his business to include the selling of sandals and T-shirts.

Isa runs the business with his wife and they are working together to improve their livelihood. She sells some of the items in the neighboring villages. Their aim is to have enough capital so that they can purchase the majority of their goods wholesale for better profit.

Isa also plans to sell some items wholesale to small vendors who are unable to buy items from Freetown or Guinea due to lack of sufficient capital themselves. Isa is therefore requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Purchase stock of clothes wholesale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius T. is thirty-eight years old, married with three children.  He runs a plastic sandal business in Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  Julius shares the space with a neighbor and he would like to have his own space but due to lack of capital, he has not been able to construct a selling table for his business.  Julius would like to expand his business so that he can earn a good income and be more independent.  He is requesting a loan of $175 which he will be able to pay back monthly.

loans.use: Construct an improved space so his business can be independent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed T. is thirty-five years old, married with one child.  He started running a business twelve years ago selling rice. With the development of many vocational training schools by the international NGOs, many people are trained in tie-and-dye and soap making.  Mohamed found there is great need for chemicals such caustic soda, color dye, and even cotton fabrics.  He then started selling these items on a small scale.  The business improved after his previous loan and he would now like to expand his business further.  He is requesting a loan of $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase stock of chemicals sold for use in tie-dye and soap making

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam C. is forty years old and married with two children.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same market but in a different location. The couples’ businesses are too small to make enough income for all the family's needs, so Mariam would like to diversify her business by including the selling of rice, palm oil and peanut butter.  She said if only she could access a loan of $175, she would improve her income. Then she and her husband would be able to purchase items from the villages for her to sell in the town.  Mariam is serious about providing her two children with a good education and a better future life.

loans.use: Diversify into selling of rice, plam oil, and peanut butter

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William K., 52, had his livelihood destroyed during the civil war in Sierra Leone. Starting life over again with his wife and children at the age of forty-five, after being a refugee in a neighboring country, was very hard for William. With their meager savings, he was able to set up a small business five years ago in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.

William's previous loan from SMT enabled him to purchase goods from Guinea and he made a good profit and was able to pay back his loan on time. He is now requesting a second loan of $350 from SMT for the same purpose. William’s hope is to continue to educate his children and build a better house for his family in the future.

loans.use: Increase stock of clothing

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is happily married and has one daughter and a grandson. She operates a flourishing shoe shop at the Central Market in Melitopol. Irina has been in the shoe selling business for 15 years and has built up a great repertoire of clients. Her central location helps to ensure that she has plenty of business.

Irina would like to be able to purchase a new supply of seasonal shoes. She has requested a $1200 loan which would enable her to purchase 200 pairs of shoes. She has a wonderful and solid reputation with Nadiya Ukraine and is a very goal-oriented and hard-working person. Her fifteen years in the shoe business attest to that. Irina’s long term goals are to continue to watch her business grow so that she can help her daughter and grandson and provide a stable income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her shoe shop

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina supports herself and her 15-year-old daughter with the income from her small women’s clothing business. During the cold winter months she sells warm coats, and in the warmer season she sells T-shirts and undergarments. Irina has had her business for eight years. She now operates two sales kiosks, one of which is in a very good location at the market with a lot of passing traffic and good sales.

Irina has developed a good reputation in the market. She is a delightful lady with a grateful attitude. Irina has requested a loan of $1000 to buy new clothing inventory and continue developing her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her women's clothing business

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda has a business selling delicious sweets from a small space at one of the busy markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She sells a variety of small cookies and candy. Nadezhda’s business does well as there are not many other vendors who have the product selection that she does. She has been in business for 15 years, and has gained much experience and many happy customers along the way.

Nadezhda makes about $300 a month in profits which helps to support herself and her husband. In the future she hopes to be able to help her grandchildren financially as well. Nadezhda has requested a short-term loan of $300 to help her purchase more product inventory for her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her confectionary business

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en: Yuriy D. is a friendly young businessman from Zaporoshie, Ukraine. Three years ago he started a small sales business selling light bulbs and small electronics at one of the large outdoor markets in Zaporoshie. Smart advertising and friendly service have helped attract many customers to his two sales locations. Yuriy designed small marketing flyers to distribute in the market that have done an excellent job of bringing in new clients. Yuriy has requested a loan of $800 to help him purchase a supply of new, energy-efficient light bulbs to sell in his kiosks.

loans.use: Purchase new type of light bulb

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina has a little kiosk at the Central Market in Melitopol. She sells women’s clothing and shoes and would like to be able to purchase some extra seasonal inventory. Her kiosk is located in a very central location for shoppers and is attractive and well organized. She has run her little store for 14 years. Through the help and support of Nadiya Ukraine she was recently able to find a better kiosk which has helped her business expand.

In order to purchase the necessary inventory for her business, Valentina has requested a $700 loan. She currently has $1500 invested in inventory. Valentina is a hard-working and very trustworthy client with Nadiya Ukraine and has an excellent credit history.

Valentina and her husband, Anatoily, have two sons. Her goal is to continue developing her clothing business and earn extra income so that she will be able to take her two sons and her husband on a special vacation.

loans.use: Purchase additional seasonal inventory for her women's apparel shop

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia C. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. Silvia runs a small grocery store located at her house that she and her husband just started a year ago after he retired. Her husband used to work in public administration, but now he is working on fixing the yards of their house and neighbors.

Silvia and her husband are seeking a loan in order to purchase chickens to start a small farm because they want to start selling chicken at their small grocery store. With their last loan, they were able to purchase 2 pigs.

loans.use: Purchase chickens.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. D. B. has her own greenhouse at her house. She grows her own plants and trees to sell. Victoria is 49 years old, married, and the mother of one daughter. Her daughter will turn 15 years old in October.

Victoria has clients all over the country. She sells about 200-300 plants per month. She started her business 10 years ago, but has been working as a gardener for many years before that for other people. Her husband and three other people also help her in her greenhouse. Victoria works everyday from 7 am until 8 pm.

Victoria needs a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina A., second from right, wants to open a barber shop in Bayaguana.  Josefina is pictured here with the four other members of her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. Josefina will use her portion of the loan to buy materials to start up her barber shop.  Her business will help her support her four-year-old daughter Jaqui.

loans.use: To open a barber shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria E. C. wants to open a beauty salon in Bayaguana. She will use this loan to buy hair care products and tools as well as materials with which to keep her accounts, such as notebooks and pencils. Maria's small business will help her support her daughter Liset (16) and extended family members. Liset dreams of being a model, but for now she is studying to become a secretary.

Note: Maria is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana S. wants to open a popsicle stand in Bayaguana. She will use this loan to buy materials such as juice and popsicle sticks to make the popsicles, other small commodities to sell such as gum, and also a ledger and pens with which to keep her accounts. Juana's entrepreneurship will enable her to help her husband Danilo support their son Vladimir (11), who is in eighth grade at a local public school. Juana hopes to become a good professional whose business can benefit the surrounding community.

Note: Juana is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $700 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To open a popsicle stand

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mrs. Mirta L. Alcaraz is 28 years old, is married and has a 2-year-old son. A few years ago, motivated by the desire of self-improvement Mirta gathered her few savings and established her own microcompany. She opened a small kiosk on the municipal market of the city. Thanks to the big commercial movement of the area, she was able to extend her business with the profit that she was obtaining. Today, she is a proprietor of a big grocery store where she commercializes all kinds of products of basic necessities, such as oil, noodles, canned products, candies, soap, etc. Mirta works everyday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. She tells us that her goal is to go so far as to buy her own house, since where she lives now it is a rented house. To increase her profits she wants to sell wholesale products since in the area where she is, there are many wholesale clients. For this reason she needs a loan of $600 that she will use to buy wholesale basic products such as oil, flour and sugar. With this Mirta will obtain bigger profits that will allow her to save more and buy one day the house that she desires so much.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirta L. Alcaraz tiene 28 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Hace unos años, Mirta impulsada por el deseo de superación, juntó unos ahorros y montó su propia microempresa, abrió un pequeño kiosco en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Gracias al gran movimiento comercial de la zona, ella pudo ir ampliando su negocio con las ganancias que obtenía, hoy día, ella es dueña de una gran despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, como aceite, fideos, productos enlatados, golosinas, jabón, etc. Mirta trabaja todos los días de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m., y nos cuenta que su meta es llegar a comprar su casa propia, pues donde vive ahora es una casa alquilada. Para aumentar sus ganancias ella desea vender al por mayor sus productos pues en la zona hay muchos clientes mayoristas; para ello necesita un préstamo de US$ 600 con lo que emperezará a adquirir los productos básicos al por mayor como aceite, harina y azúcar. Con esto ella obtendrá mayores ganancias que le permitirán a su vez ahorrar más para poder comprarse la casa que tanto desea.

loans.use: Buy whosale oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Australia

texts.en:
Australia M. is the proud owner of Botellera Dundun, a bottle recycling service that she maintains out of her home in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. Working in conjunction with the Dominican Republic’s largest brewery, Australia collects used bottles and glassware from her community and earns a profit by recycling these with local breweries. Australia’s business not only brings added provisions for her two children, Claraelena and Valentin (age 18 and 26, respectively), but she also is an admirable role model in her community through her stewardship for the local environment. With this loan, Australia will be able to expand her business by investing in bags to increase her storage of bottles.

Note: Australia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase storage bags and bottles

loans.name: Nelson Miguel

texts.es:
Nelson F. is married and the father of two with a third child on the way. Five years ago his factory job was downsized. Using his severance money, he opened a small grocery store in the center of their town where he and his wife sell produce and staples such as sugar, flour and cooking oil. The shop has been very successful and they now hope to expand it. They have rented more space and are asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase inventory.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Nelson F. es casado, y es padre de dos niños y uno por nacer. El trabajan conjuntamente con su esposa atendiendo el negocio, ellos son dueños de un almacén ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Hace 5 años Nelson quedó sin trabajo por una reducción de personal que sufrió la fábrica donde él trabajaba; con la indemnización cobrada decidió abrir su propia microempresa; montó un almacén donde venda todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como hortalizas, frutas, azúcar, aceite, harina, etc. Gracias a las excelentes ganancias obtenidas ellos han decidido ampliar el negocio, alquilaron otro salón y ahora necesitan aumentar su stock de mercaderías para ello solicitan un préstamo de US$ 1000 que lo invertirán en la

loans.use: To purchase stock for a grocery store including sugar, produce, pasta, oil, flour and dairy products.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Business Description

Máxima has fifteen years of experience in the sale of cosmetics and costume jewelry, including perfumes, creams, lipstick, earrings, rings, and more. She begain this business because she and her husband separated. With some money that he left her, she began her sales career little by little so that she could take care of her two children. She works from nine in the morning until eight at night, every day. She conducts her business door to door.

Purpose of the Loan

Máxima would use the loan to buy Herbalife products. She is just branching out into this product line, and she doesn't have enough capital to keep investing in the line. She also wants to continue her line of costume jewelry. Herbalife products are in great demand, and she wants to fill client orders.

About the Applicant

Máxima is forty-five and divorced. She has two children. The older child helps out with household expenses. The younger helps out by selling the products in school and through schoolmates. The father of the children makes a monthly payment to cover food expenses. They live in a very modest one-story house made of concrete. She is a woman who has worked very hard to better her children's life in the fifteen years that she has been alone. She wants to enlarge her business with this loan and in this way give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Máxima tiene 15 años de dedicada a la venta de cosméticos y bisuterías de mujer, como perfumes, cremas, lápiz de labios, aretes, anillos etc. Ella empezó este negocio a raíz que se separó de su esposo. Ella tenia un dinero que él le dejó entonces empezó a vender de poco a poco para de esta manera poder mantener a sus 2 hijos. Ella trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante.

Uso del Préstamo

La señora Máxima desea el crédito para comprar productos de herbalife, ya que ella esta incursionando en esta línea y le falta capital para poder seguir invirtiendo. Y desea continuar continuar con la línea de bisuterías. Ella tiene mucha demanda de los productos herbalife y desea atender a los clientes que le están solicitando estos productos.

Información Personal

La Sra. Máxima tiene 45 años de edad es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos. El mayor de sus hijos le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y su hijo menor le ayuda vendiendo sus productos con sus compañeros en el colegio. El padre de sus hijos le pasa una mensualidad para los gastos de alimentación. Su casa de de 1 piso, de cemento y muy modesta. Ella es una mujer que se ha esforzado mucho por sacar a delante a sus hijos desde hace 15 años que ha estado sola. Desea crecer con los créditos y de esta manera darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and nautral products for resale

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
Osvaldo P. is a widower and the father of two young girls. He has worked from a very young age and once emigrated to Argentina in search of better opportunity. With money he saved up from several years of hard work there he was able to return to Paraguay and open his own business in the municipal market. Thanks to the wide variety of groceries and Osvaldo's close attention the store has grown little by little and now supplies several smaller business in the area. Osvaldo hopes to earn enough money to purchase a home, as he still shares a small, rented house with his two daughters. At this time he finds himself low on inventory so he is asking for a loan of $200 to stock up on popular dairy products like cheese, milk and yogurt.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Osvaldo P. es viudo y tiene dos hijas. Trabajo desde muy joven en diferentes lugares, viajo a Argentina para buscar mejores condiciones de vida, pero luego de unos años de arduo trabajo y ahorro el pudo volver a Paraguay para abrir su propio negocio. Con sus ahorros montó un almacén en el mercado municipal de la ciudad y nos cuenta que gracias a la variedad de sus productos y su buena atención, el ha logrado crecer de a poco. Hoy día es proveedor de varios negocios más pequeños de la zona; con las ganancias que obtiene planea comprarse una casa pues aún vive con sus hijas en una pequeña casa alquilada. Como la demanda va en aumento el necesita surtir más su negocio, por lo que desea obtener un préstamo de US$ 200 que los invertirá en la compra al por mayor de productos lácteos como queso, leche y yogurt que son los productos de mayor demanda.

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of dairy products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Business Description

Rosa buys and sells chickens and hens. She has twenty years of experience in this business. Twelve years ago she used her own money to open a business so that she could be independent. Her business is located in the local market. She works from five in the morning to one in the afternoon.

Purpose of the Loan

Rosa wants this loan so that she can pay cash when buying more poultry. Currently she pays cash for only some of the poultry and buys the rest on credit. She doesn't have enough capital because of the expenses she incurred when her small son had an operation two months ago. This loan would allow her to buy her poultry at a better price and pass the savings along to her clients.

About the Applicant

Rosa is thirty-four. She is separated from her husband. She is both mother and father to her children. Her two-story home is made of concrete but is still under construction. Two of her children go to school; the third is a one-year-old. She is a very hard-working person who is striving to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Doña Rosa se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos y gallinas tiene 20 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Hace 12 años con un capital propio que ella tenia decidió independizarse y poner su propio negocio. Ella tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado del sector. Rosa trabaja desde las 5:00am hasta 13:00pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Doña Rosa desea con el crédito comprar mas pollos y gallinas de contado, ya que actualmente compra una parte en efectivo y la otra la saca a crédito. El capital de ella no es suficiente para su negocio debido a la operación que le realizo a su hijito hace 2 meses en la cual tuvo muchos gastos. Por ello al tener este crédito le permitirá comprar a bajo costo y darles un mejor precio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

La señora Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, esta separada de su esposo. Ella es padre y madre para sus hijos. Su casa es de cemento de 2 pisos pero aun esta en construcción. Tienes 2 hijos una esta en la escuela el otro es de 1 añito. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Business Description

Karina has spent three years running a business she started with her own money. She sells clothing, shoes, skirts, and so on. She also sells juices, candies, and many other confections. She sells the clothes on credit and works from eight in the morning to eight at night. Her business is located in her home.

Purpose of the Loan

Karina would use the loan to buy more clothing, which makes up the bulk of her sales because demand is high. She wants to pay cash so that she can get a better price and pass on the savings to her customers.

About the Applicant

Karina is married and has three children who go to school. Her husband makes deliveries from a small vehicle they own. Together, they are able to meet household expenses. They live with Karina's mother-in-law, who has given over a part of her home to them. Karina's wish is to obtain this loan so that she can expand her business and ensure a better future for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Karina lleva 3 años dedicada al comercio de ropa y confitería, ella inicio su negocio con un capital propio que tenia. Ella vende ropa, zapatos, faldas, etc. y también jugos, cachitos y todo tipo de confiterías. La ropa la vende a crédito, ella trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 8pm. Su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

Karina desea el crédito para comprar ropa que es lo que mas vende ya que tiene muy buena demanda de sus clientes. Ella desea comprar de contado la mercadería para obtener un mejor precio. Y a su vez venderla a un valor más accesible a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Karina esta casada, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que están en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja haciendo fletes en un carrito que tienen y de esta manera ambos aportan con los gastos del hogar. La vivienda donde habitan es de la suegra quien le dio una parte para que vivan allí. Ella desea obtener el crédito de tal forma ir incrementando su negocio y darle un mejor futuro a su familia.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Business Description

Wilson buys and sells household goods, such as quilts, bedspreads, plastic bins, bedsheets, and so on. He has fifteen years of experience. He works every day of the week, delivering his wares to the homes of clients who place orders. His wife is a great help to him in his business.

Purpose of Loan

Wilson needs the loan to buy more household goods for resale, since he has retained and increased his clientele through his daily effort in his business. Despite the setback of the theft of a certain portion of his inventory, Wilson has not lost the ability to work and generate income for his family.

About the Applicant

Wilson is thirty-one. He lives with his wife and his three beautiful children. Thanks to his efforts and those of his wife, he has been able to continue their education. His house is constructed from cane, but is sturdy and cosy. Wilson's dream is to have his own shop, where he could display and sell his wares to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Don Wilson se dedica a la compra y ventas de artículos para el hogar como: edredones, colchas, canastas de plástico, sabanas etc... , teniendo como experiencia 15 anos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana hasta los domingos entregando la mercadería a domicilio de clientes que les hacen los encargos, ya que tiene un gran apoyo de su esposa el cual le facilita en el trabajo.

Uso del Préstamo

Wilson necesita el préstamo para la compra de más artículos para el hogar, ya que por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener y aumentar, Wilson necesita incrementar sus ventas esto, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo. A pesar de haber sufrido un robo llevándose cierta parte de su mercadería, Wilson no ha perdido su capacidad de trabajar y generar ingresos para su familia.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Wilson tiene 31 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 bellos hijos, que gracias al esfuerzo que realiza junto a su esposa a logrado mantener educándolos. Su casa es de estructura de cana pero en condiciones estables y acogedora. Los sueños de Wilson es tener su propio local en donde la clientela valla a ver la variedad de los productos que gracias a su esfuerzo Wilson los provee y demuestra.

loans.use: To buy household goods for resale

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra's Business

Sandra began her business five years ago. She sells chicken as well as traditional foods from the coastal regions of Ecuador. Sandra has a very personal relationship with her clients and works every day from 8a.m. to 9p.m.

Use of the Loan

Sandra is in need of a loan for investment in an industrial kitchen, tables, chairs, and other materials to decorate and improve the presentation of her restaurant.

Personal Information

Sandra is 32 years old. She has three beautiful younger children and one who is in school. Her husband works as a day laborer in house building. Since she was very young, Sandra has taken a keen interest in working, and it was with the help of her mother that she began to sell chicken and traditional foods. Occupied as she is with her business, she feels it is a large part of her life. She hopes that in keeping up and improving her business she will also be able to ensure the improvement of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Sandra inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Los productos que vende son pollos y comida típica de la costa ecuatoriana. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8am-a -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Sandra necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de una cocina industrial, mesas con sillas, materiales para adecuar y mejorar la presentación de su local.

Información Personal

Sandra tiene 32años .Tiene 3 lindos hijos menores 1 de ellos estudia. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero en la construcción de casas. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar. Con la ayuda de su madre dio inicio a la venta de pollos y comidas típicas. Ocupando para el negocio parte de su vivienda. Aspira ha mejorar y mantener su negocio para de esta manera seguir colaborando en el progreso de su hogar.

loans.use: To outfit an industrial kitchen and buy furniture for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Mrs. Sara R. is 50 years old, she is married and lives with Alfredo, her 42-year-old husband. He works downtown selling fishing articles; they both economically support their household. They have 3 children; two boys and a girl, they all three are in school, they live with them and help his parents with the sales. Sara has exclusively sold tobacco for more than ten years, she has a stand at the city market. She opens her business at 5:30 a.m. and she starts working preparing cigarettes with dry tobacco leaves until 6 p.m. Then she returns home house to take care of her family and to share the anecdotes and experiences of the day. The requested loan will be use to buy tobacco leaves since she wants to increase her production. Sara is a part of a committee of the city market called " Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope). It is constituted by 16 enterprising women, they work as a team and the group is quite solid, the committee is in the fifth cycle of the program "Committee of enterprising women", a project of the Paraguayan Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sara R. tiene 50 años, ellas es casada y vive con su marido, Alfredo de 42 años, él trabaja en el centro de la ciudad y se dedica a la venta de articulo de pesca; ambos aportan económicamente con los ingresos de la casa. Tienen 3 hijos; dos varones y una mujer, los 3 hijos estudian, viven con ellos y ayudan a sus padres con las ventas.
