Información Personal

Ella tiene 30 años y un hijo que estudia su casa es de cemento esposo le ayuda en la casa y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su meta es de poder ampliar su local para que su esposo ya no tenga que salir a vender los productos sino que tenga otro local similar

loans.use: To buy paper and plastic household goods for resale

loans.name: Mirna Estela

texts.es:
I have a small business selling tortillas out of my home. I've been doing this for about 1 1/2 years. I'm able to help my husband pay for the family monthly expenses. I currently need to buy more cornflour, salt, firewood and I want to make improvements to my kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas en mi casa. Este negocio lo tengo hace un año imedio, con el cual ayudo mucho a mi esposo para los gastos familiares mensuales.Ahora necesito comprar mas maiz, sal, leña y mejorar mi cocina.

loans.use: Cornflour, salt, firewood and coal

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

José started in this business by selling pork. He had to change his business because demand for pork was high and he didn't have enough capital to buy it. At the suggestion of a friend, he used his savings to invest in beef instead. The business has done well. He works every day of the week from seven in the morning to seven at night.

Purpose of the Loan

He would use the loan to buy sausages, meat, and poultry, which he plans to offer again. He is hoping that his investment will lead to greater profits. Also, he wants to save up to buy a refrigerator in which to store his meats.

About the Applicant

José separated from his wife three years ago. He is fifty-four and has two grown children. He is engaged to be married, and his fiancee helps him in his rented shop. His wish is to have his own home and a larger shop.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

José se inicio con la venta de carne de chancho. Negocio que tuvo que cambiar ya que la demanda por el producto fue grande y no tenía capital. Sus ahorros los invirtió en la compra de carne de res. Un amigo lo motivo a esta inversión. Le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de embutidos, carnes, y pollos. Producto que esta nuevamente comenzando a vender. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder mejorar sus ingresos. Además poder ahorrar para adquirir un congelador donde pueda guardar sus productos.

Información Personal

José es separado de su esposa hace 3 años. Tiene 54 años y dos hijos los que ya son adultos. Actualmente tiene un nuevo compromiso. La que le ayuda en atención del local. El cual es alquilado. Su deseo es poder tener su casita propia y de esta manera tener un local más amplio.

loans.use: To buy several kinds of meat for his butcher shop

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Business Description

Isabel got started selling crabs. Since she had to travel every week and that was too much of an effort, her father encouraged her to offer restaurant services. With his support, she was able to buy cooking utensils. She began selling five meals a day for lunch. Currently, she has a clientele that surpasses 20 customers everyday. She works during the weekends from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m. She gets help from her mom and dad for the preparation of the meals

Loan Use

She will invest the loan in buying supplies. She is also planning to purchase sodas, beverages and juices. Additionally, she is thinking of buying chickens once her income has increased.

Personal Information

Isabel is 39 years old and single. Eighteen years ago she suffered the loss of her 2-month-old son. She lives with her parents and seven siblings. They are all adults and they take care of their parents. Three years ago, her father had prostate surgery and this left her with little money. Her parents are her inspiration in order to keep going. She is hoping to build a house of concrete in the future. She currently lives in a house built with mixed materials.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Isabel se inicio con la venta de cangrejos. Por los que tenia que viajar todas las semanas. Actividad que le demandaba mucho esfuerzo. Su papa la motivo para que venda comida. Con su ayuda pudo comprar utensilios de cocina. Comenzó vendiendo 5 almuerzos. Actualmente tiene una clientela que sobrepasa las 20 personas diarias. Trabaja los fines de semana en horario de 5 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Recibe la ayuda de su papa y mama en la preparación de la comida.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres. Además piensa comprar colas, bebidas, jugos. Otra parte poder invertir en pollos. Con lo que mejorara sus ingresos.

Información Personal

Isabel es soltera. Tiene 39 años. Hace 18 años sufrió la perdida de su hijo de la edad de 2 meses de nacido. Ella vive con sus padres y 7 hermanos. Todos ya adultos y pendientes de sus padres. Hace 3 meses su papa fue operado de la próstata. Lo que ha ella la dejo un poco sin capital. Sus padres son lo que ha ella la motiva a seguir trabajando. Esperando a futuro poder construir su casa de cemento. Actualmente es de construcción mixta.

loans.use: Investing in buying supplies

loans.name: Adalinda

texts.en:
Business Description

Adalinda is a schoolteacher. Her sister put Analinda in charge of her own store. Little by little, she started saving and set up a business of miscellaneous items. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Loan Use

She will invest the loan in purchasing goods for supplying her location. She already has orders from people in the area.

Personal Information

Adalinda is a single mother. She is 32 and a has a 6 year old son that is currently attending school. Her little house is made of cane. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to start building a cane fence in order to give it more security. She is hoping to save money and provide a better environment for her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Adalinda es maestra de escuela. Su hermana tiene una tienda la que le dio a ella para que la administre. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y puso un local de artículos varios. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Ya que tiene pedidos de gente del sector.

Información Personal

Adalinda es madre soltera. Tiene 32 años. Y un hijo de seis que estudia. Su casita es de caña. Ella gracias a su trabajo ha podido irle haciendo un cercado de caña y de esta manera darle seguridad. Espera poder ahorrar y darle un mejor ambiente donde crezca.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

Carmen has 10 years of experience doing business. She started selling water, sodas and juices. Through a loan she purchased make up. Due to her own initiative she started in this line of business. She has done very well. She works every day in a schedule of 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Loan Use

The loan will be invested in the purchase of jewelry, make up and other accessories. She has good demand from clients. Thanks to the service she provides.

Personal Information

Carmen is married. She is 28 and has two kids. They study. Her husband is in the military and her dream is to open a diner. She hopes to reach this with the investment she will make.

Translated from Spanish by Claudia Welch, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Carmen tiene una experiencia de 10 años en la actividad del comercio. Se inicio vendiendo agua, colas, jugos. Por medio de un crédito que adquirió tuvo capital para comprar cosméticos. Por iniciativa propia incursiona en esta línea. Le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos, bisutería, joyas y productos de lencería. Tiene buena demanda de clientes. Gracias al servicio que ella les ofrece.

Información Personal

Carmen es casada. Tiene 28 años y 2 hijos. Los que estudian. Su esposo tiene la profesión de militar en servicio activo. Su deseo es poder tener un comedor. Espera lograrlo con la inversión que realizara.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of jewelry, make up and other accessories.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Business Description

Olga used to drive a school bus. Her car broke down. Then she looked for help through her sister to find funds to reach the dream to have a diner. This was possible and the business started three years ago. She started with a dining table in her house. Little by little she has adapted her diner. Together with her mom she works from Monday to Saturday in a schedule from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. And until 11 p.m. on the weekends.

Loan Use

The loan will be invested in purchasing food to prepare meals. As well as, in repairing a little used car to deliver lunch downtown. This way she will be able to provide a better service to her clients.

Personal Information

Olga is a single mother. She is 43 and has 4 children. 3 study and one of them helps her with her business, besides delivering lunches downtown. Her house is made of cement. Her wish is to have a big diner to accommodate the demand she currently has. People like her because of her sazon (seasoning of the food she prepares) which is really good.

Translated from Spanish by Claudia Welch, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Olga se dedicaba ha realizar expreso escolar. Su carrito se le daño. Por lo que busco mediante una hermana capital para cumplir su sueño de tener un comedor. La cual le facilito y comenzó con el negocio hace tres años. Comenzó con la mesa de comedor de su propiedad. Poco a poco a adecuado su local. Junto a su mama trabaja de lunes a sábado en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. Y los fines de semana hasta la 11.p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Y también poder reparar un carrito de segunda que tiene para poder repartir los almuerzos por el centro de la ciudad. De esta manera podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Olga es madre soltera. Tiene 43 años y 4 hijos. 3 estudian y uno le ayuda en la atención del local. Además de entregar los almuerzos en el centro. Su casita es de cemento. Su deseo es poder tener un amplio local debido a la demanda que tiene en estos momentos. Las personas la buscan por su sazón que es muy buena.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and car repair

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Business Description

Jesús has eight years of experience in her industry. She started selling cosmetics for another individual, and then she was able to open her own business with her savings. Because of her hard work, she has been able to build a more sturdy, cement house. It accommodates a small store inside. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m.

Use of the Loan

She will invest the loaned money into the purchase of cosmetics, jewelry, and gifts. Because of the service she provides, demand for her goods has increased.

Personal Information

Jesús is a 33 year old single mother. She has one child. Her baby attends a school near her home. She hopes that with these new funds she will be able to begin saving and provide better security for her home by creating an enclosure around her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Jesús tiene una experiencia de 8 años en la actividad del comercio. Se inicio vendiendo cosméticos para otra persona. Luego con sus ahorros decide tener su propio negocio. Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado construir su casita de cemento. Adecuo un pequeño local dentro de ella. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos, bisutería, joyas y regalos. Gracias al servicio que ella les ofrece su demanda ha aumentado.

Información Personal

Jesús es madre soltera. Tiene 33 años y 1 hijo. Su bebe estudia en una escuela cercana a su domicilio. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder ahorrar. De esta manera comenzar a dar seguridad a su domicilio. Realizando un cerramiento a su casa.

loans.use:
She will use the funds to purchase cosmetics, jewelry and gift items to sell in her store.

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de cosméticos, bisutería, joyas y regalos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
To purchase a display case and better her inventory.

Comprar una vitrina y mejorar su inventario

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Business Description

Maria serves snacks, lunch and a la carte entrees in her restaurant. She started this business when she immigrated from Colombia in search of a better life. With her husband's help, she has been successful in Ecuador and runs a business that continues to grow each day. She has also added a pay phone booth at the same location.

Loan Use

She needs this loan to expand the size of her restaurant and make improvements to the space, which will allow her to better serve her growing clientele.

Personal Information

Maria is 49 years old and has three children who are students. Her house is made of cement. Her husband helps her around the house and they enjoy a stable family life.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Maria tienen a la venta almuerzos meriendas, platos a la carta. Empezó este negocio cuando inmigro desde Colombia para mejorar sus situación, con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado superarse en Ecuador y tener un negocio que cada día crece mas por la excelente sazón que ella tiene. Además ha incorporado locutorio que administra junto a su restaurante

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para hacer adecuaciones en su restaurante porque como ahora tiene mas clientela ella ya no tiene espacio suficiente para atenderlos de buena manera por lo que necesita ampliar el local.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 49 años y tres hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento su esposo le ayuda en la casa y tiene estabilidad familiar

loans.use: To expand and make improvements to her restaurant

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Business Description

Cecilia runs a business selling products for the home, fragrances, costume jewelry and cosmetics. She started her business 2 years ago. Previously she sold cheese wholesale to businesses in her area. She receives customers at her home from 8 AM to 8 PM seven days a week and also makes sales calls both inside and outside her area. Her catalog sales format, along with her lay-away weekly payment plans, have resulted in even more customers.

Loan Use

Cecilia is requesting this loan to increase her inventory and facilitate catalog sales of products for the home, as this sales format has been well received. Cecilia demos and customers select products such as beds, comforters, DVDs, fans, sheet sets, china, pots and pans, TVs and cooking stoves.

Personal Information

Cecilia is 30 years old and has four children; three of them attend school. Her youngest child was born with cleft palate. She needs this loan to increase her inventory and generate more business which will allow her to increase her family's income and savings. She hopes to save enough to pay for her youngest child's cleft palate operation; even though he's an active child, she would like to see him lead a normal life. Her husband works for a private company and supports her business ventures. He is grateful that there are people willing to make loans to small businesses, allowing them to grow. He also indicated that his wife's earnings, which she has invested wisely, have allowed them to partially build their home and have added to the family's financial security.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia tiene negocio de artículos para el hogar, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Se inicio hace 2 años con este negocio. Anterior a este negocio vendía queso por libras que los entregaba a tiendas del sector. Atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana en su domicilio desde las 8: AM a 20: PM Cecilia también recorre promocionando sus productos dentro y fuera del sector. Su forma de venta por catalogo ha permitido que Cecilia tenga mas clientes. Al igual que la forma de pago en pequeñas cuotas cada semana y ella entrega el articulo cuando este cancelado máximo 10 semanas.

Uso del Préstamo

Cecilia solicita crédito para incrementar mas su negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar por catalogo. Esta forma de venta indica Cecilia tiene mucha acogida. Cecilia muestra el producto y el cliente escoge. Los artículos que Cecilia muestra son: camas, edredones, dvd, ventiladores, juegos de sabanas, vajillas, ollas y artículos de mayores valores como un TV, Cocina y otros.

Información Personal

Cecilia tiene 30 años 4 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian. Cecilia tiene su último niño con labio leporino. Cecilia dice que necesita crédito para crecer mas su negocio y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan ahorrar porque tiene la esperanza de hacer operar a su hijo y verlo como un niño normal aunque nos dice que es muy inquieto. El esposo la apoya en sus gestiones de crédito que ella realiza y trabaja en una empresa. Esposo nos dice que se siente contento que existan personas que den la oportunidad de créditos a aquellos negocios pequeños y les permitan crecer. También nos indica que gracias a las ganancias obtenidas y que son bien invertidas por su esposa han podido construir su vivienda auque no en su totalidad, pero que ya tienen mayor seguridad su negocio y familia.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and increase her sales

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Business Description

Martha works hard to sell bedspreads, awning (like a canvas canopy), quilts as well as undergarments and home products. Having 10 years of experience, she works independently. She starts work very early in the morning, delivering goods to towns in the outskirts of the city. She travels four days of the week.

Use of Loan

Martha needs the loan to purchase more merchandise and to have well-attended clients which increase her sales. By building up her clientele, Martha, in spite of being a single mother, has managed to grow her business as a result of her hard daily efforts.

Personal Details

Currently, Martha is 33 years old and lives together with her children who are ages 17, 14, 13 and 12 and are currently studying. Thanks to the help of her children she keeps her cement home very neat and cozy. Martha’s dream is to have a large business where she can display her merchandise to the locals and no longer needs to leave the city.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Martha se dedica a la venta de colchas, toldos, edredones, además venta de ropa interior y artículos para el hogar. Teniendo como experiencia 10 anos, trabajando independientemente. Trabaja desde muy temprano del día, entregando su mercadería a los pueblos aledaños del sector, viajando 4 días a la semana.

Uso del Préstamo

Martha necesita el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería y tener a su clientela bien atendida, de tal forma que llegue a incrementar sus ingresos, por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener y aumentar, Martha a pesar de ser madre soltera siempre ha llevado su negocio adelante, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad Martha tiene 33 anos de edad, en donde vive junto a sus hijos de 17, 14, 13 y 12 anos de edad actualmente estudiando, gracias a la ayuda que les brindan sus hijos mantiene su casa de estructura de cemento, muy aseada y en condiciones acogedoras. Los sueños de Martha es tener un gran local, donde pueda mostrar su mercadería a la gente del sector y así ya no tenga que salir de su ciudad.

loans.use: invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy winter clothing

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Business Profile

Mr. H. started his restaurant seven years ago. He has expanded the restaurant's output and now has orders from several businesses, to which the restaurant delivers to workers at their work site. His wife helps him with the business.

Use of the loan

Mr. H. wants to buy tables and chairs so as to provide better service and comfort to his clients.

Personal Information

Mr. H. is 31 years old with two kids. His house is made of cement. His goals are to expand his business premises in order to improve the quality of service since his business continues to grow day by day and has a great location.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor H. tiene un comedor que empezó hace 7 años, hoy ha desarrollado su producción y tiene varios pedidos de empresas lo cual entrega a trabajadores en los diferentes puestos de trabajo, en el negocio le ayuda su esposa.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere realizar adecuaciones en su local y comprar mesas y sillas para una mejor atención y comodidad de sus clientes.

Información Personal

Tiene 31 años y dos hijos , su casa es de cemento y sus metas es ampliar el local para de esta manera dar un mejor servicio ya que cada día crece y su ubicación es muy buena.

loans.use: Improve his restaurant through purchase of new chairs and tables

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Business Description

For four years now, Mr. Alfonso has had a shop where he sells canned goods, groceries, and items needed for everyday living. His business has grown to include more novelty products as well. He started this business after he was no longer able to dedicate himself to his profession as a plumber.

Loan Use

Mr. Alfonso needs this loan to buy more merchandise because he has more clients buying his products than before, and it's necessary to buy more so that he can grow his profits.

Personal Information

Mr. Alfonso is 52 years old and has three children, two of whom are studying. He and his family live in a basic, house made of cement. They have a close and stable family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Descripción del Negocio

Don Alfonso tiene hace cuatro años una tienda donde vende víveres y productos de primera necesidad. Este negocio lo comenzó luego de que ya no puedo dedicarse a su profesión de gasfitero. Actualmente vende víveres y ha incrementado otros productos de novedad

Uso del Préstamo

Él necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería pues con los productos que actualmente ofrece el tiene mas clientela que antes y por lo tanto necesita comprar mas y así aumentar sus ganancias.

Información Personal

El tiene 52 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian, su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Genaro Teofilo

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Genaro Teofilo has a general store where he sells items needed for everyday use, as well as canned goods and groceries. He has been in business for two years. So far, business has been very good because he treats his clients very well, and because he offers products that are always fresh and high quality.

Loan Use

Mr. Teofilo needs this loan to buy a copy machine because in his area nobody is offering this service. He would also like to improve the outside of his shop. He would like to better promote this business to attract more clients.

Personal Information

Mr. Teofilo is 37 years old and has two children, one of whom is a student. They live in a basic, cement house, and he has a close, stable family. He also hopes to finish the construction of his house, so that he would have some space to rent out as the area he's in is very commercial.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Teofilo tiene una despensa donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y víveres. Este negocio lo tiene hace dos años. Actualmente le ha ido muy bien pues tiene buena manera de tratar a los clientes y se esmera porque sus productos sean frescos y de buena calidad.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Teofilo necesita el crédito para comprar una copiadora por que en su sector nadie presta ese servicio y además quiere mejorar la fachada de su local ya que tiene pensado hacer una publicidad mas llamativa para tener mas clientela.

Información Personal

El tiene 37 años y dos hijos de los cuales uno estudia, su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Una de sus metas es de poder terminar de construir su casa y así tener locales para alquilar por que el esta en una zona muy comercia

loans.use: For investment in a second hand copy machine

loans.name: Sith

texts.en: Mrs. Sith S. is 37 years old and the mother of 7 children. She sells Khmer traditional cakes such as Num Korm, Num Bot, and Num Krouk to the people in her community and usually earns up to $4 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works in his rice paddy growing crops as well as several kinds of vegetables. Two of her children are employed at a hotel, but the others are students. Currently, this couple is humbly requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to help them purchase a cow, seeds, and a motorcycle to expand their farming venture. She and her family would be grateful and appreciative of your support.

loans.use: Needs a cow, seeds and a motorcycle for their farm

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em T. is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children who are too young to attend school. She sells vegetables and a variety of grocery products to the people in her area. With this activity, she can typically generate around $ 2.50 each day, while her husband makes approximately $3 a day selling containers of gasoline along the roadside in their area.

This young couple would like to maximize the number of products their little store offers to meet their clients' needs, but this is impossible due to their financial constraints. As a result, they are humbly requesting a loan of $500 to help them expand their store.

loans.use: Would like to expand her little grocery store by adding more products

loans.name: Khong

texts.en:
It is great to visit Mrs. Khong T. Y.'s farm in a hot and sticky summer afternoon. There you can feel pleasant thanks to green banana trees, fresh green tea cups and above all, thanks to the hospitality and friendliness of the mistress. That is my feeling every time I drop in her farm. So now let me tell you the story about this likable woman.

She is 40 years old and her husband, Mr. NguY. Van Co, is same age. They have a son and a daughter who are both in high school. They have contracted for this farm since January 2007 and have invested a lot of money in it. Every day she and her husband look after 800 ducks including egg-laying ducks and ducks for food, 25 pigs and a fish pond and a rice field of one hectare. However, she is still full of energy and plans. So she wants to borrow $1,200.00 to build a biogas plant ($430.00) to keep the environment clean and make the most of livestock manure. She will also use the loan to buy 25 breeding pigs and 800 chickens and ducks. As for payment, she is very confident and proud because she gets $6.5 per day from selling eggs, not to mention regular incomes from other livestocks. She says she doesn't fear hardship, she just dreams of having enough money to send her children to university.

loans.use: She wants to build a biogas plant and buy pigs, chickens and ducks for her livestock raising business.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Mr. Nut S. is a 34-year-old widower and has 3 school-aged children. 
To cover all the family’s expenses, Mr. S. works as a trailer driver transporting passengers (his trailer is attached to a motorcycle) and typically makes up to $6 each day. He has worked diligently to manage to support his 3 children, since his wife passed away a few years ago. At present, Nut S. needs to replace his old trailer, but he has insufficient money. He  hopes this loan will allow him replace it and then be assured of the earnings that ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for his business

payments.comment: Nut Sarin has successfully repaid his loan early! Thanks to you, he has able to grow his business and improve life for his family.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S. is 38-year-old mother of 5 children. She is a housewife, while her husband is a head of family who covers all the family’s expenses by working for a private company as a driver. He can typically earn up to $6 each day. Two of her children also work as private drivers, and the others generate income by operating a tailoring business. S. hopes this loan will help her purchase more sewing machines, so that her children can operate their business more efficiently and satisfy their clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines for her children's tailoring  business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Sor Sovanath for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
For the past eighteen years, Arthur S., pictured here on the right with his loan officer, Vladimir, has operated a shoe design and repair business in Izyum, Ukraine. By establishing good relationships with leather manufacturers, Arthur has been able to provide high quality products at low prices. Motivated, focused, and cheerful, Arthur has successfully expanded this family business to provide a consistent and stable income for his wife and daughter.

Arthur has requested a loan of $1200 to increase his working capital and purchase additional materials for his business. With the increased profits, Arthur hopes to open a shoe store and hire some employees to help alleviate the problem of unemployment in his community. Additionally, Arthur would like to complete some much needed repairs on his family’s home.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy materials for his shoe design/repair business

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Hardworking and a dedicated businesswoman, Galina G. has operated a women’s clothing business in the central market of Kherson for the past eight years. Known for her excellent customer service, Galina has successfully developed her business, expanding into the three vending facilities she currently operates. She has utilized microfinance loans from Nadiya Ukraine to accomplish this development, repaying each with a perfect credit history.

Galina’s business is the sole source of income for herself and her two sons. Currently, Galina is seeking a loan of $1000 to increase her clothing inventory, allowing her to increase her profits and provide a higher standard of living for her family of three.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her women's clothing business

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina B.’s passion lies with children. A mother of two, Irina opened her business selling children’s clothing with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past nine years, Irina has successfully operated her business at the market in Melitopol. With her profits, she not only has improved the living standards for her children, but she has been able to support her elderly parents as well.

Irina has requested a loan of $600 to restock her clothing inventory. An optimistic businesswoman with a perfect credit history, Irina plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her children's clothing business

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Two years ago, Irina opened a small kiosk in the central market of Stryi, Ukraine. She focused her business on the sale of imitation jewelry and accessories. Hardworking and modest, Irina has successfully used microfinance loans from Nadiya Ukraine to quickly expand and develop her business. With excellent customer service and reasonable prices, Irina’s business has been in high demand. She has managed to take on three employees, including her mother.

Irina has requested a loan of $1200 to open a new business – a little sandwich stall. By opening a second business, Irina hopes to increase her income and employ additional workers.

loans.use: Open a second small business

loans.name: Mahiyaddin

texts.en: Mahiyaddin is an IDP (displaced person) from the occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. Married, Mahiyaddin has four children. He started his business in 1998 and has borrowed four Normicro loans from our Baku branch totalling $1800. Now he is requesting to borrow $1000. He plans to expand his assortment of goods. This will increase his family's income.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.en: Doniyor is an energetic young man. He has recently moved to Kanibadam and started to work at the market. He is 19, and he is married. His wife helps him to run their business selling men's clothes. Besides buying and selling in the market, Doniyor works at a labour exchange. These two activities are the main source of income for his family. Recently Doniyor received a loan from Microinvest and significantly expanded his business. Now he is planning to get a new loan for further expansion of his activities.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida is an IDP (displaced person) from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, Valida has two children. She started her business in 1996 and has taken out two Normicro loans from our Baku branch totalling US$ 600. Her second loan amount was $450.

Now Valida is requesting a third loan, this time of $500. She is going to replace her refrigerator in the shop and use the rest of the sum to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods she sells and replace her refrigerator

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is an IDP (displaced person) from the occupied Shusha district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, Tarana has one child. She started her business in 1993 from zero. She has already taken one loan from Normicro Baku branch. Her first loan amount was US$ 350. This time, Tarana is requesting a loan of $500. She wants to purchase more goods so that she can retain her clientele because there is a lot of competition in the area where she runs her business.

loans.use: To increase her variety of goods and better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is an IDP (displaced person) from the occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, Maryam has one child. She started her business in 1993 and has already taken out one loan of US$ 450  from the Normicro Baku branch. With this second loan of $500, Maryam plans to increase the variety of her goods and outsell the competition in the area where she works.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods she sells in her general store

loans.name: Ayna

texts.en:
Ayna is an IDP (displaced person) from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, Ayna has one child. She started her business in 1995 and has taken one loan from the Baku branch of Normicro in the amount of US$ 300.

Ayna sells fruits and vegetables and her business needs to be funded from season to season. With her last loan, she bought melons and watermelons because at this season, such fruits are in greatest demand. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her fruit and vegetable sales

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana decided to begin her small market business about six years ago after observing her friends who had their own businesses. She operates a little sales kiosk at the Angolenko market in Zaporoshye, Ukraine where she sells women’s clothing.

Sventlana decided to concentrate on selling inexpensive clothing. She has found a neat niche by marketing affordable clothing to older customers who frequently live on small fixed incomes.

Svetlana and her husband have two children. Her goal for her business is to be able to earn enough to support her family. Svetlana has requested a $600 loan to help her purchase more seasonal inventory. She has proven to be a great client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past and we are glad of this opportunity to further help her with her business.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of her women's clothing business

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita sells children’s and baby clothes at the busy Angolenko market in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She also makes and sells baby bedding and blankets which gives her business a competitive edge over other clothing vendors.

Vita began selling in the mid 90’s when there was a boom in the market and people were earning good money. This enabled her to develop her business and establish a foundation for the future. Vita currently makes around 2500 Ukrainian Hrivna, or about $500, per month in profit. Her income is a big help to her and her husband and their son. She has requested a loan to increase her inventory of seasonal clothing.

loans.use: expand the inventory of her children's and baby clothes

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima Y. has been selling office/school supplies for 7 years now. She has a secondary school education. She is a widow and has 3 children, who help her in her business. The children study in school, and since she substitutes as a father to them, she also works as a dishwasher in one of the cafeterias in the city. She has been a client of MLF – MicroInvest for almost 4 years. She started by borrowing 300 somoni (currency of Tajikistan). Thanks to her responsibility and discipline with MLF – MicroInvest she has increased her activity to 3000 somoni. Right now she gets her products from local suppliers and in the future she plans on traveling to get supplies herself, increase her product offering and of course improve the location of her business.

P.S. In the photo is her daughter - Firuza

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Юлчиева Фотима продает канцелярские товары вот уже 7 лет. Образование среднее. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей, которые помогают ей, в её деятельности. Дети учатся в школе, и так, как она заменяет им и отца, она также совмещает работу посуда мойщицы в одних из столовых города. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» является почти 4 года. Начала кредитоваться с 300 сомони. Благодаря её ответственностью и дисциплинированностью перед программой МЗФ «Микроинвест» она увеличила свои активы до 3000сомони. Сейчас она товар берет у местных поставщиков, и в дальнейшем собирается ездить за товаром сама, расширить ассортимент и конечно же улучшить место своей деятельности. P.S. На фото её дочь- Фируза.

loans.use: increasing goods

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty K. is forty years of age, married with six children. She sells rope and string for local building construction, sharing a selling space with a friend. With six children, Mabinty struggles to provide her family with basic needs. Her husband sometimes assists with the selling of the items.

Mabinty and her husband would like to diversify their business but don’t have enough capital to do so. They would like to sell other building materials such as nails, padlocks, etc. and therefore are requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: Diversify inventory of building materials

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta K. is forty-four years old and married with three children. Her husband is employed as a driver but his income alone cannot meet the family expenses. Fanta therefore supplements her husband’s income with the income from her soft drink business which is based in Makeni town in Sierra Leone.

Fanta distributes some of the drinks to small shops in a nearby village and collects the income on a weekly basis. Fanta would like to expand her overall inventory volume and is requesting a loan of $175 to do so.

loans.use: Expand her rotating stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a grocery stand

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
K. Nigora was a seller of boiled peas, one of the Tajiks' favourite dishes. But as the competition for this kind of business was very high, it became less profitable. With the financial help of her husband, Nigora started a business selling household goods. Her mother also supported her and gave her a shop. Nigora’s sister-in-law helps with selling products.

Six months ago, Nigora received a loan from Microinvest that helped her to expand her assortment of products. At the moment, one can find anything that is needed for the home in her shop.

If Nigora can get a second loan, it will help her to develop her business further and make more profit. This is very important as Nigora has three kids and her business brings in significant income for the family.

loans.use: to further develop her business

loans.name: Bahrihon

texts.ru:
Bahrihon is 42 years old and has 4 children. She has been in the rice trade business for 4 years. Rice is a product with no substitutes in Tajik families as it is from rice that Plov, the traditional Tajik dish is made.

Bahrihon buys rice wholesale in local markets and she also travels to the wholesale market in neighboring Kyrgyzstan. Her workday starts early in the morning and continues into the evening. She has many steady clients and one can say that her profits are also steady. One year ago she turned to MLF MicroInvest and received her first loan. Since then her business has increased several times over. Today she is asking for a new loan for the purchase of rice because she can purchase it at a good price and earn a good profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Бахрихон уже 4 года занимается куплей продажей риса. Как известно рис является незаменимым продуктом в таджикских семьях, ведь из него готовится всем известный таджикский плов. Бахрихон 42 года, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Рис она покупает оптом на местных рынках, и еще она ездит в соседний Кыргызстан на оптовый рынок. Ее рабочий день начинается рано утром и продолжается до самого вечера. У нее много постоянных клиентов и ее прибыль можно сказать постоянна. Год назад она обратилась в Микроинвест и получила свой первый займ. Ее бизнес с тех пор увеличился в несколько раз. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ на закупку риса, потому что цена на него приемлемая и приносит хорошую прибыль.

loans.use: Expansion of current business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes business

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa Lakoh is married with four children. He runs his shop in the small town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. His wife Adamsay helps him in the management of the shop and both work cooperatively. Isa is forty-three years old and he is planning to build a family house in two years.

Isa's previous loan from SMT helped him expand his business and he now plans to diversify his stock more so that he can have more customers and income. He is requesting a loan of $350 and he feels sure he will be able to pay it back within ten months.

loans.use: Diversify inventory in his grocery store to attract more customers

loans.name: Sauban

texts.pt:
Sauban I. was born on the 21st of April, 1979, in Maputo. He attended school until the 12th grade, having studied English at the Language Institute of Maputo. He lived with his parents until he was twenty years old, at which time he became an instructor. At this point in time, he and his soon-to-be wife began living together in his parent's house. She worked at one of the firms in the city of Maputo. However, since her salary was low, she decided to start selling clothes in the province of Inhambane. This business did not survive due to the difficulty in traveling to the province.

Some months later, they decided to open a grocery store, having secured a stand and placing it beside their residence. The business prospered, and they were able to save some money. In May of 2007 they married, and the expenses far surpassed the money that Sauban had saved for the event. This forced him to use his savings from his business. Through a friend, he became acquainted with Hluvuku and asked for a loan of 600 dollars to purchase merchandise to increase his stock. This business greatly affects his family. By increasing the rent, he is able to cover his expenses, and now, he is renovating his house. Within the community, he has created work for one person and reduced the distance required by his neighbors to access a grocery store. In the future, he hopes to purchase a phone and start a take-out business.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Sauban I., nasceu em 21 de Abril de 1979 em Maputo, estudou ate 12ªclasse tendo feito de seguida o curso da língua Inglesa no Instituto de Línguas de Maputo. Viveu com os seus pais ate aos 20 anos, altura em que aranjou o emprego como professor, ainda nessa altura, junta se com a sua esposa e passaram a morar juntos distante dos pais. A esposa consegue um emprego numas das empresas da cidade de Maputo, mas porque o salario era baixo, decide iniciar o negócio de venda de roupa na provincia de Inhambane, cuja actividade durou muito pouco tempo devido a dificuldade de transporte para aquela provincia.

Alguns meses depois decide iniciar o negócio da venda de Produtos da primeira necessidade tendo arranjado um estabelecimento móvel e colocado junto do prédio onde reside. O negocio prosperou tendo conseguido juntar algum dinheiro. Em Maio de 2007 casou se com a sua Esposa e as despesas do casamento foram acima do valor que juntara para o efeito, facto que lhe obrigou a usar o fundo de reserva do seu negocio. Atraves de um amigo ficou a saber da existencia da Hluvuku , tendo solicitado o valor de 15.000,00mt e com este valor pretende comprar produtos para aumentar stock. Este negocio tem um impacto positivo na sua familia uma vez que, aumenta a renda cobrindo todas despesas e agora esta reabilitando sua casa . E para a Comunidade, alem de ter criado posto de trabalho para uma pessoa, reduz a distancia uma vez que os seus vizinhos adquirem produtos da primeira necessidade perto poupando deste modo o tempo. Futuramente pretende comprar um telefone publico e iniciar um novo negocio de take away.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

payments.comment: Sauban successfully repaid this loan in advance.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata K. is forty-five years of age and married with six children. Aminata runs a dried fish business in the market in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  Her previous loan from SMT helped her buy fish wholesale and now she sells both wholesale and retail.  She would like an additional loan to enable her buy more fish and sell even more wholesale.  Her goal is to continue to provide her children with education and other basic needs.  Eventually, she also would like to build a mud brick house for herself and her children.

loans.use: Purchase stock of fish to sell wholesale

loans.name: Idalina Antonio

texts.pt:
Idalina Antonio Agripa T. is married with 2 children. She is 41 years old, and she was born in CaT. and lived with her parents until she was 14 years old. She completed the 4th grade at CaT.'s Primary School in the 1970s, and later she continued her studies at Maxaquene's Secondary School, attending 5th and 6th grade. Due to difficulties in travel, she had to live with her uncle in Liberdade, where she attended the 7th grade at the Josina Machel Secondary School, finally completing the 8th grade some years later. In 1989, she met her husband and began living with her in-laws in Malhangalene. She learned to make sweet and savory snacks, which she sold to nearby bakeries and gas stations.

In 1995, she rented a house in Benfica on the outskirts of the city of Maputo and continued producing and selling sweet and savory snacks. Her first job was at the Mobil-Benfica gas station where she worked as a gas attendant for a week. Four months later she oversaw the shop and then worked as a cashier, advancing due to her dedication and responsibility. Later she became the take-out manager until the owners decided to sell the business and she was left without a job for a year. Meanwhile, since she was considering starting her own business, she discovered semi-abandoned lodgings and began renting them. Without any financial resources, she decided to ask for a loan from Hluvuku, whom she came to know through her brother. She employs 2 workers, contributing to the reduction in the unemployment rate.

Her first loan of 400 dollars increased the volume of her business and allowed her to pay off the loan without any problems. With the loan of 800 dollars, she intends to increase her business by acquiring more merchandise and advancing the payment on her rents so that she does not have to be concerned with any obligations.

Idalina's business greatly impacts the community by alleviating drivers in their search for drinks and sandwiches, for the lodgings are localized in a passenger terminal and create a dining culture that provides greater security and hygiene. This business helps support familial expenses, pay for her children's expenses, and save for the future. In the future, she hopes to have her own business, construct a grocery store, and supply a more diverse product to her customers.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Idalina António Agripa T., casada maritalmente tem 2 filhos, 41 anos de idade, nasceu na CaT. e viveu com os pais até aos 14 anos onde concluiu a 4ª classe na Escola Primária da CaT. nos anos 70, e mais tarde continuou na Escola Secundária da Maxaquene frequentando a 5ª e 6ª classe, e devido a dificuldades de travessia teve que viver com o tio na Liberdade, frequenta a 7ª classe na Escola Secundária Josina Machel isto no curso pós laboral até que anos mais tarde veio a concluir a 8ª classe. Em 1989 conhece o marido e passou a viver com os sogros na Malhangalene e ela aprendeu a fazer doces e salgados que os entregava nas pastelarias e bombas de combustíveis mais próximos.

No ano de 1995 aluga uma casa no Benfica arredores da Cidade de Maputo e continua a confecionar doces e salgados e vendia-os a retalho. Teve o 1º emprego nas Bombas da Móbil-Benfica e trabalhou como Bombeira uma semana e 4 meses mais tarde passou como vigilante na loja e depois passou a trabalhar como caixa devido a dedicação e responsabilidade e dalguma maneira granjeava simpatia pelos patrões. Depóis mais tarde ficou como gerente do Take Away até altura que os proprietários decidem vende-lo e obviamente ela fica desempregada durante um ano. No entanto como estava decidida a ter negócio próprio descobre instalações semi abandonadas e aluga-as e como não tinha recursos financeiros decide pedir credito a Hluvuku atravéis do irmão que é cliente.Emprega actualmente 2 trabalhadores contribuindo para redução dos índices já elevados de desemprego.

Teve o 1º crédito de 10.000 MT com o qual aumentou o seu volume de negócio tendo amortizado sem sobressaltos. Com o crédito de 20.000,00 MT pretende incrementar os seus negócio adquirindo mais mercadoria e adiantar o pagamento das rendas instalacoes de forma a trabalhar por um periodo longo sem contar com quaisqueres obrigações. A actividade desenvolvida por esta cliente tem impacto na comunidade pois alivia os transportadores de passageiros para compra de refeições e sandes, pois as instalações estão localizadas na terminal de passageiros e cria também cultura das pessoas consumirem em locais apropriados com melhores condicções de segurança e higiene. Consegue com a actividade aliviar algumas despesas familiares, escolarização das crianças e poupar algum dinheiro para os tempos dificéis. No futuro aspira ter instalações próprias , construir uma mercearia e diversificar ainda mais os produtos a fornecer aos clientes.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereal business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata T. started her business ten years ago on a very small scale. She sells mainly agricultural products such as rice, peanut butter, onions, etc. At forty years old, Aminata has five children and is responsible for providing her family with basic needs as her husband is jobless. Currently she has a stock of palm oil worth $200 and is a member of a rotating savings club.

Aminata plans to invest her small savings to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of $350 to add to what she has saved in order to purchase her business items wholesale from Guinea. She expects more profit to help build up her working capital after loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase stock of food items wholesale

loans.name: Bernadete Margarida

texts.pt:
Bernardete Margarida Dhorsam was born in Maputo. She is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She lived with her parents in Beira until she was 12 years old. She completed the 5th grade in the 1970s. After the 1975 Independence, she returned to Maputo and lived in Machava for 3 months, and afterwards, her parents bought a house in the city of Matola. There she took some courses in embroidery and sewing. After her marriage, her husband worked at Nacala-Porto for 4 years. She worked at a restaurant in the hotel from which they rented making sweet and savory snacks. Later she divorced, and since she was unemployed, she started living with her parents in Matola. Her sister, who lived in the city of Maputo, had a kitchen where she made custard and coconut cakes and delicacies and sold them to Polana gas stations. She would be payed weekly, and thus she began to gain customers and many requests for aniversary cakes, buffets, and decorative work. Shell contacts her for lunches and event planning. Since her sister had a shortage of financial resources, she hired Bernardete.

She worked 9 years as a caterer for her brother-in-law until 2002. However, since her way of life did not improve, she decided to leave her job and form a partnership with a South African couple in a restaurant in Matola for 8 months. At the end of 2003, she leaves the partnership and rents a bar in Matola for some time and then buys an oven to produce arrufadas (a type of cake), which she distributes at schools.

She meets her husband in 2004, and he works at a food supply for the workers of Mozal. This is when they decided to build a kitchen in the garden of their house, producing sweet and savory snacks. Bernadete met Hluvuku through friends and asked for a loan of 1,200 dollars to increase the volume of stock. She employs 3 workers, one female, and contributes to the reduction of unemployment and poverty.

Her business greatly impacts the community by reducing the travel time for the delivery of pastry items. She also acts as an alternative to her customers, especially institutions and other organizations, when they host seminars, conferences, etc. In the future, she would like to own a van to transport product for distribution to her customers. She would also like to have her own lodgings, employ more people, and increase her business while also maintaining and improving the quality of her products.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardete Margarida Dhorsam, nasceu em Maputo tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente, tem 2 filhos e viveu com os pais na Beira até aos 12 anos onde concluiu a 5ª classe na década 70. Após a Independência em 1975 volta a Maputo e passou viver na Machava uns 3 meses e depois os pais compraram uma residência na Cidade de Matola e fez alguns cursos de estilismo, bordados, corte e costura. Depois de casada o marido teve emprego em Nacala-Porto durante 4 anos e no Hotel onde alugavam havia um restaurante e ela dedicava suas energias no fabrico de doces e salgados e mais tarde divorcia-se passando a viver com os Pais na Matola e como era desempregada, a irmã que vivia na cidade de Maputo dispensa uma cozinha para confeccionar bolos de nata e coco, delícias e os entregava nas Bombas do Polana. e estes pagavam semanalmente, assim começou a ganhar clientes e as pessoas contactavam-na para encomendas (Bolos de aniversários, montagem Buffet volante e trabalhos de decoração) que lhes valeu muita clientela. A Shell contacta para fornecer lanches e organizar eventos e como tinha escassez de recursos financeiros a irmã decide apoiá-la.

Trabalhou durante 9 anos com empregada de Cathering na firma do seu cunhado até 2002, e como a vida dela não melhorava decide deixar o emprego e firma uma sociedade com um casal Sul Africano num restaurante na Matola durante 8 meses e nos finais de 2003 deixa de ser sócio e aluga um bar ainda na Matola onde explorara por pouco tempo e decide comprar um forno para fabrico de arrufadas que os distribuía pelas escolas.

Conhece seu actual marido em 2004 e este ganha um trabalho fornecimento de comidas aos trabalhadores da empresa Mozal é quando decidem montar uma cozinha no quintal de sua residência, porém ela não deixou de fazer doces e salgados que os fornecia aos diversos clientes seus. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através de amigas, tendo se dirigido e solicitar um empréstimo de 30.000,00 MT. Com este crédito pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos e ter um stock. Emprega actualmente 3 trabalhadores dos quais uma mulher, contribuindo para redução da pobreza e desemprego.

O impacto da actividade é visível pois encurta a distancia para compra de produtos pasteleireiros por encomendas, cria uma alternativa para os clientes sobretudo para as instituições e outras organizações quando tem seminários, conferencias, etc. No futuro gostava de ter uma carrinha fechada para transporte de produtos confeccionados para distribuição pelos clientes, ter instalações próprias, empregar mais pessoas, alargar mais o negócio mantendo e melhorar a qualidade.

loans.use: To increase stock in her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her animal feed business

loans.name: Alice Angelo

texts.pt:
Alice Angelo Covela was born on the 26th of February, 1959. She is a native of Maputo and a daughter of a police officer and a homemaker. She attended school until the 8th grade. She started working at the age of 27. Although due to sickness, she had to abandon her job. Later, her godfather offered her a kiosk, which she left to construct a small commercial establishment near the Ferroviario club in 1986. In 2003, the municipal council destroyed the building. That same year she rented a stand at the People's Market.

Through a cousin, Alice came to know Hluvuku-Adsema and asked for a loan of 1,000 dollars to invest in her business. With a previous loan, she was able to improve the conditions of her business, increasing qualitatively and quantitavely the meals she prepares. She has 2 establishments, the second localized in the Maxaquene district. This establishment allows her to work later hours. The establishment located in the People's Market must close by 7pm, the time when she has the most customers. The community is greatly impacted by this business; beyond providing food to local workers, her income allows her to support 5 people and employ two kitchen workers.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Alice Ângelo Covela, nascida em 26 de Fevereiro de 1959, natural de Maputo, filha de Pai Policia e mãe domestica, estudou ate oitava classe. Começou a trabalhar aos 27 anos, onde por motivo de doença teve que abandonar o emprego. Mais tarde o seu padrinho ofereceu lhe um quiosque onde começou a praticar a actividade que até agora desenvolve, alienou esse estabelecimento e foi construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no recinto do clube Ferroviário em 1986 onde veio a sair em 2003 com a destruição das mesmas pelo conselho Municipal. No mesmo ano ela foi alugar uma banca No Mercado do Povo onde até então desenvolve a sua actividade.

Por intermédio de uma prima sua e que é cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema informou se sobre os requisitos e recorrendo a um empréstimo de 15 000,00mt para reforçar deste modo o seu negocio. Com o empréstimo de 25.000,00mt melhorou cada vez mais as condições de atraçao de clientes no seu estabelecimento tendo aumentado qualitativamente e quantitativamente as refeições que confeciona. Conta actulamente com 2 estabelecimentos e que o segundo está localizado no bairro de Maxaquene. Este, permite-lhe trabalhar até mais tarde já que no Mercado do Povo onde está localizado o 1º estabelecimento, não é permitido trabalhar acima das 19 horas e sendo este, o momento em que regista maior afluxo de clientes. A actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois para além de fornecer refeições aos funcionários que trabalham a redor do mercado, com os rendimentos consegue sustentar 5 pessoas que estão na sua responsabilidade e dar emprego a duas serventes de cozinha com quem trabalha.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

payments.comment: Alice has successfully decided to repay this loan is advance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereal supply business

loans.name: Atalia

texts.pt:
Atalia Chirinzane was born on the 2nd of March, 1959, in Xai Xai in the Gaza province. She attended school only until the 5th grade because her parents lacked the resources to support her studies. At 10 years old, she and her parents moved to Maputo, to where her father's work was transferred. At 19 years old, her father died, and she was left to live with her mother. Life became extremely difficult. At the age of 22, she and her husband moved in together. Since her husband's salary was insufficient, in 1999 she started selling wood. Through a friend, she came to know Hluvuku and asked for a loan of 800 dollars to purchase more wood in order to increase the volume of her sales.

This business has made a positive and visible impact on this family. It has allowed them to rent an apartment and purchase a vehicle, which her husband uses for his taxi service. The community has been impacted also by this business, which supplies quality wood for the production of furniture and construction of houses. In the future, after fortifying her business with the loan, she intends to construct a house for her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Atalia Chirinzane , nascido em 2 de Marco de 1959 em Xai Xai na provincia de Gaza, apenas estudou ate 5ªclasse isto porque os seus pais nao tinham condicoes para suportar os seus estudos . Com 10 anos muda-se com os pais de gaza para Maputo onde o pai fora transferido em missão de servico. Aos 19 anos falece o pai ficando a viver com a Mãe, a vida tornou se muito difícil até que aos 22 anos junta se com seu marido com qual tem três filhos e vivem juntos até agora. Porque os rendimentos do Marido não eram suficientes , em 1999 inicia o negocio de venda de Madeira . Atravez de uma amiga , ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado o montante de 20.000,00mt para compra de mais tábuas de madeira aumentando deste modo o volume do seu negocio.

Este negócio, tem impacto positivo e visivel na familia uma vez que na base deste, foi capaz de comprar uma Flat a qual está a arendar, aumentando deste modo a renda familiar , também comprou uma viatura com a qual o marido faz servico de Taxi. Tambem tem impacto na Comunidade pelo facto de fornecer Madeira de qualidade para o fábrico da mobilia e para habitação. Futuramente, uma vez fortificado o seu negocio através do empréstimo, pretende construir mais uma casa para os filhos.

loans.use: To increase stock of wood in her business

loans.name: Nehemias Vasco

texts.pt:
Nehemias Vasco C. was born on the 17th of April, 1952. He is a native of Magude and a son of a miner and homemaker. He attended school until the 7th grade and then moved to Germany, returning in 1981 having studied up until the equivalent of the 9th grade. After returning, he joined EQUIMEP in the Niassa province. He worked until 1991 and then transferred jobs to the municipal counsel of Maputo, formerly the executive counsel, where he worked until December 2005. At this time, he stopped working due to an infirmary and retired.

Since 1998, he developed small businesses at his home until 2004, when he purchased a small commercial establishment at the Maguiguana Market where he works to this day. Through a friend who was a client of Male Yeru, he sought a loan of 600 dollars, which he used to reinforce his business, and payed it off without any problems. With the current loan of 800 dollars, he intends to increase his stock, which will allow him to meet his customers' demands. His goal is to open a small shop in his home to alleviate his movements from constant foot pain. His business makes a positive impact by suppling the population with food and employing a person who helps with sales. His income from the business allows him to support his childrens' studies at the university.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Nehemias Vasco C., nascido em 17 de Abril de 1952, natural de Magude, filho de Pai Mineiro e mãe domestica, estudou ate sétima classe e foi para Alemanha onde regressou em 1981 com equivalência de nona classe. Apos seu regresso, ingressou na EQUIMEP na provincia do Niassa, trabalhou ate 1991 quando mudou de emprego para o Conselho Municipal de Maputo Outrora Conselho Executivo onde trabalhou ate Dezembro de 2005 altura em que por motivo de doença teve que interromper o trabalho passando para o regime de aposentado.

Desde 1998 desenvolvia pequenos negócios em casa até 2004 altura em que comprou um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no Mercado Maguiguana onde até então desenvolve a sua actividade. Por intermédio de um amigo seu e que era cliente da Male Yeru recorreu a um 1º empréstimo de 15 000,00mt com o qual reforçou o seu negócio, tendo concluido sem sobressalto. Com o empréstimo de 20 000,00MT pretende reforçar o stock o que lhe permite satisfazer a demanda e exigências dos seus clientes. Tem como perspectiva abrir uma pequena mercearia em casa uma vez que tem problemas de dor dos pés o que até certo ponto limita lhe as suas deslocações. Contudo, a sua actividade tem um impacto positivo uma vez que abastece as populações em alimentos para além de que com o rendimento consegue sustentar os estudos dos 2 filhos que estão na Universidade e dar emprego a uma pessoa que lhe ajuda nas vendas.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

payments.comment: Nehemias has successfully decided to repay this loan is advance.

loans.name: Hercilia Madalena

texts.pt:
Hercilia Madalena T. was born on the 27th of July, 1975, in Maputo. Her parents separated when she was only 5 years old, and she started living with her father. She attended school until the 10th grade, and at the age of 19 she met her husband, with whom she would have 2 children. At the age of 23 she decided to start a business to increase the family's income. She worked several jobs and was most successful selling clothes, which she practices to this day. She thought about renting a store where she could sell her clothes, but she had insufficient funds. Through a friend, she met Hluvuku and asked for a loan of 1,2000 dollars to continue with her store project, having decided to work arduously at building savings to help her further her store.

This business has a positive impact on her family, helping her husband support their children and allowing them to purchase a car, which will greatly help her business in traveling for purchases to South Africa and in her deliveries. Her business' impact on the community is also positive. By supplying clothing at reasonable prices to her community, she saves her neighbors time and money from travelling to South Africa. Selling clothes door-to-door is very demanding, and in the future, she intends to build a shop where she can display her clothing.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Hercilia Madalena T., nascida em 27 de julho de 1975 em Maputo, seus pais separam se quando ela tinha apenas 5 anos e passou a viver com o pai. Estudou ate 10ªclasse, aos 19 anos junta se com seu marrido o qual praticava os seus negocios, com o qual tiveram dois filhos. Aos 23 anos decide iniciar o negócio para aumentar a renda familiar, fez vários tipos de negócios tendo tido sucesso no negócio de roupa o qual pratica ate entao . Pensou em alugar uma loja onde pudesse colocar as suas roupas mas, não tinha fundo suficiente e, através de uma amiga, ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado emprestimo no valor de 30.000,00 MT e com este valor não foi suficiente para continuar com o projecto da loja tendo decidido continuar a trabalhar arduamente no sentido de fazer crescer este fundo e que futuramente poderá continuar com este projecto da loja.

Este negocio tem impacto positivo na sua família uma vez que consegue ajudar o marido no sustento dos filhos e na base deste negocio esta comprando um carro faltando pagar a ultima prestação o qual irá ajudar lhe muito no seu negocio uma vez que faz compras na Africa do sul e também lhe ajudará nas entregas. Na comunidade também tem impacto positivo pelo que fornece roupas sem que as pessoas se desloquem a africa do sul ou a cidade para adquiri las poupando lhes o tempo e dinheiro assim como lhes cria facilidades de pagamento. Futuramente pretende construir uma loja onde poderá colocar as suas roupas uma vez que é transtornante e despendioso trabalhar em regime ambulatório.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

payments.comment: Hercilia has repaid back this loan in full. She has actually paid higher installments every months and this week made a payment of $150.

loans.name: Elisabete

texts.pt:
Elisabete P. is married with 2 children. She was born in Machangulo-Matutuine and is 35 years old. Due to a lack of financial resources she only attended school until the 3rd grade at the Education Center of Chiango. In her spare time she would help her mother cut wood and collect almonds for sale. The money she made helped her support her family. In 1990 she met her husband in Costa do Sol where they lived and had two daughters. In 1997 she moved to Matutuine and started a commercial business with her husband purchasing products in bulk and selling it at retail to the local community. Due to the lack of a Secondary School in Filipe for her children, they decided to move to Catembe, in the village of Chali, where they built a house and a commercial establishment with local products.

She and her husband manage the business personally and in their absence their children assume the responsibility. To supply the best, high-quality products to their customers, they decided to ask Hluvuku for a loan. With the loan of 400 dollars, they intend to increase the volume of their business by acquiring more products and guaranteeing a sufficient stock to meet customer demands. The business has a positive impact on the local community by providing groceries close to the community and at affordable prices. With the income from the business they are able to suport their childrens' studies and sustain the family. In the future, they hope to build a house and shop and own a vehicle for the transport of their products.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisabete P. casada maritalmente tem 2 filhas, nasceu em Machangulo-Matutuíne, tem actualmente 35 anos de idade, devido a falta de recursos financeiros estudou até a 3ª classe em 1986 no Centro Educacional de Chiango, e nos tempos livres ajudava a mae no corte de lenha, coleta de amenjoas para vender e ter algum dinheiro para sustento da familia.Em 1990 conheceu o marido na Costa do Sol onde viveram e teve duas filhas e no ano de 1997 veio viver em Matutuine e iniciam a actividade de comercio juntamente com o marido comprando produtos a grosso e retalho revendendo a comunidade local. Devido a falta duma Escola Secundária em Filipe para as crianças continuarem a estudar, decidem passar a viver em Catembe, concretamente no bairro Chali onde construiram uma casa e estabelecimento comercial com material local, dando assim continuidade a actividade comercial.

Ela e o marido gerem pessolamente o negócio e na ausência destes, as filhas ficam como responsáveis. Para satisfazer a maior procura dos produtos da primeira necessidade pelos clientes decidem pedir credito a Hluvuku. Com o crédito de 10.000 MT pretendem aumentar o volume do seus negocio adquirindo mais produtos e garantir um stock suficiente para rersponder as necessidades da sua clientela. A sua actividade tem impacto positivo póis além de abastecer a comunidade local em produtos da primeira necessidade, coloca os mesmos mais perto da comunidade e a preços bastantes acessiveis. Com o rendimento do empreendimento consegue por as crianças a estudar, sustentar familiar. No futuro almeja construir casa e uma mercearia em material convencional e se possivel ter um carro para transporte de produtos.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Victória

texts.pt:
Vitoria Chauque was born 49 years ago in the district of Chibuto-Gaza. She is widowed with 5 children. She also takes care of her husband's four other children. She grew up with her grandmother and attended school until the 4th grade. Years later her grandmother died, and she began living with her uncle in Xiquelene on the outskirts of the city of Maputo where she met her husband. Later, she had a traditional marriage and moved along with her husband to Manchica where he worked. Due to the nature of her husband's military work she was forced to live in various areas. After the 1992 ceasefire, her husband transferred to the Catembe Artillery School, and she started living in Catembe with her family. Through her own motivation she started her own stand selling tomatoes, onions, almonds, etc. against her husband's wishes.

After 2000, her husband recognized the significant contribution that Vitoria's business was making toward the family's rent, and he decide to ask Hluvuku for a loan to construct a small commercial establishment. He helped Vitoria purchase products to develop her business, and since then, they have sought larger purchases. It was through her first husband that she came to know Hluvuku, but after his death, she saw no other alternative to maintaining her business without the help of Hluvuku. Her first credit was used to increase the volume of her business with various products, and she payed off the loan without any problems. With the current loan of 400 dollars, she intends to purchase her product in greater quantity and to diversify her business more.

This business' impact on the community is a positive one. She reduces the distance required to purchase everyday products in a community that faces a great lack of public transport. She manages her business personally. In her absence, her daughter watches over the business. Her income allows her to support her family and educate her children. She hopes to improve her business by supplying the it with a variety of products for retail or bulk sale.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Vitória C. nasceu a 49 anos no distrito de Chibuto-Gaza, viúva , tem 5 filhos e ainda responsabiliza-se no cuidado de mais 4 criancas que o marido teve com outra mulher, cresceu e viveu com a Avó, estudou até a 4ª classe mas com muitas dificuldades, isto na decada 60. Anos mais tarde a avó veio a falecer e teve que passar a viver com o tio no Xiquelene arredores da Cidade de Maputo onde conhece o seu marido e mais tarde foi casada tradicionalmente e rumou para viver com ele na Manhica onde ele trabalhava. Devido a natureza de trabalho do marido como militar foi sujeita a viver em varios locais. Depois do cessar fogo em 1992 o marido e transferido para trabalhar na Catembe-Escola prática de Artilharia terrestre e ela passa a viver na catembe com sua família e montou por iniciativa propria uma banca onde vendia tomate, cebola, amendoim,etc embora contra vontade do marido.

Depois de 2000 o marido por ver que o negocio dela contribui significativamente na renda da familia, ele decide com credito da HLUVUKU construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial e ajudou-a na compra de produtos para desenvolver o negócio, e apartir dessa altura a procura foi cada vez maior.Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku atraveis do falecido marido que era cliente e logo depois ao falecimento ela nao viu outra alternativa para manter o negócio e decide procurar a Hluvuku para dar contiunuidade com a actividade pois enfrentava muitas dificuldades.Teve o 1º crédito onde aumentou o volume do seus negocio apetrachando o estabeleciemnto com vários produtos e pagou sem sobressaltos. Com o crédito de 10.000 MT pretende impulsionar o negócio comprando produtos em sacos de 25 e 50 kgs respectivamente e diversificar ainda mais em outros produtos.

A actvidade desenvolvida pela cliente tem impacto bastante positivo na comunidade póis reduz as distancias para a aquisicao dos produtos da primeira necessidade numa comunidade que atravessa sérios problemas de falta de meios de transporte. Ela desenvolve a actividade pessoalmente e na sua ausencia fica a sua filha e com os rendimentos consegue sustentar familiar e educar as criancas.A perspectiva futura é melhorar as instalacoes, apetrechar o estabelecimento com produtos diversos tanto a retalho como a grosso.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

payments.comment: Victoria has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Albino Pinto

texts.pt:
Albino Pinto M. was born in 1964. He is a native of Chiure, Cabo Delgado province. He is a son of fieldworkers, and he is a father of 2 children. He attended school until the 7th grade and was recruited to obligatory military service. He transfered to the city of Maputo where he continued his studies until the third year of Comercial school and obtained a house. In 2000 he sold his house and moved to the Bagamoyo village where he resides until this day. With the money from the sale of his house, he built another house and developed his water business. The architect's miscalculations of the structure caused the water tanks to collapse, and Albino lost his investment. Still, he continued with his project, and with the help of some friends, he was able to purchase a new water tank. He also came to know Hluvuku and asked him for a loan, increasing the number of tanks to two. With his second loan he purchased a pump with greater capacity and increased the number of tanks by one, subsequently increasing the number of customers. With the current loan of 1,200 dollars he intends to purchase more tanks and tubes.

He services 91 clients with fixed contracts, and another 300 people benefit from his business. He hopes to invest in other villages where the community suffers from diverse sicknesses due to a lack of natural water. This business helps him support the six people who are his responsibility. He pays the salaries of 2 workers, and helps support the reduction in the country's unemployment rate.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Albino Pinto M., nascido em 1964, natural de Chiure Província de Cabo Delgado, filho de Pais camponeses, pai de 2 filhos estudou ate sétima classe e foi recrutado para servico militar obrigatorio, tendo sido transferido para Cidade de Maputo onde veio continuar com os estudos até terceiro ano Comercial e adquiriu uma casa por alienação. Em 2000 vendeu a casa e mudou-se para o Bairro de Bagamoyo onde reside até então. Com o dinheiro da venda de casa construiu outra e com o valor remanescente dicidiu abrir um furo de água para fazer face a escassez de água potável que se atravessa naquele bairro.
