O mau cálculo da estrutura por parte do técnico causou o desabamento dos tanques e perda do investimento aplicado. Mesmo assim continuou com seu projecto e com ajuda de alguns amigos conseguiu comprar um outro tanque retomando a actividade. Através de colegas conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema tendo recorrido a um empréstimo de 25.000,00mt e aumentou para 2 o numero de tanques de abastecimento. Com o segundo empréstimo de 42.000,00mt comprou uma bomba com maior capacidade e aumentou mais um tanque e consequentimente o numero de clientes. Com o empréstimo de 30.000,00MT pretende comprar mais tanques e tubos para alastrar cada vez mais a sua rede, visto que a procura deste precioso líquido é cada vez maior.

Conta actualmente com 91 clientes com contractos fixos e com cerca de 300 que se abastecem directamente das fontanárias instaladas em sua residência. Tem como perspectiva investir noutros bairros onde o as comunidade sofrem devido a falta de água potável. O seu projecto é de vital importância pois abastece a comunidade em água potável evitado de certa forma várias doenças de natureza hídrica , resultante da falta de água potável e/ou consumo de água imprópria, por outro lado incurta as distãncias para aquisição deste precioso líquido. Na sua vida pessoal este projecto incrementa a renda ajudando-lhe a sustentar 6 pessoas que estão na sua responsabilidade e para além de pagar salários a 2 (dois) trabalhadores que emprega ate então, participando deste modo para a redução do elevado índice de desemprego que assola o país.

loans.use: To buy pipes for his water business

loans.name: Flora Beatriz

texts.pt:
Flora Beatriz M. was born on the 3rd of November, 1974, in Maputo. She lived part of her childhood with her parents. In 1987, her father died, and she was now under the care of her mother. She attended school until the 7th grade. While she studied, she also managed a business. At 16 years old she became pregnant, which forced her to discontinue her studies and focus on the business to gaurentee sustenance to her child, especially since her boyfriend had abandoned her. In 1991, she became pregnant a second time, birthing twins.

She had been in the business world for a long time. When she was young, her mother gave her money to start her own business. She has built a house alongside her business, and she lives currently with her three children. Through a friend, she came to know Hluvuku and asked for a loan of 675 dollars to purchase products to strengthen her business capital. In the future, she intends to construct a house to rent becasue she considers this a secure investment.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Flora Beatriz M., nascido no dia 3 de Novembro de 1974 em Maputo, passou uma parte da sua infância junto dos seus pais . Em 1987 faleceu o pai ficando sob cuidados da Mãe, estudou até 7ªclasse .Enquanto estudava tambem fazia negócio, aos 16 anos fica grávida facto que lhe fez deixar de estudar para se dedicar apenas no negócio para garantir o sustento do filho já que o homem que lhe engravidara já a tinha abandonado. Em 1991 fica novamente grávida com outro homem tendo em 2000 nascido gêmeos.

Segundo ela, entrou no mundo de negócio a muito tempo e ainda nova sua mãe foi quem lhe deu dinheiro para iniciar o negócio.Tendo construído uma casa do tipo dois na base do negócio, vive actualmente com os seus três filhos. Atravês de uma amiga ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo, tendo solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de produtos o que vai reforçar o capital de trabalho. Futuramente pretende construir mais uma casa para arendar porque considera que é um investimento seguro.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana is 66 and the single mother of three. Her children sell candies on buses. They live together in a humble house in Asunción. Viviana spends her mornings caring for the home and cooking for her children and grandchildren before going out in the afternoon to collect paper, cardboard and plastic for recycling, returning home around midnight. She has supported herself and her family this way for twenty years. She is a member of the TECOJOJA Women Entrepreneurs' Committee, a group of 15 small-business owners who borrow cooperatively from this foundation. She hopes to use this loan to buy a new, larger handcart to use collecting recycling.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Viviana es una señora de 66 años, soltera y madre de 3 hijos que trabajan vendiendo caramelos en los ómnibus; todos viven en una humilde casa ubicada en un barrio de Asunción. La señora se dedica a la recolección de papeles, cartones y plásticos para su posterior venta a una planta recicladora. Ella sale de su casa a trabajar después del mediodía, ya que antes se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y cocina para el almuerzo de sus hijos y nietos. Luego de recorrer los barrios con su carrito, ella vuelve a la casa cerca de la medianoche. Hace 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo, y con esto logra sustentar su casa. Doña Viviana forma parte del grupo de micro empresarial llamado “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras TECOJOJA”, formada por 15 mujeres que responden por los préstamos obtenidos de la fundación de forma solidaria. Hoy Vivian desea un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de un carrito nuevo, pues el que tiene ahora es pequeño y desea adquirir uno más grande.

loans.use: To buy a handcart for recycling collection.

loans.name: Oscar Elvin

texts.es:
I sell seafood in the street in the city of San Lorenzo where I live. As you can see in my photo I sell fresh seafood by the pound during the day. I have had this business for 2 years, but now I need to buy a bigger cooler to keep my seafood on ice. I have plans to expand my business by setting up a permanent place where people can come to buy my seafood. I hope that you can help me achieve my goal.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de mariscos en la calle en la ciudad de San Lorenzo donde yo vivo. Como ustedes podran ver mi foto vendo por libra mariscos frescos del dia. Este negocio lo tengo hace 2 años, pero ahora necesito comprar una hielera mas grande para tener mi mariscos con hielo. Tengo planes de ingrementar mi negocio poniendo un lugar estable donde me puedan ir a comprar. Me gustaria que me puedan ayudar para poder logar mi meta.

loans.use: To purchase a cooler, ice and seafood

loans.name: Boboeva

texts.ru:
G. Boboeva has been a MLF MicroInvest borrower for a year. Her business is comprised of selling traditional Tajiki dastrahans (tablecloths). Sales are strong and profits are good. The profits from her business support her family.

Recently her husband returned from Russia where he was earning money and started to help her in her business. One year ago she turned to MLF MicroInvest in order to take out a loan. The partnership is helpful to G. and her business is slowly expanding. Right now she is asking for a new loan of $800 payable over 10 months to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To expand her existing business

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Sharofat is married and has 2 children. She has been borrowing money from MLF MicroInvest for 2.5 years. During this time her business of selling men’s and teen clothing has undergone substantial changes. She has been able to expand her inventory and now has many regular clients.

Sharofat has a secondary education and after finishing school she did not work anywhere. Her husband also does not have a job and her business became the main source of income for Sharofat. She plans on using the loan to expand her inventory of summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Шарофат кредитуется в Микроинвест 2,5 года. В ее бизнесе произошли существенные изменения. Она продает мужскую и подростковую одежду и обувь, и за это время увеличила ассортимент товаров и теперь у нее много постоянных клиентов. Шарофат замужем и у нее 2 детей. Образование у нее среднее и после окончания школы она нигде не работала. Муж тоже нигде не работает и занятие предпринимательской деятельностью стало для Шарофат основным источником дохода для ее семьи. Сейчас она собирается расширить ассортимент летней одежды и для этого просит новый займ.

loans.use: Expansion of current business

loans.name: Celeste

texts.es:
Celeste is a young entrepreneur of 24. She lives with her parents in a humble home. To earn money she and her parents opened a small shop in their home. She started out selling just sugar, flour and noodles, branching out as she earned money and took out loans. Today her shop also sells coffee, bakery items and vegetables such as tomatoes, carrots and potatoes. She is a partner of the Women in Action Women Entrepreneurs Committee, a group of 20 women who borrow collectively. To continue to grow her business, Celeste would like to borrow $125 to buy milk, eggs and sugar in bulk, as these are the products her customers most demand.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Celeste es una emprendedora de 24 años, ella vive con sus padres en una humilde casa; para generar ingresos extras, ella, ayudada de sus padres, abrió una despensa ubicada en la misma casa. Empezó vendiendo solo azúcar, harina y fideos; poco a poco con las ganancias y préstamos obtenidos ella fue surtiendo su almacén. Hoy día ya posee una mayor variedad de productos entre lo que podemos citar están café, panificados, verduras como tomate, papa, zanahorias, etc. Este negocio forma parte del grupo de microempresas del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras “Mujeres en Acción”. Formada por 20 mujeres que responden por el préstamo solidariamente. Celeste está deseosa de seguir progresando y desea aumentar sus productos para la venta, para ello solicita un crédito de $125 que lo utilizará para comprar leche, huevos y azúcar en mayor cantidad ya que son estos los productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Santos Gregoria

texts.es:
I have run a grocery store in my house for three years. It is my job and how I pay for family expenses. Now I need to buy more products to stock my store and provide better service to my customers who have already asked for certain products. At my age this is the only work that I can do because in my country it is very hard for people my age to find employment. I would appreciate your help to buy the products that I need.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una pulperia hace 3 años en mi casa, este es mi trabajo y de aqui salen todos los gastos familiares. Ahora necesito comprar mas productos para poder surtirla y dar un mejor servicio ya que mis clientes me han pedido varios productos. A mi edad este es el unico trabajo que puedo hacer ya que en mi pais es bien dificl que contraten personas a mia edad. Le agradecere mucho su ayuda para poder compar mis productos

loans.use: To purchase beans, sugar, coffee, soap, etc.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is an invalid. A car crash resulted in serious injuries that caused his disability. In spite of this Bakhtiyor helps his wife in her business. His wife, Ulfat, buys dried apricots of lower quality on the market and after sorting them out resells them for better price. This is how she makes a profit. Bakhtiyor has four children and he also looks after them at home.

In order to develop their business, Bakhtiyor needed additional funds. Two years ago he received a loan from Microinvest that helped to increase his business activities for quite a while. At the present time, Bakhtiyor would like to get a second loan to expand their business further. You can see his wife Ulfat in the picture.

loans.use: to further expand their business

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.es:
Lucilla Portilla D. owns a restaurant and catering business that specializes in cooking hamburgers, steaks, and other dinner foods for birthday parties and other events.  She has owned and operated her business for 14 years and has successfully used previous loans to remodel her kitchen facilities.  Mrs. D. hopes to use future loans to buy additional food products and improve her ability to handle larger orders so that she may expand her customer base.  As her business is dependent upon filling large orders quickly, Lucilla says that additional funding will give her the necessary cash on hand to manage larger orders and scale up her business.  At the age of 49, Mrs. D. lives with her husband and two daughters (ages 11 and 12).  
Several weeks ago Mrs. D. received an order to cater for a 100 person event; she now needs $800 to buy the necessary meat, bread and vegetables.

loans.use: PURCHASE OF MEAT, BREAD AND VEGETABLES

loans.name: Higinio Luis

texts.es:
Higinio C. is 48 years old and married. He lives in Carapeguá and has four children. His wife tends a shop in their home while he sells clothing at the municipal market. Together, they manage to support the family and pay for the children’s education. Twenty one years ago Higinio opened his first shop selling clothing in front of the bus station. A few months ago he opened a stall at the municipal market selling clothing and undergarments. Demand is strong and thanks to the good location sales have started to take off. At this point he would like to expand his product line to include a greater variety of t-shirts, shirts and trousers, hoping to boost sales and better provide for his family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Higinio C. tiene 48 años, es casado, vive en Carapeguá y tiene 4 hijos. Su señora atiende una despensa que tienen en su casa y don Higinio atiende un puesto de ventas de ropas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad; con los ingresos generados pueden cubrir los gastos de la familia y el estudio de sus hijos. Higinio empezó abriendo un kiosco hace 21 años frente a la terminal de ómnibus de la ciudad; hace unos meses se decidió a montar un puesto de venta de artículos de mercería y ropas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, ya que la demanda de este rubro ha aumentado bastante en esta zona, y gracias a la buena ubicación ya ha empezado a ver sus frutos. Su meta actualmente es ampliar este negocio con la compra de mayor variedad de mercaderías como remeras, camisas, pantalones para aumentar sus ventas y consecuentemente tener mayores ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, trousers, shorts and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A., a proud Dominican mother of three and owner of De Todo Elena, provides such refreshments as coffee and juice to her community of Barrio Dubeau in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic. With this loan, Elena intends on expanding her current inventory of coffee, tea, plastic cups, and silverware to better serve her community. As a mother raising Alfonso (age 11), Naomi (age 10), and Amauri (age 21), Elena uses the income from her business to supplement her husband’s full time job.

Note: Elena is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, tea, cream, and plastic cups.

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es:
Mr. C. is married and a father of a 3-year-old child. He opened the doors of his business more than 5 years ago. At present he is requesting for a loan to supply his local grocery store with products of quality and very popular among his clientele. He plans to buy larger quantities of basic grains (rice, beans) and other products such as oil, salt, etc. since these are the products that he sells in big quantities and he has better profits. The loan will allow him to get the discounts that the providers offer by buying larger quantities, therefore he will be able to increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. C. es casado y padre de un niño de 3 años de edad, tiene más de 5 años de haber abierto las puertas de su negocio y en la actualidad está solicitando el crédito para abastecer su pulpería con productos de calidad y de gran aceptación por parte de su clientela. Tiene planeado adquirir más cantidades de granos básicos (arroz, frijoles) y otros productos como aceite, sal, etc. ya que son productos que se venden en grandes cantidades y le dejan muy buenas ganancias. El crédito le permitirá aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen los proveedores por comprar en grandes cantidades, lo cual le permitirá incrementar sus utilidades.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

payments.comment: During our lastest audit, we were unable to verify that Mr. Castillo was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full and hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Mr. Wilmer D. is an enterprising young man who is in the business of selling construction materials. The business was founded by his father more than fifteen years ago and now he is in charge of it. He is requesting for a loan to buy more new materials (cement, lime, sand, etc.) that will allow him to obtain bigger profits once these are sold. Mr. D. told us that he is very proud of his business and what satisfies him the most is to know that he has generated 4 jobs in a very poor country like Nicaragua.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Wilmer D. es un jóven emprendedor que se ha dedicado al negocio de vender materiales de construcción. El negocio fue fundado por su padre hace más de quince años y ahora él está a cargo del negocio y está solicitando el crédito para abastecerlo con nuevos materiales (cemento, cal, arena, etc.) que le permitirán obtener mayores ingresos cuando estos sean vendidos. El Sr. D. nos comentó que está muy orgulloso de su negocio y lo que más le satisface es saber que está generando 4 puestos de trabajo en un país muy pobre como Nicaragua.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

payments.comment: During our latest audit, we were unable to verify that Mr. Diaz was the actual recipient of this loan.  We are therefore repaying the balance in full.  Thank you very much and we hope that you will continue to support Kiva and its mission.  Kendall Mau.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena Ruiz D. G. is 51. She has been married for twenty years and has three children. The oldest son is a first-year law student, while the two girls are still in high school. Maria Elena hopes to see all three complete a university education. A native of Villarrica, Maria Elena moved to Carapeguá nineteen years ago with her husband, a mechanic who runs his own auto body shop. A neighbor woman taught her to weave hammocks and shawls, and since then she has dedicated herself to weaving to earn extra money for her family. Today, Maria Elena is one of the best weavers in the city. She works every day, and when she has a certain number of shawls prepared takes them to shops in the city center to sell, even selling them in neighboring cities. The business has grown in part thanks to previous lines of credit. At this time she would like to borrow $50 to buy cotton thread and cloth and expand her production to meet demand. A member of Fundación Paraguaya since December of last year, Maria Elena is part of the New Horizons Women's Union, a group of fifteen neighbors who together guarantee each loan and pledge to save 10% of their weekly payments.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Elena Ruiz D. G. tiene 51 años está casada hace 20 años, tiene 3 hijos, todos sus hijos estudian actualmente, el mayor está cursando el primer año D. la carrera D. Derecho (Leyes) y sus dos hijas todavía están en la secundaria; su mayor deseo es que puedan terminar sus estudios y obtener títulos universitarios. María Elena es oriunda D. la ciudad D. Villarrica; hace 19 años se mudó a la cuidad D. Carapeguá con su marido, quién es mecánico y tiene su propio taller D. Chapería y Pintura para vehículos. DesD. que llegó a esta ciudad, María Elena, se interesó mucho por el oficio D. tejer mantas y hamacas; las ganas D. aprender y la necesidad D. obtener ingresos extras para el sustento familiar, la llevaron a estudiar las técnicas para elaborar las mantas, fue así que le pidió a su vecina que es tejedora que le enseñe. Hoy día, María Elena es una D. las mejores tejedoras D. la ciudad, trabaja todos los días y una vez que tiene una cierta cantidad D. mantas, las lleva a vender a las tiendas del centro y D. otras ciudades aledañas a la D. Carapeguá. Gracias a créditos solicitados anteriormente ella ha podido ir creciendo, hoy día ella está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar hilos D. algodón y telas para aumentar su producción, pues la demanda D. sus mantas a aumentado considerablemente. Ella empezó con la Fundación Paraguaya en Diciembre del año pasado asociándose al Comité D. Mujeres que se formó en su barrio, y hoy día su negocio forma parte del grupo D. microempresas “Mujeres Solidarias Nuevo Horizonte”, conforman el grupo 15 socias, trabajan todas juntas, pagan semanalmente por el préstamo y generan un ahorro del 10% D. sus cuotas; la responsabilidad del crédito es solidario.

loans.use: To buy cotton thread and cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 43 years old. Her husband Santiago V. sells perfume for a living. They have three sons who attend a private high school. Ten years ago, Norma left her family and emigrated to Argentina to work. She worked as a domestic and sent money back to her husband to care for the children. In her free time, she studied hairdressing, and after several years of hard work she returned to Paraguay and used her savings to open her own hair salon. Today, her business is thriving, thanks to her own hard work and previous loans from Fundación Paraguaya. Norma is proud of her loyal customer base. At this point she is asking for a loan of $400 in order to renovate and paint the salon.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Norma, tiene 43 años D. edad, está casada con el Señor Santiago V. que se dedica a la venta D. perfumes; tienen tres hijos varones, los tres están cursan sus estudios secundarios en un colegio privado D. la ciudad. Norma nos cuenta que hace 10 años atrás tuvo que abandonar su familia y emigra a la Argentina (país limítrofe) en busca D. mejores oportunidades D. trabajo. Allá trabajo como empleada doméstica y enviaba dinero para ayudar a su marido que quedo a cargo D. los niños. En sus horas libres, Norma, estudió peluquería, y luego D. unos años D. arduo trabajo junto unos ahorros y volvió a su casa para abrir su propia peluquería. Hoy día, y gracias a su esfuerzo y créditos obtenidos en la Fundación, ella ha podido ver progresar su negocio. Posee una buena clientela formada, y está deseosa D. seguir progresando; ahora está pensando en mejorar la infraestructura D. su peluquería, para ello solicita un crédito D. $ 400 que lo utilizará para pintar y refaccionar su salón.

loans.use: To paint and renovate a hair salon.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Mrs. Obdulia is 40 years old. She is married and has a daughter aged 23. Her husband, Mr. Eleuterio Valiente, is employed in a business working leather which makes for a big part of their family's income.

Mrs. Obdulia started her own Kiosk 18 years ago. It's located in the entrance of the city of Carpeguá. Thanks to her small business and the credits she obtained, she was able to keep progressing and with her earnings she manages to pay for the studies of her only daughter -who is her greatest hope. She is hoping she can finish her studies and have a worthy profession which improves her quality of life.

Her tenacious spirit and her wishes to accomplish her goals, have been the motivation to start her workdays at 4 am, when she goes up to the municipal market which is 40 minutes away from her home to buy the products she later sells. Her neighbours admire her for her sacrifice and her clients are very content with since her products are good and the service she gives them is the best.

Because the home where they live is precarious, Obdulia needs to make a few repairs since the roof and the floor are in deplorable state and urgent repair is necessary. In order to fix them Obdulia is requesting a credit of $1000.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Obdulia tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija de 23 años. Su marido, el Sr. Eleuterio Valiente, es empleado de una empresa de curtidora de cuero quien le ayuda en gran parte con los ingresos familiares. La señora empezó su Kiosco hace 18 años atrás, tiene su puesto en la entrada misma de la ciudad de Carapeguá; gracias a su pequeño negocio y los créditos que obtuvo, ella pudo ir progresando y con sus ganancias logra pagar los estudios de su única hija, quien es su mayor esperanza, desea que esta pueda culminar sus estudios y tener una profesión digna que mejore su calidad de vida. Su espíritu luchador y deseos de cumplir sus metas, son sus motivos para empezar la jornada a las 4 am, cuando va al hasta el mercado municipal que queda a 40 minutos de su casa a adquirir los productos que luego los lleva a su local para venderlos; los vecinos la admiran pues es muy sacrificada y sus clientes quedan muy conformes pues sus productos son buenos y la atención que ella les brinda es la mejor. Como la casa en la que viven es muy precaria, Obdulia necesita hacer unas refacciones a la casa pues el techo y el piso están en estados deplorables y es necesaria una urgente refacción; para ellos Obdulia solicita el crédito de $ 1000 que lo invertirá en las mejoras de su casa.

loans.use: House repairs - changing the roof and floor

loans.name: Zayda

texts.en:
Zayda is 28 years old and was a chef in a restaurant before she got her first loan to start a vegetable stand. She imported vegetables from Arequipa and sold them from a tricycle in Juliaca. Now her vegetable business has become so successful that she has turned it over to her husband and started her own restaurant in Rinconada, a mining town based around Ananeya gold mines. Since there is no food production in Rinconada, her small restaurant utilizing fresh produce from her connections in Arequipa is very profitable.

Given a loan of $500, Zayda hopes to be able to buy more tables and larger pots so that she can capture a larger portion of the lunch rush. Long term, Zayda hopes to earn enough money to move back to Juliaca and join her husband and daughter and expand her business there. She plans on saving enough in Rinconada to send her two children to school and maintain her Juliaca business.

loans.use: Expand restaurant by purchasing more pots, pans, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Rosa Juana

texts.en: Rosa Juana sells the popular Peruvian snack ¨chicharrones¨ from her street cart. Up until a year ago she sold only soft drinks but with a microloan she was able to purchase a large frying pan and a portable stove to prepare ¨chicharrones¨. She has a reliable clientèle base along her daily sales route. With a new loan she hopes to expand and sell complete lunches along her route as she has noticed that there are no other lunch vendors in the area. She would need a loan of $325 to start this bussiness.

loans.use: Expand food business to provide complete lunches.

loans.name: Margarita Martha

texts.en: Margarita sells candy and sweets from her cart in Juliaca. She originally began selling Bolivian products because they are cheaper but recently has moved into selling domestic products. Because of the demand for national products and the increasing risk of traveling across the border she now sells only Peruvian products. She also has expanded to selling her sweets wholesale to vendors in Ananeya, a nearby goldmining town. She travels weekly to Aneneya to distribute her goods and collect payments. She needs a $600 loan to increase the quantity and variety of her products. Eventually she would like to open a store in her neighborhood, Alta Rinconada, where there are few stores currently.

loans.use: Increase variety and quality of sweets.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca J. is 38 years old and single mother of two. The oldest is 17 and is doing junior high school in a private school in town; the youngest is 4 and is her everyday companion.

Blanca, like many other women, traveled to the capital several years back in the pursuit of better working opportunities. After several years and after saving some money she came back to her hometown, San Ignacio, to open up her own business downtown. Now, she is th owner of the shoe store.

Thanks to the credits she could attain, she was able to extend her business both in physical space and merchandise in stock. She sells all kinds of footwear for children, ladies and gentlemen.

She is doing fairly well since she has almost no competition. She travels once a month to the capital to bring the merchandise she sells. Today she is wishing to keep extending her business; she also wants to sell garments for ladies and gentlemen.

For that purpose, she is requesting a credit of $300 which she will use in purchasing her first garments to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Sra. Blanca J. de 38 años de edad es madre soltera, de 2 hijos, la mayor tiene 17 años y está cursando la secundaria en un colegio privado de la ciudad; el menor tiene 4 años y es su compañero de todos los días. Blanca, al igual que muchas mujeres viajo hace varios años atrás a la capital a buscar mejores oportunidades laborales, luego de varios años y después de juntar un poco de dinero, volvió a su ciudad, San Ignacio, a abrir su propio negocio en el centro mismo de la ciudad, ella es dueña de una zapatería. Gracias a los créditos que obtenía ella pudo ir ampliando su negocio, tanto como en espacio físico así como en stock de mercaderías, ella vendo todo tipo de calzados para niños, damas y caballeros. Le va muy bien, pues no tiene casi competencia; ella viaja una vez al mes hasta la capital para traer sus mercaderías para vender. Hoy día está deseosa de seguir ampliando su negocio, por lo que desea vender también prendas para damas y caballeros, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 300 que los utilizará para comprar sus primeras prendas para la venta.

loans.use: Purchasing garments such as remeras , shirts, skirts and trousers

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en: Clemencia G. C., mother of two, began working at a pasteleria owned by her mother-in-law. Now Clemencia has launched her own business preparing and selling cakes to local primary schools who place bulk orders.  After six successful years, she expanded her business to sell ¨chuños¨, dehydrated potatoes.  She now hopes to expand her business even further to sell other varieties of potatoes.  She is asking for a $325 loan to propel her business to the next level.

loans.use: Increase the variety of potatoes sold.

loans.name: Yarisa Brea

texts.en:
Yarisa is a young woman who has decided to start her path as an entrepreneur by starting her own jewelry business. She plans on buying the jewelry in a nearby town named "Villa Consuelo" and plans on selling the items to her neighbors since she does not currently own an establishment for her to sell the merchandise.

Yarisa is married with 1 daughter named Nicauris and her husband works at a warehouse. They live in Yamasa but her community is called "La Cola". She is also a member of the military.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Rosa Julia

texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old and supports her two children, Elsa Janeth, 18 and Diego Ivan, 16.  She currently has a successful business selling holiday-specific goods, such as flowers on All-saints Day, ceramic nativity scenes around Christmas and ¨misturas serpentinas¨ during Carnival. She currently rents space during festivals to sell her crafts. Although she does not have a permanent store she has established a strong and faithful client base. She hopes that with a $325 loan she can expand her business during holiday seasons and accumulate enough savings to maintain an artisan store year-round selling both festival crafts and handmade jewelry.

loans.use: Maintain an artisan store year-round

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a woman who has been working in salons for most of her life. She wants this loan  to increase her income and expand the business. She plans on buying larger amounts of product for her to be able to sell more on a single trip. Her son helps her by buying the products for her in the city. She sells to her neighbors and the people in her community called La Cola. Amelia is married and has 8 children.

loans.use: To buy hair products for her to resell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa R., age 36, currently sells food and drinks from a street stand in Juliaca.  She is married with three children, aged 14, 4 and 2, all of whom are still living at home.  She has used her current $500 loan to increase her sales by buying more goods and offering her clients more products.  She would like an additional $525 loan to buy and sell tickets.  This would allow her to make a high profit, but she lacks the capital to begin this enterprise.

loans.use: To start a ticket agency.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a woman who has decided to go into the beauty salon business and would like a loan to start the business. She wants to use the loan to buy hair products for her to offer to her clients and offer a better service. As of now she does not own an establishment but she uses her house to offer her services to clients which are usually her neighbors. She buys the products in the city which is around 1 hour or more away since she has to take public transportation and sometimes walk. 
She is single and has 3 children

loans.use: To start a new salon and to buy hair products

loans.name: Emiliana Lucinda

texts.en: Emiliana is a single mother of seven. She works as a local vendor selling golosinas and snacks, in the streets of Juliaca and at a local market, Tupac Amaru. Emiliana has worked as a street vendor for as long as she can remember. As a young child Emiliana often helped out her mother who also sold golosinas. At the moment she works by herself and often travels to Arequipa, five hours away, to purchase her goods. She hopes that with an increased loan she will be able to purchase a greater variety of snacks, including those which are a little bit more expensive but yield a higher profit.

loans.use: Expand variety of snacks.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristine C. is 35 years old and is married to Roberto Bordon, 52. They live in their own home. Cristina is an enterprising woman. With some savings she was able to open a business in her house. She sells aromatic candles, incense, natural remedies and various other articles. Thanks to the excellent location of her home, she has made good progress in her business and her earnings. She is able to help her husband with the household expenses and the costs of her son's university studies; he is studying at a private university in the capital at considerable expense to the family.

To continue her good progress, Cristina would like to buy a wider variety of merchandise. She would like to receive a loan of $500 which she will invest in the purchase of the additional items at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cristina C. tiene 35 años de edad está casada con. Roberto Bordón de 52 años, y viven en una casa propia. Cristina es una mujer emprendedora, con unos ahorros pudo abrir un negocio en su casa donde se dedica a la venta de velas aromáticas, inciensos, remedios naturales y artículos varios; gracias a la buena ubicación de su local, ella ha podido ir progresando y con sus ganancias puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de su hijo que vive en la capital pues está estudiando en una Universidad privada que le demanda muchos gastos.

Para seguir progresando ella desea adquirir mayor variedad de mercaderías, por lo que desea adquirir un préstamo de $ 500 que los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor.

loans.use: Buy aromatic candles, handcrafted items, incense, candle holders and aromatic oils

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Keeping busy with two different businesses, Gloria has still found time to consider expansion.  Monday through Friday she runs a copy center and offers her services as a typist.  Her store is located in front of a university and receives most of her business from the students.  For the past four years since she began her business, she has experienced steady growth and recognizes the potential to expand the scale of her business.  She would like to convert her copy center into an internet café.  With her prime location for the university students, she feels it would be easy to quickly make the profit necessary to pay back her loan.  By combining the services of internet, copying and any necessary dictation, Gloria's copy center could turn into the one-stop shop for all the students' technological needs.

loans.use: Convert her copy center into an internet cafe.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad wants to start a new cafeteria. She plans to sell toasted bread, various fruit juices and sandwiches'.  She wants to start selling from her house since she doesn't own an establishment. She plans on serving clients from all around her community. She currently works as a cleaning lady in other peoples homes in Santo Domingo. She is married and has one daughter named Elainy Paola.

loans.use: To open a home based cafeteria

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en: Hermelinda comes from a fishing family. Her mom has had a fishing business for over ten years and Hermelinda just began hers around two years ago.  With the help of her loans from PRISMA she has been able to stabilize her business and find success in the local market.  She would like to use the money from a $175 loan to buy a new boat and more poles to expand her harvest.  Hermelinda and her husband spend their days together out on Lake Arapa catching fish to sell.  Meanwhile, their two children Miliana, six years-old, and Christian, eight, are just starting out in school.  Although they are too young to help with the business now, they are still able to enjoy the delicious fish their parents bring home for dinner.  With a new boat and more poles, their parents could bring home more fish to eat, and also with expanded sales, create an increased level of financial security for their future.

loans.use: Purchase a second fishing boat.

loans.name: Aura

texts.en: Aura sells in a "Ventorrillo" which is a place where she sells vegetables, and various kinds of meat. She has been in the business for almost 2 years and before that she had a stand where she sold "Pastelitos" .She goes to the market in Santo Domingo to resupply and only goes every time she needs to restock. She is married with 3 children 1 girl and 2 boys. She also has her own place to sell the goods.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Marinella Esther

texts.en:
Marinella is 38 years old and has two daughters, Flavia, 7, and Dahna, 4. Marinella sells clothing for girls. She travels every three months to Lima to purchase her inventory for the season. With her last loan she was able to purchase graduation dresses, which were in high demand and brought in higher profits than casual wear.

Marinella is requesting a $400 loan to expand her business into a small shop. She currently just sells out of her home to friends and acquaintances. Rent for a small shop in Juliaca runs between $150-$200 a month. By expanding into a small shop in Juliaca, Marinella would be able to make many more sales and continue to sell graduation dresses. Marinella hopes to be able to afford to put her daughters into private schools, which are much better than the public schools they currently attend.

loans.use: Expand home-based business into a small shop

loans.name: Amelia Marleni

texts.en: Amelia, a mother of two, currently sells clothes and accessories from the mail-order company Ebel Unique.  Most of her sales are to friends or acquaintances. Her sales are almost exclusively by order. She also works in a casino to support her two young daughters.  Amelia is requesting a $400 loan to open a traditional Peruvian restaurant in Juliaca in order to better provide for her family. She has had experience in the restaurant business and enjoys cooking much more than her current occupations.

loans.use: Open a restaurant in Juliaca.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and accessories for motorcycles

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a 39 year old father of five from Juliaca. On Sundays and Thursdays he travels to local ferias, where he buys and sells cattle. He has been trading cattle for three years now. During the rest of the week, Eusebio drives his tricycle taxi around Juliaca.

With a loan of $150, he will be able to make some necessary improvements to his tricycle taxi and to invest part of the loan in the cattle he trades.

loans.use: Make improvements to tricycle taxi and invest in cattle.

loans.name: Wilber Cleto

texts.en:
Wilber started his photocopying business three years ago, working with one photocopier based in his home. He is now 27 and has been able to expand his business to two photocopiers plus a computer and printer. With his last loan he was able to purchase the second photocopier which has allowed him to increase his productivity.

He is now requesting a loan of $325 to meet his customers' demands by purchasing more ink and paper for his business. During his free time Wilmer also drives a motortaxi.

loans.use: Purchase ink and paper for printing center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a store to sell food out of her home.

loans.name: Paulina Juliana

texts.en:
Paulina was born in the countryside near Juliaca, where she lived until her twins began primary school. She decided to move the family of four children closer to the city so that her children would not have to travel so far to get to school. She did not have the opportunity to finish primary school and hopes that her children will have the opportunity to attend a university. So far the 11 year old twins have remained at grade level and are soon to start secondary school.

For the past two years, Paulina has been selling food items from a cart on the street. In the last year, she has purchased a cart with wheels which has allowed her to expand the quantity and the type of foods she sells. Having a mobile business makes it easy for her to find the best location for sales depending on the time of day.

Paulina is requesting a loan of $175 with which she hopes to buy a stand in the market where she can continue to expand her business and clientèle as well as her financial security. Her primary goal is to make enough money to send all four of her children to school.

loans.use: Purchase a stand at the local food market.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria Cecilia is married and has two children ages 10 and 17. She is a hardworking woman who, in order to help her husband cover the household expenses and her children's education, decided to start her own business five years ago. She started selling blankets and quilts, and later on, with the help of a teacher friend of hers, she started selling regional dresses and costumes. The response from her customers has been very positive and business has increased.

This type of dress is in high demand for special events at schools and churches. She is currently handling many orders placed by customers from her parish. In order to fill these orders, Maria is seeking a loan of $925 to buy merchandise. She is committed to repaying the loan in 8 months. Become an important part of the growth of this business and the lives of Maria and her family. They will be forever grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Cecilia es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 10 y 17 años de edad, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos decidió emprender su negocio hace cinco años, empezó vendiendo colchas y edredones y poco después, por medio de una amiga que es maestra, comenzó a vender trajes regionales y disfraces en donde ha recibido una muy buena respuesta de sus clientes y ha crecido con su negocio.

Este tipo de vestuarios tiene mucha demanda en eventos especiales en la escuela y en la iglesia, actualmente tiene muchos pedidos que le han solicitado sus clientes de la parroquia y para poder surtirles lo necesario Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 8 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Maria y su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Carmen Amalia

texts.es:
12 years ago, Carmen started her own business selling groceries. At the time, her husband was unemployed and her household debts were increasing. She also had to cover the cost of school for her two children. Thanks to the business, they were able to get ahead. Fortunately, the high-quality service that she offers has allowed her to remain in business for a long time. She gradually increased her inventory and fixed up her store to meet the needs of her customers.

At this time, Carmen is seeking a loan of $925 to buy merchandise. She would like to expand into the sale of fruits and vegetables and continue to increase business. She is offering to repay the loan in 8 months. The wellbeing of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of their business. They greatly appreciate the confidence and support that you offer.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Carmen inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, en ese momento su esposo se encontraba desempleado y las deudas de su hogar iban en aumento y también tenían que cubrir los gastos de la escuela de sus dos hijos y de esta manera es como lograron salir adelante. Afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido estar en el negocio durante tanto tiempo, poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor y acondicionando su tienda para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Carmen solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en al compra de mercancía porque desea incorporar la venta de frutas y verduras y seguir creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 8 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y ayuda que les brindas.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia lives in the city of Santa Catarina, in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is married and has two children ages 9 and 16. She would like her children to have a quality education and improve their quality of life, which would be impossible on her husband's salary alone. For the past 10 years, Cynthia has been involved in the sale of footwear via catalog. Little by little, her business has grown and her clientele has increased.

She is now filling large orders and needs a loan of $925 which she will use to acquire merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and continue to grow. She is committed to repaying the loan in 8 months. You can become a part of this business by deciding to help this family today. They sincerely appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Cynthia vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina en el estado de Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 16 años de edad. Ella desea que sus hijos puedan tener una educación de calidad y mejorar su calidad de vida lo que sería imposible sólo con el salario que recibe su esposo, por lo que desde hace 10 años Cynthia se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio incrementando su número de clientes.

Ahora surte grandes pedidos y necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía con lo que espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 8 meses. Tú puedes formar parte de este negocio, decídete a ayudar a esta familia hoy, ellos te agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio is divorced and has one child. He is originally from Apocaca, Nuevo Leon. He previously worked in a furniture store, but eight years ago the company went bankrupt and as compensation they offered to pay him in furniture. That is how he came to start his own business. With the help of his brothers he has been able to increase business. The high quality of the furniture he sells and the level of service he offers has helped him augment his sales.

Cecilio now needs a loan of $1,100 to acquire merchandise to keep the business well-stocked and offer a greater variety to his customers. He is committed to repaying the loan in 6 months. Cecilio very much appreciates the opportunity that you are offering him with your support for the improvement and growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilio es divorciado y tiene un hijo, él es originario de la localidad de Apocaca, Nuevo León. Anteriormente él trabajaba en una mueblería, pero hace ocho años esta empresa se declaró en quiebra y para liquidarlo le ofrecieron el pago en muebles, así es como inició su propio negocio que con la ayuda de sus hermanos ha hecho crecer, la buena calidad de los muebles que comercializa y el buen servicio que ofrece le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas.

Ahora Cecilio necesita de un préstamo de $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Cecilio agradecen mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos is very responsible and a hard worker. He is married and has a small daughter. After struggling with unemployment, for the past six years he has been involved in the sale of clothing and perfume. He started his business with a very small amount of capital, but thanks to the high quality of his products and the excellent level of service he offers, he was able to increase his sales and reinvest in the business to allow it to grow. Unfortunately, his daughter fell seriously ill, and as they have no social security benefits, the cost of doctor's visits and medication were very high, thereby reducing the amount of capital he could invest in his business.

Today his daughter is no longer in danger. To continue working, he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise. He is committed to repaying the loan in 6 months. Now is time to help those who are most in need. You can be an important part of the development of this business and the lives of Carlos and his family. They appreciate it sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, es casado y tiene una pequeña hija, ante la falta de empleo desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, inició su negocio con muy poco capital pero gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y el excelente servicio que ofrece pronto logró incrementar sus ventas y reinvertir en el negocio para hacerlo crecer. Lamentablemente su hija enfermó de gravedad y por no contar con seguro social los gastos en consultas y medicamento fueron muy altos, lo que redujo el capital que reinvertiría en su negocio.

Hoy su hija está fuera de peligro y para continuar trabajando solicita un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Carlos y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Diana Martha

texts.es:
Diana has a 17-year-old daughter. She started her business selling linens and cosmetics two years ago to pay for her daughter's schooling. At that time, her husband left the home without providing them with any assistance. But Diana is a resourceful woman and she began to offer her products on a payment-plan basis, which has allowed her to increase her clientele considerably. Her daughter now helps out with the business.

To continue to grow, Diana now needs a loan of $250 for the purpose of acquiring merchandise, thus offering a better level of service to her customers. She is willing to repay the loan in 3 months. Today you can help those that are most in need. Diana and her daughter very much appreciate your support and the opportunity that you provide them to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Diana tiene una hija de 17 años de edad, ella han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de lencería y cosméticos hace dos años, en ese momento debía pagar la colegiatura de su escuela y su esposo las acababa de abandonar sin pasarles ningún tipo de ayuda, pero Diana es una mujer emprendedora y comenzó a ofrecer sus productos con facilidades de pagos, por lo que sus clientes se han incrementado considerablemente y ahora también recibe la ayuda de su hija en el negocio.

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Diana necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y de esta manera poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Diana y su hija agradecen mucho el apoyo y la oportunidad de mejorar que les brindas

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca Lidia is married and has one daughter. They are originally from Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. For the past 3 years, she has been involved in the sale of cosmetics. Her daughter previously ran the business, but she was offered a job outside of Mexico and Blanca took over in order to help cover her household expenses. Her husband is retired and his pension is very low. The high quality of the products that Blanca sells and the high level of service she offers have allowed her to continue to increase business.

She is now handling many orders and, in order to fill them, she is seeking a loan of $600 to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. You can contribute to the development of this business as well as improve the life of this family. They very much appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca Lidia es casada y tiene una hija, son originarios de Apodaca, Nuevo León. Desde hace 3 años ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su hija tenía este negocio pero le ofrecieron un empleo fuera de México y Blanca continuó con las ventas para poder ayudarse con los gastos de su hogar, ya que su esposo está jubilado y su pensión es muy baja. La buena calidad de lo productos que comercializa Banca y el buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido continuar creciendo con este negocio.

Ahora tiene muchos pedidos y para poder cubrirlos está solicitando un préstamo de $ 600 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio y a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Silvia Mirta

texts.en:
Silvia is 47 years old and lives in Juliaca with her 8 year-old daughter and her husband. Two years ago she rented a storefront on the road leading out of Juliaca to Cusco. She began selling limited merchandise such as candy, cookies, and sodas. With a $500 loan, she expanded her merchandise to include cooking ingredients.

She is now requesting a loan of $625 so that she can continue to expand her merchandise. She says she has a competitive advantage over other stores in the area because she buys all her products in bulk from legitimate companies in Juliaca and therefore has higher quality products than most of her competitors who buy from informal markets.

loans.use: Increase the quality and variety of her merchandise.

loans.name: Sandra Aurora

texts.es:
Sandra is a young entrepreneur. She is married and has a small child. For the past three years, she has been involved in the sale of cosmetics. She started the business because her husband's salary is very low, and not having social security, they needed to save money to pay for her maternity costs. Through her work she was able to cover these costs, and after the birth of her son, her customers continued to request her products. She therefore continued with the business and now has many more customers.

Sandra is seeking a loan of $475 to acquire merchandise for filling current orders and to continue to increase business. She is committed to repaying the loan within 6 months. Become an important part of the development of this business and support Sandra. She and her family will be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es una joven emprendedora, ella es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inició porque el salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo y al no contar con seguro social tenían que ahorrar para pagar los gastos de su maternidad, con base en su trabajo logró cubrir estos gastos y después del nacimiento de su hijo sus clientes continuaron solicitando sus productos, asó que siguió con su negocio y ahora tiene muchos más clientes.

Sandra está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y apoya a Sandra, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea is married and has three children who go to school. Her husband works as a driver for a construction materials company and his salary is very low and insufficient to cover the costs of living and school for their kids. Faced with the need for another income, Andrea began two years ago by selling shoes. Little by little, thanks to her passion for making sales and her personality, she has been increasing her number of clients and making her business grow.

At this moment, Andrea needs a loan of $250 dollars that she will invest in purchasing more merchandise to meet the demand of her clients. She promises to repay this loan in three months. Help Andrea improve her family's quality of life by contributing to the growth of her business. They thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Andrea es casada y tiene tres hijos, que están estudiando. Su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa de materiales de construcción y su salario es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, ante la necesidad de in ingreso extra Andrea inició con la venta de zapatos hace dos años, poco a poco gracias a su gusto por las ventas y a su carácter ha ido incrementando su número de clientes y haciendo crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Andrea necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ayuda a Andrea a mejorar la vida de su familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to meet clients' demands

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés is a young man with big desires of success and self-improvement. Presently he is attending his fifth semester for a technical degree in refrigeration. He is the oldest of five siblings. His father's salary alone is not sufficient to cover all the costs of living and the education of his children. This is how Andrés began his own grocery store business, so he can pay for his studies and improve his family's quality of life.

Now he hopes to be able to continue growing and for this reason he is requesting a loan of $250 dollars, which he will invest in purchasing merchandise to increase the variety of products that he offers and improve his service. He promises to return this loan in three months. Be a part of Andrés' success. He greatly appreciates the opportunity to improve and grow his business, which you make possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Andrés es un joven con grandes deseos de superación, actualmente esta cursando el quinto semestre de la carrera técnica en refrigeración, él es el mayor de cinco hermanos y solo con el salario de su padre no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, así es como Andrés inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes para poder pagar sus estudios y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ahora desea poder continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un crédito de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad que productos que ofrece y mejorar su servicio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Se parte de los logros de Andrés, él agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy grocery merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Rocio Alejandra

texts.es:
Rocio is married and has a little daughter who is one year old. Since the birth of her daughter, the costs of living have increased considerably and the salary that her husband receives is not sufficient to meet the basic needs of the family. For this reason Rocio began her own business by selling used clothes and plastic articles at the local travelling markets. She has obtained great success because of the quality of the products that she offers.

In order to make her business grow, Rocio is now resquesting a loan of $250 dollars that she will invest in more merchandise so she can offer a better variety of products to her clients. She is offering to repay this amount in only three months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and improve the lives of this family. Many thanks for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Rocio es casada y tiene una pequeña hija de un año de edad, desde el nacimiento de su hija los gastos de su hogar se incrementaron considerablemente y el salario que recibe su esposo resultó insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por lo que Rocio inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada y artículos de plástico que comercializa en los mercados rodantes y ha obtenido muy buenos resultados por la calidad de los productos que ofrece.

Para poder hacer crecer su negocio ahora Rocio está solicitando un préstamo de 250 que destinara a la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mejor variedad a sus clientes, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, muchas gracias pos tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to increase variety offered to clients

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a very hardworking woman. She is married and lives alone with her husband. He has an illness that prevents him from continuing work. Faced with the necessity of obtaining an income in order to cover their basic needs, Delia began two years ago with the sales of cosmetic and natural products. This business has permitted her to live a good life with her husband, and thanks to the recommendations of her clients, she has succeeded in making the business grow.

Now she is requesting a loan for $475 dollars that she will invest in buying merchandise to meet the demand of her clients. She is sure that she will be able to repay this amount in five months. You can be part of the development of this business and help this family. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Delia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y vive sola con su esposo, él tiene una enfermedad que lo incapacitó para continuar trabajando, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades básicas Delia inició con la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos desde hace dos años, este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante con su esposo y gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes ha logrado hacerlo crecer.

Ahora está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella esta segura que podrá regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Tú puedes formar parte del desarrollo de este negocio y ayudar a esta familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Sandra Verónica

texts.es:
For twenty years Sandra has been dedicated to working as a seamstress. She is married and has two children who are in school. Her husband works at the market, and his salary is very low and insufficient to cover all the family needs. For this reason Sandra decided to open her own seamstress shop and help her husband with the household expenses. Thanks to the high quality of work that she creates, she has gained many clients and made her business grow.

Taking advantage of the present situation of classes starting again, Sandra desires to start producing the school uniforms that many people are demanding this time of year. For this opportunity she is requesting a loan of $250 dollars, which will be used to buy fabrics that she needs. She promises to repay this amount in four months. Sandra greatly appreciates the opportunity to improve and grow her business, which you make possible. Thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 20 años Sandra se dedica a realizar trabajos de costura, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en el mercado y su salario es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que Sandra decidió abrir su propio taller de costura y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, gracias a la buena calidad del trabajo que realiza ha logrado tener muchos clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Aprovechando que está próximo el regreso a clases Sandra desea poder iniciar con la elaboración de los uniformes escolares que le demandan mucho en esta temporada, por lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de telas que necesita, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Sandra agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase fabric for sewing school uniforms

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is married and has two little children. Her husband is a bricklayer and the income that he receives is not sufficient to cover the basic needs of their family. For this reason Lourdes, being an enterprising woman, began her own business three years ago with the sales of jewelry. She started selling to her relatives and friends, but soon she succeeded in increasing her number of clients and making her business grow.

The love for her children and the loyal commitment to her husband motivate her day by day to grow. Now Lourdes is requesting a loan of $250 dollars that she will invest in merchandise with which she hopes to meet the demands of her clients and improve the quality of her service. She is offering to repay this loan in three months. Be an important part of the lives of this family. They greatly appreciate your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Lourdes es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo es albañil y el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por lo que Lourdes siendo una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio con la venta de joyería desde hace tres años, empezó vendiendo a sus familiares y amigos pero pronto logró ampliar su número de clientes y hacer creer su negocio.

El amor hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso que tiene con su esposo la motivan día con día a crecer, ahora Lourdes está solicitando un crédito de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en al vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Noelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Noelia is married and has two young children who are studying at the primary school level. Her husband works as an employee in a refinery. She began her business to help him with the family income. Two years ago Noelia began selling food in her home, and little by little she has progressed to where she now has her own little kitchen and place to sell her food. Thanks to the growth of her sales, her sister now helps her with the business. She desires to continue growing and make hiring two employees her next goal. She has learned a lot about business and has made her plans to grow; she knows that she is going to achieve her goals.

Noelia is requesting a loan for $925 so she can buy cooking utensils, which will allow her to prepare her meals in a more efficient manner, and enlarge her kitchen. With this loan, she will be able to complete all her orders and also continue growing. She is offering to pay back the loan in six months. She and her family greatly appreciate your support that helps Noelia reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Noelia está casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños que se encuentran estudiando en la primaria. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una refinería y ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar. Noelia empezó hace dos años vendiendo comida en su casa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo hasta ahora tener un pequeño local, gracias al incremento de sus ventas ahora su hermana la ayuda en el negocio. Ella desea continuar creciendo y tiene como meta contratar dos empleados ya que ha aprendido mucho del negocio y ha hecho sus proyecciones para crecer y sabe que lo va a lograr.

Noelia está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para comprar utensilios de cocina que le permitan avanzar con sus comidas de manera más eficiente y para ampliar su local, con lo que podrá cumplir con todos sus pedidos y a la vez continuar con su crecimiento, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para que pueda cumplir sus metas.

loans.use: Buy cooking utensils and remodel

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es:
Juana is a married woman and has one little son who is two years old. Her husband works in a factory. Presently they are paying for their home that they obtained by means of a loan for low-income persons. These payments greatly reduce the family income. Faced with this need, Juana decided three years ago to begin her own business selling shoes through a catalog. She began selling among her friends and neighbors, and day by day she gained more clients.

Juana is requesting a loan for $100 dollars so she can meet her order requests for the upcoming graduations. She offers to pay back this loan in three months. She and her family appreciate your support, which helps Juana continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Juana es una mujer casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de dos años de edad, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica. Actualmente están pagando su casa que obtuvieron mediante un crédito hipotecario para personas de bajos recursos y los pagos reducen considerablemente el ingreso familiar, ante esta necesidad Juana decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos por catálogo desde hace tres años, comenzó vendiendo entre sus amigos y vecinos, su esposo colabora con ella ofreciendo zapatos entre los trabajadores de la fabrica, y día a día se hace de más clientes.

Juana está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 100 para poder surtir sus pedidos en estas fechas para las graduaciones y ofrece pagar este préstamo en tres meses, ella y su familia te agradecen por tu apoyo para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy shoe merchandise

loans.name: Maria Bibiana

texts.es:
María Bibiana is a married woman with four children. Her oldest is going to high school and working at the same time. The three little ones go to primary and elementary school. Maria's husband is a factory worker. Maria started her business because their income was too modest for such a large family and she wanted to help out with the family expenses. She started working from home selling a small number of things like sodas, tortillas and milk. Little by little her clientele grew .Now her husband and kids help her out with the store.
Maria is asking for a loan of $475 to buy more merchandise, specially fruits and vegetables . Her customers have been wanting those for a while now. She'll repay the loan in 6 months. Maria Bibiana thanks you for supporting her and her family.

Spanish

María Bibiana es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales el mayor estudia en la preparatoria y trabaja, los tres pequeños estudian., dos en la escuela y el último en preescolar. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica y sus ingresos no eran suficientes para poder mantener el gasto familiar y fue por eso que María Bibiana decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar, trabajando desde su casa, empezando con muy pocas cosas que vender en su tienda como refrescos, tortillas y leche. Poco a poco sus ventas se fueron incrementando y así ella poco a poco fue surtiendo de más productos y a la vez creciendo con su negocio. Su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan en sus tiempos libres en la atención de la tienda.

María Bibiana está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así conservar sus clientes, además de incluir en sus productos frutas y verduras que son muy pedidos por sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en seis meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario started her business a couple years ago to contribute to the expenses of the household. She sells shoes via catalogue to her friends and neighbors. Maria chose this occupation because it allowed her to stay home and take care of her two kids while working. She has two sons, one on elementary school and the other on kindergarten. Her husband works as a driver for a private company. Thanks to her shoe business Maria and her husband were able to save for the down payment of their home. Maria's husband helps her with sales offering the catalog to his coworkers.
Maria del Rosario is asking for a loan of $550 She will use it to buy new merchandise and to cover outstanding orders. Maria and her family thank you for supporting their efforts to improve their lives.

Spanish

María del Rosario inició su negocio hace dos años atrás para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ella empezó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo entre sus amistades y vecinos, y se dedicó a este tipo de ventas para no descuidar a sus pequeños hijos que son dos pequeños uno estudiando en la escuela primaria y el otro en el kinder, su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa, y parte de las ventas de su negocio lo utilizó para poder dar el enganche de su casa que actualmente la están pagando. Su esposo colabora con ella ofreciendo sus productos entre los compañeros de su empresa, ofreciéndoles crédito por la compra de los mismos.

María del Rosario está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar mercancías y poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is married and lives with her husband, a retiree. Their two daughters are married. Her husband's pension didn't meet the household expenses, so four years ago Irene decided to open her own business selling shoes out of catalogs. At first, she sold to family, friends and neighbors, but little by little her customer base has expanded and she has now branched out into bedding. She is working hard to keep this business growing. At this time she is asking for a loan of $250 to stock up on shoes before the important back-to-school season. She promises to repay the loan in three months. Irene and her husband thank you for helping this business grow.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Irene está casada y vive sólo con su esposo, quien esta jubilado, sus dos hijas están casadas, ella inició con su negocio debido a que los ingresos por pensión de su esposo son muy bajos, y no cubren los gastos del hogar. Irene empezó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo hace cuatro años atrás entre sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, y así poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de clientes y ahora ya tiene un buen número de buenos y puntuales clientes, ahora también se dedica a la venta de sábanas y colchas para poder incrementar sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea continuar con su negocio.

Irene está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería de temporada en zapatos ya pronto inicia el periodo escolar y sus ventas se incrementan, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su esposo te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio, y poder incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Any Xiomara

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Any Xiomara A. and I have had a business selling tortillas for three years. I now need to buy more corn, limes, milk and a mill to grind the corn. I support my family with this business and I hope that you can help me buy the things that I need this month.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Any Xiomara A., yo tengo un negocio de venta de tortillas hace 3 años. Ahora necesito comprar mas maiz, cal, leche y un molino para poder moler el maiz.
