Con este negocio yo mantengo a mi familia, el cual me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder compar las cosas que necesito para este mes.

loans.use: To purchase corn, limes, salt and a mill

loans.name: Dania Iveth

texts.es:
Hello, I run a small Grocery Store in my house and I need to buy more products to stock my store and give my clients better service. I use the income from my store to pay for my studies and to help my parents with monthly expenses. I worked hard to start this business one year ago, and now my goal is to restock my store.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Hola, Yo tengo un pequeño negocio de una pequeña pulperia (Grrocery Store) en mi casa, ahora necesito comprar mas producto para poder surtirla y dar una mejor atencison a mis clientes. Con este negocio me pago mis estudios y ayudo a mis padres en gastos mensuales. Este negocio lo empese hace un año con mucho esfuerzo, pero ahora tengo una meta que es surtir mi pulperia

loans.use: To purchase toilet paper, cookies, soft drinks, sugar, rice, dish and body soap, etc.

loans.name: Maria Celestina

texts.es:
I have a small store, that in my country we call a 'chiclera,' where I sell candy, churros, and packaged water.’ I have run this store at a bus stop for two years. This is a great location because people who get on and off the bus always buy things from me. Now I need to buy more products because I do not have very many left. I would very much appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo este pequeño negocio de venta de dulce, churros, agua en bolsa en mi pais le llamamos (chiclera) Este pequeño negocio lo tengo en una parada de buses hace 2 años: Este punto es muy bueno, ya que la gente que se baja y toma el bus siempre me compran. ahora necesito comprar mas producto ya que me he quedado con poco. Les agradesere me puedan ayudar.

loans.use: To purchase packaged water, ice, churros, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
I have run a grocery store in my house for 4 years with which I pay for family expenses. Now I need to buy more products like bread, beans, rice, sugar and coffee to be able to sell products wholesale or by the pound. There is high demand for these products and I would like to better serve my customers, who are my whole community.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo una pulperia en mi casa hace 4 años, de la cual cubro los gastos familiares. Ahora nesecito comprar mas productos como: pan, frijoles arroz azuca, cafe para poder vender por mayor o librado. Ya que tengo mucho demanda de estos productos y quiero dar un buen servicio a mis clientes que son todos los de mi comunidad.

loans.use: To purchase bread, beans, sugar, soap, coffee, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda started  her business of buying clothing in Desaguadero and Juliaca and selling it in the gold mining towns of Ananeya five years ago, joining her uncles´ family business. She spends most of her week traveling. On Tuesdays through Thursdays she travels to Desaguadero or buys in Juliaca and on Fridays she leaves for Ananeya to sell all weekend to miners. This is an extremely profitable business since goods are very cheap in Desaguadero and Juliaca, but are in high demand and very little supply in Ananeya. She hopes that with a new loan of $1,200 she will be able to buy household appliances such as blenders, microwaves and food processors to add to her current range of goods for sale in Aneneya.

loans.use: Expand sales business to include household appliances.

loans.name: Codifun

texts.en: Codifun is 27 years old and has owned a metal shop at his home in Sarumilla for two years now. Codi works on an average of ten orders a week. A $200 loan will allow him to purchase the necessary materials (steel, iron, metal tubes, cables, etc.) to expand his business. Codi plans on opening a shop in a more industrial area of Juliaca in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase metal materials for metal shop.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en: H. Marhamat is married. Sometimes her son helps her to bring women's handkerchiefs from Istaravshan. She started her business with 40 US dollars. Now she has 350 US dollars in her business. She used to work in dry-cleaning, but after her salary was reduced she decided to start her own business. She wants to purchase modern goods and increase her profit. The market plans to build new shops, and she wants to rent one of them, because in winter it is too cold to sit in the street. The income she earns supports the family's expenses because her husband is sick and her son is unemployed. Her daughters are married and they live separately.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: S. Mavluda is 46 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters and one son. Her husband is a driver for a private company. She sells children's clothes in a local bazaar in Panjshanbe. She started her business with 50 US dollars and now has 15 years experience in trade. Earlier she sold socks and now her business is improving. She wants to purchase new kind of children clothes from Istaravshan. Her son works for a construction company but Mavluda would like him to go to university. She is a teacher by education but teacher's salary is not enough to support her family.  She will use her next loan to purchase seasonal children's clothes.

loans.use: EXPANSION OF COMMODITIES

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
If you should go to Phu Minh commune, Soc Son district and ask people to show you the way to Mr. Thanh and Mrs. D.'s house, you will hear them ceaselessly praise this couple.

Mrs. Nguyen T. D., aged 40, and Mr. Nguyen Van Thanh, aged 41, not only live in harmony but also are good at doing business. They have a corn business where she sells corn kernel and corn mash wholesale and retail. Normally he operates a milling machine to grind corn kernel, yet when their customers want to have corn delivered to their house, he can ride a rickshaw or drive a motor-cart to transport corn. From this business they earn about $12.5 a day. In addition, they have a rice field of 700m2. You may wonder how they can manage everything. The answer is simple and easy to understand. They have the encouragement from good results of their 4 school-going children aged 9 to 18. Thinking about the future of these dear children, Mrs. D. wants to borrow $1,200.00 to buy 6 tons of corn to expand her business. Of course they will be busier, yet they are willing to do everything for the sake of their children.

loans.use: She wants to buy 6 tons of corn for her corn business.

loans.name: Khilola

texts.en: Khilola is a single mother and has two small children. She is bringing them up on her own as she is divorced from her husband. Khilola was not able to find a permanent job and a year ago she started her own business. This is the main source of income for her and her family. She has experienced some difficulties in running the business as she does not have a permanent place in the market. Six months ago Khilola came to Microinvest where she received a loan which helped to expand her business a little and get additional income. Khilola plans to develop her activities further and is requesting a new loan for that. In the future, when the business expands sufficiently, Khilola will be able to rent a permanent place in the market.

loans.use: to her expand business

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en: Muqimjon is 48 years old and is married with three children. He has a secondary education and is unemployed at the moment. His business is the main source of income for his family. A year ago Muqimjon got a loan from Microinvest to process and dry apricots. Once he had repaid the first loan he applied for another loan to open a small shop where he sells an assortment of foodstuffs and soft drinks. Recently Muqimjon has started stocking carpets from a local carpet factory in his shop. Muqimjon is requesting a third loan so that he may further expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Mashrbay

texts.en: Mashrbay T. is 42 year sold, and he has a secondary-level education. He is married and has 4 children. Ten years ago Mashrbay started his business. In the beginning, he sold food products near his home. Recently he rented a sell-point in a center of his district and started selling kids' clothes. The majority of families are big families, so that is why Mashrbay decided to sell kids' clothes. He buys and sells goods according to the season. With the loan amount of $1000, he is going to buy kids' clothes and footwear. This loan helps to increase and diversify the range of goods. Local habitants have the opportunity to obtain kids' clothes near their homes, so it helps to save transportation expenditures.  He is going to pay off the loan over 10 months.

loans.use: To increase turnover, selling kids' clothes and footwear

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: A. Rahim is 48 years old and married with 3 daughters and one son.  All three daughters are married. His son graduated from secondary school and now works in auto service as an assistant. A. Rahim has 27 years experience in this field of trade.  He is a trained accountant but started to work in a vegetable shop after the collapse of the USSR.  Afterwards he decided to open his own  business. He imports his goods from villages and neighboring countries and now wants to increase his business. His next loan will be used for the increase of volume of vegetables that he is able to import.

loans.use: Increase the volume of vegetables he is able to trade.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: S. Mavluda is 46 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters and one son. Her husband is a driver with a private company. She sells children's clothes in a local bazaar in Panjshanbe. She started her business with 50 US dollars and now has 15 years experience in trade. Earlier she sold socks and now her business is improving. She wants to purchase new kinds of children's clothes from Istaravshan. Her son works for a construction company but Mavluda wants her son to go to university. She is teacher by education but her teaching salary is not enough to support her family.  This is the reason she decided to make a business and she will use her next loan to purchase seasonal children's clothes.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal children's clothes

loans.name: Oishahon

texts.ru:
Oishahon K. sells perfumes and other goods; she has been in business since 2001. Before she was working as a seamstress in a sewing factory. After she was laid off, she decided to start her own business. She started her business by selling colognes and perfumes. Currently in addition to colognes and perfumes she also sells different creams and hairspray. Oishahon is married, and her husband delivers the goods which she sells from Dushanbe (the capital of Tajikistan). Her son studies in school, and she wants him to go to university after he graduates. In the future, she wants to increase the assortment of goods and increase her business’ profit.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кадырова Ойшахон – продает парфюмерию и другие товары галантерии, этим бизнесом занимается с 2001 года. Раньше работала на швейной фабрике портнихой. После сокращения она решила заниматься бизнесом. Бизнес начинала с продажами одеколонов и духов. Сейчас у неё кроме одеколонов и духов есть разные кремы и лаки для волос. Она замужем, муж ездит за товаром в Душанбе (столица Таджикистана) а она продает. Сын у неё учится в школе, она хочет, чтобы сын после школы учился в университет на факультете таможни. В будущем она хочет расширить ассортимент своих товаров и увеличить доход от бизнеса.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality commodities

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba A. sells women’s clothes; she has been in business for 4 years. She travels to the neighboring countries to get goods. Matluba plans to increase assortment by adding summer women’s clothing. Previously she was selling women’s shoes. Matluba was trained as a teacher and she used to work as an elementary school teacher. She started doing business because her salary was not enough to provide for her family. She has four children and all of them are going to school. Her husband works as a public transportation driver. Matluba wants to increase assortment of goods and receive a maximum profit and she needs $875.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

A. Matluba– продает женские одежды, в этом бизнесе 4 года. За товарами ездит сама в соседние страны. Планирует, расширит ассортимент летних женских одежд. Раньше она продавала женские обуви. По образованию она преподаватель, раньше работала в школе преподавателем начальных классов. Так как зарплата не хватала, чтобы содержать семью она решила заниматься бизнесом. У неё 4 детей, все они учатся в школе. Муж работает шофером общественного транспорта. Хочет увеличить ассортимент товаров и получить максимальный доход. Она запрашивает 875 долларов.

loans.use: Purchase of new season clothes

loans.name: Mahsadoi

texts.ru:
Mahsadoi G. is 50 years old. Her husband went to Russia to find a job. Their daughter is married and their two sons work for a building company. She sells fabrics for woman's clothing. Mahsadoi is a certified commodity expert and has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She used to work as a saleswoman, but then she decided to start her own business selling fabrics at the market. She currently travels to the neighboring countries of Kirgizia and Uzbekistan to buy her fabrics. She wants to expand her business by traveling to China and the United Arab Emirates to buy better, more expensive fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

G. Mahsadoi – 50 лет, продает ткани для женской одежды. В этом бизнесе она 10 лет. Раньше работала продавщицей в магазине по продаже тканей. Она решила сама привозить ткани и продавать на базаре. По образованию она товаровед. За товарами ездит сама в соседние страны Киргизию и Узбекистаню Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Ее дочь замужем, а два сына работают в строительной компании. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и поехать за товаром в ОАЭ и Китай , чтобы купить дорогие ткани.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Tuvalu

texts.en:
Tuvalu is a middle-aged woman of thirty-four with five children, who works hard for her family's living. Her household consists of her husband, the five children and herself. With his support, everything is easy as their five children attend school. For a business, Tuvalu does baking. She believes, baking is a talent from God. In addition to that, it provides for daily necessities.

Tuvalu received a previous loan from S.P.B.D and she used it to buy materials needed and promote her business. Her praises and thanks go to S.P.B.D for approving her loan because many things would’ve been impossible without it.

loans.use: further develop micro-business

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa T. is a 36-year-old mother of four children, who makes buns, etc. from home.  Her children are all in school. Because Lisa is a breadwinner for the family, it is very important that everything is done in a proper and neat manner as the products are sold to customers near a school within the village.  Lisa is grateful for her husband, who supports her in her endeavor, as well as for S.P.B.D. for enabling her to receive this loan.  Without it, her business wouldn’t have started.

loans.use: Establish Micro-Business

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Many storekeepers and shop owners know Carol R. when people speak of her. Twenty-four years old and single, Carol contributes to the financial support of her family. At the age of sixteen, she was taught by her grandmother how to weave and make handicrafts and that’s just what she does for income. When everything is complete, the product is then sold to public stores.

Carol's heartfelt gratitude goes out to her elderly grandmother for imparting her knowledge to her granddaughter as well as to S.P.B.D. for this loan. It has been used to better the outcome of the products sold. When the money is plenteous, Carol will think of settling down.

loans.use: Establish Micro-Business

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
As a mother and very hard working woman, Eseta Laputi tries to meet the personal needs of her family. Being middle-aged, thirty three, and married with five children, she has been making and selling ice-cakes for two years. Her husband and children help make the ice-cakes because they must be ready for the next day’s sales.

Eseta is thankful to S.P.B.D. for their assistance because it has financed her business needs and the money gained from products sold will help make more products.

loans.use: Establish Micro-Business

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru:
Fariza Y. sells children's foot wear and woman's dresses in a store at the central market of Hodzhent city. She is a sertified commodity expert engaged in the trading business for 10 years. Fariza used to work as a saleswoman, but now she owns her own business. She and her husband have been separated for two years. Their young son lives with her. He is in second grade in school. Fariza picks up the goods in Bishkek, but in the future she wants to be able to travel to China to buy more goods. She requests a loan of $875 to increase the inventory and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Y. Fariza – продает детскую обувь и женские платья в одном из магазинов центрального рынка города Ходжента. В бизнесе она 10 лет, по образованию товаровед. Раньше работала продавщицей в магазине, а сейчас у неё свой собственный бизнес. Уже два года она живет с мужем врозь, у неё маленький сын, учится во втором классе. Товары привозит из Бишкека, но в будущем хочет поехать за товаром в Китай . Она запрашивает 875 долларов, чтобы увеличить объем товаров. Хочет расширить свой бизнес.

loans.use: to expand the inventory

loans.name: Faapisa

texts.en:
Working is Faapisa T.’s life. As a 26-year-old wife with one child, she works hard to provide for her family. Presently, there are not too many expenses as her child is only three years old. Faapisa's husband is the handyman. He helps grow the crops and does little jobs here and there.

Much gratitude goes out to S.P.B.D. for the loan that has enabled her to meet the business needs as well as buy equipment needed.

loans.use: Purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fruit business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoe selling business

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
Gladys is 30 years old and the single mother of 3 daughters, one 9 years old, one 6, and the youngest 1. The older girls study in a public school in the village where the family lives. The girls' father moved to Argentina in search of better work prospects; he sends money for the children's support monthly. Gladys has a kiosko where she sells all kinds of sweets, soft drinks and baked goods along with fast food she prepares herself. With the earnings from her business, she is able to support the family, especially the youngest daughter, who brings the family extra expenses like diapers, medicines and milk.

Gloria tells us that her business is going well. She has good sales, but she is eager to continue her progress and expand her business. She is applying for a loan with which she will buy flour, sugar, noodles and sweets in wholesale quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Gladys de 39 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijas, una de 9 años, otra de 6años y la más pequeña tiene 1año; las niñas más grandes están estudiando en un escuela pública del pueblo donde viven. El padre de sus hijas viajó a la Argentina en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, el envía mensualmente dinero para la manutención de sus niñas.

Gladys tiene un kiosco donde vende todo tipo de golosinas, refrescos, panificados, y comida rápida que ella misma prepara. Con las ganancias de su negocio logra el sustento de su familia especialmente de la más chica, ya que es la que más gastos sustenta por los pañales, medicamentos y leche que consume. Gladys nos cuenta que le va bien en su negocio, tiene buenas ventas, pero desea ir progresando y ampliar su negocio; para ello solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, fideos y golosinas en mayores cantidades para ir ampliando de a poco su negocio.

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, noodles and sweets in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her second hand clothes selling business

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Mr. Victoriano M. is 58 years old and lives with Maria Garcia, 35. They have two children, one 9 and the other 7. Both of the children are in school.

Victoriano and María both own their own businesses. María has a fruit and vegetable store where she sells all sort of produce and Victoriano is the owner of a gym. He tells us how he invested his savings to open a gym years ago, set ting up most of the exercise equipment himself.

The gym is a great success, since he has very little competition in the area, and is busiest during summer. He is eager to continue the progress he's made in the business and wants to modernize the gym in order to improve the benefits and comforts he offers the people who come to his gym to exercise. To do so, he is applying for a loan to nvest in additional weights and supplies for the gym.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Victoriano M. tiene 58 años está en pareja con María García de 35 años, tienen dos hijos, uno de 9 años y otro de 7; ellos actualmente están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad.

Ambos tienen su negocio, María tiene una verdulería donde comercializa todo tipo de hortalizas y Victoriano es dueño de un gimnasio. Victoriano nos cuenta que hace unos años atrás invirtió unos ahorros para abrir su gimnasio, el mismo monto la mayoría de los aparatos que tiene.

El gimnasio es todo un éxito, ya que no existe mucha competencia en la zona, en verano es cuando más clientes tiene. El desea seguir progresando y modernizando mas su gimnasio para poder ofrecer mayores beneficios y comodidades a las personas que acuden al local a ejercitarse; para ello, Victoriano solicita un crédito que desea invertirlo en la compra de más pesas e insumos para el gimnasio.

loans.use: Buy more weights and other supplies for the gym

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Mrs. Ambrosia C., 43 years old, is married to Mr. Silvano I., 46. They are the parents of 2 girls, one of whom is 14 and in the 9th graD., and the other, who at 8 years old is in the third graD.. All of the couple's hopes and dreams revolve around their children. They dream that their children will graduate from colleges so that they will have access to better career opportunities.

Ambrosia's husband has worked as a chauffeur in a private company for more than 20 years. To support her husband and generate additional income for the family, Ambrosia opened her own business in her house, where she sells all kinds of food supplies like sugar, milk, vegetables, flour, noodles, baked goods, etc.

Thanks to the wiD. variety of products that she sells, and the personalized attention she offers, Ambrosia has lots of clients. She hopes to continue her business's good progress by offering even more variety. She is requesting a loan which she'll use to stock a wiD. selection of merchandise, including oil, herbs, meat and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Ambrosia C. D. I. D. 43 años D. edad está casada con el Sr. Silvano I. D. 46 años ambos son padres D. 2 nenas, una D. 14 años que se encuentra cursando el 9no. Grado y la D. 8 años que cursa actualmente el 3er. Grado; todos los sueños y esperanzas D. Ambrosia y su marido están en sus hijas, a quienes desean ver graduadas el día D. mañana con un titulo universitario que les permita acceder a mayores oportunidades laborales.

El marido D. Ambrosia trabaja como chofer hace más D. 20 años en una empresa privada. Para apoyar a su marido y generar mayores ingresos, Ambrosia abrió su propio negocio en su casa, donD. comercializa todo tipo D. insumos D. primera necesidad como azúcar, leche, verduras, harina, fideos, panificados, etc.

Gracias al buen surtido D. sus productos tiene muchos clientes, además D. la buena atención que les brinda; Ambrosia desea seguir progresando y variar más los productos que venD., para ello solicita el crédito que lo utilizará para la compra D. más variedad D. mercaderías tales como aceite, yerba, carne y bebidas en general.

loans.use: Buy oil, herbs, meat and beverages

loans.name: Ángel Ramón

texts.es:
Ángel Ramón S. is married and the father of two beautiful little girls, one now 12 years old and the other 8. Both girls study in a local public school and both are dedicated, responsible and excellent students. Ángel's wife is a housewife and the primary caretaker of their daughters.

Mr. S. got his start in the business 27 years ago, working in a well known suspension repair shop in the city of Caaguazú, where he learned the profession. He is now a successful mechanic and the owner of his own shop.

Ángel has his own shop with a well developed clientele, thanks to the efficiency, speed and quality of his work. Due to the volume of work his clients are requesting, he would like to buy parts currently on offer in his city and is applying for a loan of $575.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel Ramón S., es casado y padre de dos hermosas niñas, una tiene 12 años y otra 8; ambas están estudiando en una escuela pública de la ciudad y son excelentes alumnas, muy responsables y dedicadas. Su esposa es ama de casa y es la principal educadora de sus hijas.

Don Ángel S. se inicio en esta actividad hace 27 años siendo empleado de una elastiquería (taller mecánico cuya especialidad son los elásticos de los autos y camionetas)muy renombrada en la ciudad de Caaguazú donde aprendió su profesión actual, hoy día es un exitoso mecánico de elásticos dueño ya de su propio taller.

Ángel cuenta con un local propio con una clientela bien formada por la eficiencia, rapidez y calidad del trabajo con que realiza. Debido a la gran cantidad de trabajo que tiene, el desea comprar más elásticos que en este momento están de oferta en la ciudad, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 575.

loans.use: Buy auto parts currently on offer in his city to use in his auto suspension business

loans.name: Daysi Damaris

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Daysi Damaris. I am an entrepreneur. I own a small business selling new clothing, which is located in my home in the center of my neighborhood. I have 2 daughters who are in school. Thanks to my income, I am able to contribute to the family expenses and I can pay my providers. At this moment, I need to stock my store better because customer demand has risen and I don't have enough capital to satisfy my customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

Hola Mi nombre es Daysi Damaris, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicado en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi colonia, tengo 2 hijas las que estan en la escuela, gracias a los ingresos que persivo puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con proveedores, actualmente nesecito surtir un poco mas mi negocio ya que la demanda de cliente a crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy shoes, blouses, men's shirts, jeans, sneakers, girls shoes, perfumes, skirts, and sandals.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Mrs. Bernadina Benitez E. is 39 years old and married. She has 8 children, of whom 7 live with her; they are 18, 17, 15, 13, 7, 6 and 4 years old. Only her 3 youngest children are still in school. The others had to begin working as soon as they finished primary school, to help support the family. Bernadina hopes that the children who are still studying will have the opportunity to go to college.

Her husband is an employee in a local sawmill, while Bernadina has owned her own kiosk for 5 years. She sells all kinds of sweets, fast food and soft drinks. She has a large and loyal client following, since many people come to her kiosk for the exquisite daily menu prepared from scratch by the owner herself. We can mention that the menu includes the typical Paraguayan soup, along with Paraguayan specialities including chipa guazú (a bread roll made from corn meal) and starch chipa.

Since demand for her meals is increasing, Bernadina would like to buy raw materials to be able to meet demand. She is applying for a loan of $400 which she'll invest in the purchase of flour, starch, corn, eggs and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Sra. Bernardina B. E. tiene 39 años de edad, está casada Y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 7 viven con ella; de 18, 17, 15, 13, 7, 6, y 4 años respectivamente; solo sus tres hijos menores siguen estudiando, mientras que los otros cuatros una vez terminada la primaria ya empezaron a trabajar aportando así a la economía familiar pues la necesidad los obligaba, Bernardita desea que sus hijos que aún siguen estudiando tengan la oportunidad de culminar sus estudios universitarios.

Su esposo es empleado de un aserradero de la ciudad, y Bernardita tiene un kiosco de la cual es propietaria hace 5 años; ella comercializa todo tipo de golosinas, comidas rápidas y refrescos. En la actualidad ya cuenta con su clientela bien formada, ya que muchos van al local para comprar el exquisito menú del local, elaborado por la propia dueña. Podemos citar que dentro del menú se encuentra la típica sopa paraguaya, el chipa guazú y la chipa de almidón, que son comidas típicas del Paraguay.

Como la demanda de sus comidas van en ascenso ella desea adquirir materia prima en mayor cantidad para poder abastecer su demanda, por ello solicita un crédito de $ 400 que los invertirá en la compra de harina, almidón, maíz, huevos y carne.

loans.use: Buy flour, starch, corn, eggs and meat

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
My name is Bertha P.. I am an entrepreneur and I own a small convenience store (cosmetics, decoration, fabrics, and kitchen and living room furniture), with the name "Variedades Bertha". I have been in business for several years. I have a good clientèle and experience with my business. It generates the income necessary to pay for the family expenses and other obligations with my providers. Thanks to this business, I have been able to provide for my children, because I am a single mother. From my income, I am renting a floor and my greatest wish is to build my own home.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Mi nombre es Bertha P., mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de Variedades(Cosmeticos, adornos, telas y muebles de sala y cocina ), llamado variedades " BERTHA" tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, cuento con buena clientela y experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos, ya que soy madre soltera y de las utilidades estoy pagando un solar y mayor deseo es construir mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy porcelain decorations, lotions, cosmetics, fabrics, and living room and kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Edith Vangela

texts.en:
My name is Edith Vangela. I am an entrepreneur and I own a business selling used clothing in the central plaza of my city. I have owned my business for 3 years. It generates the income that I need to pay for the family expenses, because I am a single mother of 2 children.

At this moment, I need to buy more products. The lack of sufficient working capital prevents me from offering a broad enough variety of products, which will increase the income needed to give my family a better quality of life.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Mi Nombre es Edith Vangela, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada en la plaza de mi ciudad, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos actualmente necesito comprar mas producto ya que por falta de capital no me es posible ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos y mejorar las utilidades para ofrecer a mi familia un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of high quality American used clothing.

loans.name: Misael Onan

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Misael Onan. I grow ornamental flowers. I have had a small nursery for several years. I sell the flowers in the wholesale market and in several schools in my city. I have a very good clientèle. Thanks to my business, I am able to help my mother, who is a senior. My business is growing every day and due to the demand, I need an increase of capital that will allow me to offer a better variety of plants to my customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Misael Onan , mi actividad principal es el cultivo de flores ornamentales, cuenta con un pequeño vivero desde hace varios años, las que vendo en el mayoreo y en las diferentes escuelas de mi ciudad, tengo muy buena clientela, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mi madre con los gastos siendo ella de la tercera edad, actualmente mi negocio va creciendo cada día en vista que la demanda a crecido por lo que requiere de mayor capital para poder ofrecer a mis clientes mas variedad de plantas.

loans.use:
Compra de Cubetas, jaulas y plantas
To buy buckets, crates, and flowers

loans.name: Martha Isidora

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Martha Isidora. I have a small grocery store in my home which I opened one year ago. The business generates the income that I need to pay for the expenses of my 2 children, because I am a single mother. Thanks to the business I can take care of my family and at the same time generate the income necessary to pay for expenses and other debts to my providers. At this moment, I need to expand my offering because high season is getting closer and I don't have enough capital to make this investment.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Martha Isidora, cuento con una pequeña pulperia de venta de abarroteria, ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace 1 año, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mis 2 hijos ya que soy madre soltera, gracias a este negocio puedo atender a mi familia y generar ingresos para los gastos y demas compromisos con proveedores. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada buena y no cuento con el capital suficiente para realizar tal inversión.

loans.use: To buy refreshments, sweets, cookies, juices, sugar, rices, and instant soups.

loans.name: Arlin Esteban

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Arlin Esteban. I am an entrepreneur. I have a small grocery distribution business (selling food items) and I sell to all the grocery stores in my neighborhood. I have done this for several years now. It generates the income to pay for my family expenses and to pay my providers. Thanks to this business, I have my own home that I am paying in installments.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Arlin Esteban, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de abarroteria (productos de consumo humano) el que distribuyo de manera ambulante en todas las pulperias de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio tengo mi propia vivienda la que estoy pagando a plazos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, margarine, shortening, sweets, soap, ice cubes, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elida Argentina

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Elida Argentina. I am an entrepreneur and for several years I have owned a small grocery store in the center of town, named "Pulperia Central". It generates the income needed to pay for the family expenses and to pay my providers. I am a single mother of a daughter. Thanks to the income of my business, she is graduating from high school this year with a concentration on Basic Education.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Elida Argentina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en el centro de mi ciudad, llamada pulperia Central, desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores, soy madre soltera tengo una hija que gracias a las utilidades de mi negocio este año se gradua de Bachiller en Educación Basica.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments, canned juices, cookies, sweets, instant soups, and sewing accessories

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela is a very hard-working woman. She is single and she has a 15-year-old daughter, who is in school. She started selling jewelry 16 years ago, later she took a course to make traditional candies. She started her own business to be able to support her daughter and to have the resources to send her to school. Little by little she has been investing more in her business and thanks to the good quality of her products, she has managed to increase her sales considerably.

Now, she is requesting for a loan of $750 that she will use to buy the ingredients that she needs to make her candies. She hopes to increase her production and to cover all the orders that she has. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Help Carmela and her daughter, they are very grateful for the opportunity that you offer them to improve and to keep on growing with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando. Desde hace 16 años inició con las ventas de joyería, después tomó un curso de elaboración de dulces regionales y para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para el sustento y la educación de su hija inició su propio negocio, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo más en su negocio y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado incrementar sus ventas considerablemente.

Ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus dulces, con lo que espera incrementar su producción y cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Carmela y a su hija, ellas agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy

loans.name: Mayra Yesenia

texts.es:
Mayra has two children, age 2 and 10. She is single and she has had to work very hard to support her two little ones. Since Mayra is an enterprising woman, she decided to start her own business of selling footwear five years ago to offer her children a better quality of life and to give them everything they need. Little by little she has made her business grow and by offering her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger.

Now, Mayra needs a loan of $150 that she will use to buy merchandise to cover the demand of her clients, and to offer a better service. She promises to repay the loan in three months. Be an important part in the life of this family! They are very grateful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mayra tiene dos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad, ella es soltera y ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños. Como Mayra es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace cinco años decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado para ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y darles todo lo necesario, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y con las facilidades de pagos que ofrece a sus clientes sus pedidos son cada vez mayores.

En estos momentos Mayra necesita de un crédito por $ 150 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en solo tres meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta

texts.es:
Maria Enriqueta is a very hard-working woman, she is single and she has a 13-year-old son. She has been doing sales past 15 years: she started selling clothes and later she added footwear obtaining very good results. Maria wants to be able to offer a good education to his son and improve his quality of life; this is what motivates her everyday to improve and to make her business grow. Now Maria is requesting for a loan of $650 that she will use to buy merchandise. This time of the year is a really good period for sales that she wants to make the most of it by increasing her variety of footwear. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Maria and her son have their trust in those who help the people in need, they are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Enriqueta es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es soltera y tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a las ventas, inició con ropa y posteriormente incorporó la venta de calzado obteniendo muy buenos resultados. Maria desea poder ofrecerle a su hijo una buena educación y mejorar su calidad de vida, esto es lo que la motiva todos los días a mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio. Ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, esta es una muy buena temporada de ventas y quiere aprovecharla incrementando la variedad de calzado que ofrece a sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Maria y su hijo confían en las personas que ayudan a quien mas lo necesitan y agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza has 2 children who are 10 & 15 years old. They have been the main reason why she decided to start her own business selling shoes about 7 years ago. Maritza has worked very hard to give her family a better quality of life. She has done it all alone! The love that she has for her children has given her motivation to keep moving ahead. She started selling shoes to her friends and family at first, but thanks to her good selling skills and her friendly nature, soon she began acquiring more and more clients.

She currently has many orders from her clients, but she doesn't have the money to buy more inventory. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $375 USD which she promises to repay within 6 months. You can be a part of this growing business! Maritza appreciates your trust and support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Martiza tiene dos hijos, de 10 y 15 años de edad, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado desde hace siete años. Maritza ha trabajado mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, pero el amor hacia sus hijos es su mayor impulso, comenzó vendiendo a sus familiares y conocidos pero gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su facilidad para relacionarse con los demás pronto logró conseguir muchos clientes.

Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos que surtir pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Tú puedes formar parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Maritza agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Maria Oristela

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria Oristela. I am an entrepreneur who owns a small grocery store in my home, named "El Triangulo". I have owned this for several years. It generates the income I need to contribute to the household expenses. I have three children and they are all going to school. Most importantly, this business allows me to take care of my children.

At this moment, I need to expand my range of products to offer a better variety to my customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Maria Oristela, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada pulperia "El Triangulo", actividad que realizo desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, tengo 3 hijos y todos estan estudiando y lo mas importante es que este negocio me permite atender a mi familia.

Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis cliente.

loans.use: To purchase shortening, pasta, rice, sugar, corn meal, instant soups, diary, chicken, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sandra Myriam

texts.es:
Sandra lives in Santa Catrarina, Nuevo Leon. She is a hard-working woman. She is single with 2 children. About 12 years ago, she decided to start her own business by offering school transportation to all the schools in her community since it was desperately needed. She only had a few clients at first, but later with time and with her good customer service, her business began to grow.

With school out for the summer, she wants to make sure her van is well-maintained in order to avoid any type of accidents (disrepair) once school is back in session. This is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $750 USD. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Sandra thanks you for giving her an opportunity to improve her business!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Santa Catrarina, Nuevo León vive Sandra, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 12 años, observando las necesidades de su colonia, decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo su servicio de transporte escolar, empezó con muy pocos clientes pero con el tiempo se dio a conocer y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece pronto logró hacer crecer su negocio.

Aprovechando el periodo vacacional ahora desea invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y evitar cualquier tipo de accidentes en el regreso a clases, para lo que está solicitando un crédito por $ 750 dólares, que se compromete a devolver en seis meses. Sandra agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda de mejorar ya hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Maintenance for school transportation

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is a single woman with 3 children. The oldest is 14 years old, and he is in junior high. The 2 youngest are in elementary school. One is 10 years old and the other one is 6 years old. She was let go from the company she used to work for, and since she had bills to pay as well as the schooling for her children, she started a home business about 8 years ago. She has made some adjustments to her carport, where she has her grocery store, and with the money she received from her company she began buying main staples and other groceries to sell. Her oldest son helps her whenever he has free time. Little by little her business has grown as well as her clientele.

Antonia is requesting a loan in the amount of $650 USD to purchase more inventory so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise to her clients and to provide better customer service. She commits to repay the loan within 5 months. Antonia and her family thank you for your support and for helping them move ahead in life!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia es una mujer soltera con tres hijos, el mayor de ellos tiene 14 años y se encuentra estudiando en la escuela su secundaria, los dos menores ambos están en primaria con 10 y 6 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio por que la despidieron de la empresa en la que trabajaba y tenía cubrir los gastos de la casa y de la escuela de los niños, fue así que ya desde hace ocho años atrás ella acondicionó la cochera de su casa y con el poco dinero que le dieron en su liquidación compró abarrotes de mayor demanda para comenzar con su negocio, su hijo mayor la ayuda en el negocio en sus ratos libres. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y ha seguido incrementando el surtido de su tienda para ofrecer mejores y más productos a sus clientes.

Antonia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para comprar mercadería y así continuar surtiendo su negocio y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes que son los que también le solicitan de mayores productos que ofrecer, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Antonia y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is married and she has 2 little girls. Alejandra is 9 years old and Daniela is 6 years old. Guadalupe loves to sell. She is resourceful and a hard-worker. She decided to start her own business after she quit working for a company. Her income was crucial to the family, so about 6 years ago, she started selling clothes to her friends and family. She has been able to help her husband pay the bills and to pay for her girls' schooling. Her business has grown little by litte as well as her clientele. She sells seasonal clothes so that she can offer a new variety of inventory to her existing clients and attract new ones.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan in the amount of $650 USD to purchase more seasonal clothes. She commits to repay the loan within 5 months. Guadalupe and her family thank you for your support. They hope that their businees continues to grow so that her and her family can move ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe es una mujer casada y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, Alejandra y Daniela de 9 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, a Guadalupe le gustan mucho las ventas y es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella decidió poner su negocio por que se retiro de la empresa en la que trabajaba, entonces ese ingreso adicional que aportaba a la economía familiar era necesario; por ello hace 6 años atrás, empezó vendiendo ropa entre sus amistades, y con esto ha podido ayudar con los gastos del hogar, y poder brindarles educación a sus pequeñas hijas. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y con ello su cartera de clientes también, que son las personas que le solicitan sobre el tipo de ropa que ella vende y a ella le gusta tener ropa de temporada para así mantener y atraer a nuevos clientes.

Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para poder adquirir ropa de temporada y tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen tu apoyo y espera continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Ana Martina

texts.es:
Ana Martina is a married woman with 3 children. Her husband sells hot dogs & hamburgers at a food stand. His income was not enough to cover all of the family expenses, and with 3 small children to support it was necessary to get additional income. This is the main reason why Ana started her own business from home selling groceries. Her business has grown little by little and she now has many clients. She has been able to help her husband with the bills and to provide her children a better quality of life.

Ana Martina is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD to purchase more merchandise for her business. She commits to repay the loan within 4 months. Ana and her family greatly appreciate it, and they thank you for your support for helping them continue with their home business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Martina es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la venta de Hot dogs y Hamburguesas, y sus ingresos no eran suficientes para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y con tres hijos pequeños que mantener era necesario tener un mejor ingreso, fue así que Ana se decidió a abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, el cual empezó en la sala de su casa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo y teniendo más clientes, lo que le ha ayudado a poder colaborar a su esposo con los gastos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ana Martina está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar mercancía para su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Hola mi nombre es Martha Maria, mi actividad es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, tengo 3 hijos los que estan estudiando y tambien me colaboran en distribuir el producto en su tiempo libre, lo mas importante es que puedo distribuir el tiempo entre atender a mi familia y el negocio.

Hi, my name is Martha Maria and my business is in selling new clothes and shoes which I sell in the streets of my neighborhood. I have several years dedicated to this bype of business, which generates income for my family expenses and other obligations. I have three children that study and who also help me with the business in their spare time. The most important thing about my business is that it gives me the opportunity to be able to distribute time between looking after my family and the attending of the business.

loans.use: Compra de cortinas, toallas de baño,  zapatias de hombre, sandalias de mujer, blusa de dama// Purchase of curtains, bath towels, men's shoes, women's sandals, women's blouses

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta is 50 years old and married to Mr. Gabriel Vargas, 52 years old. They have 7 children, aged 28, 24, 17, 16, 14, 11 and 9 years. The 24 year old and the 17 year old are currently working in the city of San Paulo in Brazil; the oldest is married. The 4 youngest children still live with Enriqueta and Gabriel and study in a local public school.

Both Enriqueta and her husband are hardworking and enterprising people. Enriqueta's husband works as an employee in a local sawmill and to increase his earnings he also works as a laborer in the construction industry. Enriqueta is the owner of a stall where she sells fast food she prepares herself, along with natural juices made from seasonal fruit. In addition to her food business, Enriqueta washes and makes clothing. The couple does all of this work with their children in mind, wishing to give them a good education so that they will have access to better opportunities than their parents.

She is applying for a loan so that she can invest the capital in the purchase of raw materials for the food she prepares: flour, milk, meat, egg and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Enriqueta de 50 años se encuentra casada con el Sr. Gabriel Vargas de 52 años, la pareja tiene 7 hijos de 28, 24, 17, 16, 14, 11 y 9 años de edad respectivamente, sus hijos de 24 y 17 años se encuentran trabajando en la ciudad de San Pablo-Brasil, el mayor ya está casado y los cuatro menores aún viven con ella, actualmente están estudiando en una escuela pública de la ciudad.

Tanto Doña Enriqueta como su marido son gente trabajadora y emprendedora, su marido trabaja como empleado en un aserradero de la ciudad y para aumentar sus ingresos también trabaja como obrero de en construcciones; ella es dueña de un puesto donde vende comida rápida que ella misma prepara, así como también jugos naturales de frutas de estación. Además de su negocio, Enriqueta lava y confecciona ropas, todas estas actividades lo realizan pensando en sus hijos, deseosa de darle una buena educación para que puedan acceder a mejores oportunidades que ella y su marido no pudieron.

Ella desea adquirir un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para preparar sus comidas, tales como harina, leche, carne, huevo y aceite.

loans.use: Buy flour, milk, meat, eggs and oil

loans.name: Ruth Liliana

texts.es:
Mi nombre es Ruth Liliana, soy comerciante, tengo una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada pulperia "DANIELA" desde hace 1 año la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromiso, tengo una hija la que me colabora en el negocio en su tiempo libre, cuento con buena clientela ya que la ubicación de mi negocio es estrategica, por lo que necesito surtirlo mas, en vista que la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital para tal inversión.

My name is Ruth Liliana. I am a merchant. For one year, I have had a small grocery store in my house, named “DANIELA”, which generates income for my family and other obligations. I have one daughter who helps me in the business at her leisure. I have a good client base, given my business is strategically located, which is one reason why I need to supply it more as the demand has increased and I don’t count on capital for such investment.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, dulces, galletas, cafe, azucar, manteca, jabon, lacteos y huevos.// Purchase of sodas, sweets, cookies, coffee, sugar, lard, soap, milk products, and eggs

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto Carlos

loans.use: Para la compra de joyas como anillos, cadenas, pulseras y aros// Purchase of jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets, and earrings

loans.name: Maria Altagracia

texts.en: Maria is a woman who started over 5 years ago selling clothes to her neighbors. Due to difficulties in her life, she had to stop the sales and work on a salon in the meanwhile. With this loan, she wants to resume her sales, therefore increasing her income and helping her husband who works in "edesur," which is an electricity company. She plans on buying her inventory in Elias Piña, a town close to the border line between the Dominican Republic and Haiti. It is a very long trip from Santo Domingo. She doesn't own a establishment, but she is going to sell her goods in her house which is pretty common in the area.

loans.use: To buy clothes and accessories to resume her business

loans.name: Rony

texts.es:
Rony S. es un joven de 22 años de edad, se encuentra viviendo en la casa de sus padres, ubicado en el Barrio San Roque de la ciudad de Caaguazú.

Rony es un joven emprendedor, que ha trabajado desde pequeño como ayudante en el taller automotriz de su hermano, en el cual fue aprendiendo el oficio. Hoy día ambos ya trabajan de forma conjunta en dicho taller que lleva por nombre “San Cayetano”, teniendo así cada uno su propia clientela formada.

Rony está deseoso de ir adquiriendo de a poco sus propios elementos de trabajo, pues hasta ahora utiliza los elementos de su hermano, para ello solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas para su uso en el taller.

Rony S. is a young man of 22 years of age. He lives with his parents in the neighborhood of San Roque in the city of Caaguazu.

Rony is an energetic young man who has worked since he was very young as assistant in his brother’s auto body shop, where he learned his trade. Today both he and his brother work as partners in the shop called, San Cayetano, with each having established his own client base.

Rony wishes to slowly acquire his own tools for work, given that up to now he uses his brother’s tools. For this he needs a credit, which he will invest in the purchase of his tools for his shop usage.

loans.use: Para la compra de herramientas.// To purchase tools for auto repair

loans.name: Faleata

texts.en: Toddlers, youngsters, and youth within the community love Faleata T.’s baking.  Even better, she sells it by the village school most of them attend.  This is her financial contribution to her family, as she is a 38-year-old wife and mother of four schooling children.  For the previous two years, Faleata's business has been enlarged with the help of the S.P.B.D. loan she received.  It was used to buy ingredients and with the money from sales, Faleata provides for everyday family needs. Now she is asking for another loan to continue to expand her micro-business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
"How would you like your dress to be sewn?" is usually Leata T.’s question to her clients. She is a seamstress, a mother, a wife, a breadwinner, and a provider. At 34 years old with six schooling children, it is not an easy task.

Leata has been able to receive two loans from S.P.B.D. already. The first one was used to buy materials for her clients' orders, then due to her increased clientele, the second was used to buy an electric sewing machine. Leata is very grateful for S.P.B.D. because it has been able to help her meet her financial/business needs.

loans.use: To buy more materials necessary due to increased clientele

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: When the people are good, the sales are high.  When the people are good, the money is good.  These are the thoughts of Naomi M., an elei printing businesswoman.  Because Naomi has six children in school and a husband to provide for, she sells her products from Monday to Saturday at the Permanent Block she has at the Flea Market.  Many people fret but she doesn’t because she says, the sales are quite outstanding.  She thanks S.P.B.D. for the loan because it has helped her business grow rapidly.

loans.use: To acquire material and textile ink for business

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Being a storekeeper or shop owner is not an easy job.  The family is involved and if the family is busy, one must be ready to undertake all tasks.  Otila F. is one of those people.  At 31 years old with two children in school and a nine-month-old baby, the hats Otila wears vary from nursing mother to wife to storekeeper when her husband has errands to run.  However, ever since Otila received a loan from S.P.B.D., worry is not a problem anymore because there are funds to buy stock for the store.  The only problem is, hers is one of four shops within the area and there isquite a lot of competition.  “Thank you S.P.B.D” is what Otila has to say, “you’ve made my job easier.”

loans.use: To buy stock for the store

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Rubén Darío Ruiz Díaz es soltero con 33 años de edad, se encuentra viviendo en la casa de sus padres, ubicado en el Barrio Centenario de la ciudad de Caaguazú.

En el año 1992 termino su carrera de Técnico en Refrigeración y Electrónica, trabajó como empleado varios años en una empresa privada, y tras varios de ahorro pudo emprender su propia empresa teniendo en cuenta ya su experiencia en el ramo; actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela formada, y le va muy bien pues sus clientes están bastante satisfechos con su labor.

Rubén solicita el crédito para hacer mejoras en la infraestructura de su local, porque desea darle una mejor imagen a su empresa, para comodidad de sus clientes y para la atracción de otros futuros clientes.

Ruben Dario Ruiz Diaz is 33 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the neighborhood of Centenario in the city of Caaguazu.

In 1992, he finished his studies as Technician in refrigeration and electronics. He worked for several years for a private company. From his savings and collected experience in the field, he was able to establish his own shop. Currently, he counts with an established client base and he is doing well, given his clients are quite satisfied with his work.

Ruben is requesting a loan to make improvements to his work site, as he wants to enhance the appearance of his shop, provide comfort to his existing clients, and attract new ones in the future.

loans.use: Para realizar mejoras en la infraestructura del local// To improve the infrastructure of his work site

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en: Its not the shop, it’s the stock in the shop. Being a twenty nine year old mother and wife, Veronika F. was able to start a small retail shop with her husband. Although it was a hard start, at the moment, it is prospering and she is grateful for S.P.B.D. because the financial assistance has given her more money to stock up the shop. She is hoping that another loan would be granted so that her shop can go from small to a bigger one and be able to compete with others in the area.

loans.use: Veronika would like to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Mr. Wilfredo A. is married, his wife’s name is Andresa and they have 6 kids, they all live together, four of them are studying on high school in the city and the other two are already working helping therefore the family. Mr. Wilfredo has a small carrier for more than 9 years, where he sells fast food at the Bus Station in the city, his specialty is grilled meat and shish kebabs of beef and chicken. Mr. Wilfredo is very well known in the city, has several clients who love his products, he works from 10pm to 2am during the week and from 8pm to 6am during the weekends, because most of his clients are also people who goes out to eat after a party. Wilfredo wants a loan to buy pork meat in large quantities, to vary his products and sell also pork shish kebabs, buying large quantities he will get good discounts that will help him obtain a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Wilfrido A. es casado, su señora se llama Andresa y tienen 6 hijos, todos viven juntos, 4 de ellos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y los otros 2 mayores ya trabajan aportando así con los gastos de la casa. Don Wilfrido hace más de 9 años que tiene un carrito ubicado en la Terminal de Ómnibus de la ciudad donde vende comida rápida, su especialidad es el asadito o brochetas de carne vacuna y pollo. Don Wilfrido es bastante conocido en la ciudad, tiene muchos clientes, a quienes les encantan sus productos; entre semana trabaja desde las 10 am hasta las 2 am y los fines de semana desde las 8 pm hasta las 6 am, pues muchos de sus clientes también son personas que salen de las fiestas a esa hora a comer. Wilfrido desea adquirir un préstamo para comprar carne de cerdo en gran cantidad, para variar sus productos y vender también brochetas de cerdo; al comprar al por mayor también obtendrá importantes descuentos que lo ayudara a obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Buying pork meat in large quantities

loans.name: Fa

texts.en: Fa is a hard working woman of thirty eight. She is married with four children but sadly misses one because he passed away. He was her eldest son and was the first one to go away. So, from a family of five, Fa runs her BBQ business to help out with family needs. Only one of her children is still attending school and the other two are helping her out with the business. She uses her loan to buy stuff needed for her business. Fa has devoted her time whole heartedly in what she is doing. She earns $120.00 profit a day from selling her BBQ. To her, it is fun selling her BBQ everyday nearby the road in front of her house. Fa really appreciates the help she gets from SPBD for lending her the money that makes everything for her business possible.

loans.use: Fa would like to buy freezers to make her BBQ more elegant.

loans.name: Mimisa

texts.en: Mimisa is 27 years of age and married with three children. Knowledgeable in elei printing, she has used it as a means of earning money to meet her family needs. She uses her loan to buy the specialized equipment for her business. Mimisa is also grateful for the support she gets from her husband. They both struggle together in order for their business to run smoothly. They deliver their products to various shops down at the market and they earn $70.00 a day. They earn $420.00 profit from the business after all the expenditures have been deducted. Mimisa is grateful in SPBD for lending her the money so that she can manage to improve her business.

loans.use: Mimisa would like to buy fabrics and some more paints for her traditional elei printing.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is 49 years of age from the village of Seesee. She is married with six children. Three of her children are still attending school and the other three are working and helping her out in running the business. She enjoys making umu of taro, banana, luau and luau herring in coconut cream and selling it to the public in front of Siaosi’s Store at Lotopa. She earns $160.00 a day after all her expenses from shopping. It is a good way of helping her in order to assist her family financially and to fund her children’s educational career.

loans.use: Mele would like to buy more products for her fast-food business.

loans.name: Fiaola

texts.en:
Fiaola is a 36 year-old mother of two from Seesee. She is a hard working mother who is willing to earn money to fund her childrens' school and also for the betterment of her family. She is married and she joined SPBD this year 2007 with a loan of $750 in order to start up a fast-food store. She sells taro, banana, yam and luau to the public in front of one of the shops near her home. She does business three days a week and that is on Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, and she earns $260 per day. After all the deductions is being made, her leftover profit is $160.

With this new loan, Fiaola would like to buy cement, iron roof, timber, a sack of taro and bunches of bananas for her fast-food store.

loans.use: Fiaola would like to buy cement, iron roof, timber, a sack of taro and bunches of bananas for her fast-food store.

loans.name: Matagiaila

texts.en: Matagiaila is a very artistic and creative woman as she specializes in doing elei printing. She started her elei business this year, and was able to do it well. She is a hard working mother who struggles to do what is best for her family's future. Her elei printings are being sold to many people especially tourists that come over to visit our country. Matagiaila has realized that having a business helps her out in so many ways like funding her childrens' school, buying extra materials for the business, home improvement and most importantly to pay up her weekly payments. According to her weekly budget, she earns $300.00 per week after deductions have been made.

loans.use: Matagiaila would like to buy fabrics and paints for her traditional elei painting.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
The C. family has been selling barbecue tacos for more than 3 years, and they also sell barbecued meats to their clients by the kilo. They sell their tacos outside of a tortilla shop in the city of Nuevo Laredo. They are asking for a loan of $1,200.00 dollars for better air-conditioning for their van so their clients can be more comfortable while they are eating. They will also use the loan for the purchase of equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la familia C. cuenta con más de 3 años en la venta de tacos de barbacoa, también ofrecen venta de barbacoa por kilos a sus clientes. Ellos se ponen a vender sus tacos afuera de una tortillería de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 Dlls. Para acondicionar mejor la camioneta para cuando llegue el frió así los clientes estén mas cómodos, cuando estén consumiendo y compra de equipo.

loans.use: to air-condition their van and for the purchase of equipment

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. They live in the locality of Apodaca in the state of Nuevo Leon. In order to try to acquire a house and improve her family's quality of life Maria and her husband have worked a lot. She began her own business with the cooking and sale of donas and empanadas. It is thus how little by little they have been saving to offer greater stability for their children. Thanks to the good quality of the products that Maria makes she quickly made a name for herself and they have increased their orders day by day. To be able to cover demand and continue growing her business Maria is asking for a credit of $925 that she will use in the purchase of ingredients and she promises to repay this loan in six months. For your important part in the life of this family contributing to the development of their business, many thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, viven en la localidad de Apodaca en el estado de Nuevo León. Para tratar de adquirir una casa y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Maria y su esposo han trabajado mucho, ella inició su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de donas y empanadas, es así como poco a poco han estado ahorrando para ofrecerle una mayor estabilidad a sus hijos. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora Maria pronto se dio a conocer y se han incrementado sus pedidos día con día.

Para poder cubrir la demanda y continuar creciendo con su negocio Maria está solicitando un crédito por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos y se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients
Compra de insumos

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura is married and has two children. They come from the locality of Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. Her husband works in a company but the salary the he recieves is very low and insufficient to cover the basic necessities of their family. To be able to help with the expenses of the home, 14 years ago, she decided to create her own business with the sale of groceries, conditioning a quater of her home. Little by little she has been supplying the store better and offering better service to her customers.

To be able to increase sales and the variety of the products that she offers, Rosaura is asking for a loan of $250 that she will use on the purchase of merchandise. She offers to repay this amount in only three months. For your important part in the development of this business and help to Rosaura to better the quality of life for her family, they give sincere thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosaura es casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas e su familia, para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar hace 14 años decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes acondicionando un cuatro de su hogar, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y ofreciendo un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Para pode incrementar sus ventas y la variedad de los productos que ofrece, Rosaura está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrecer devolver esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a Rosaura a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise for grocery store - 
Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
Rosa Ella is married and has two children ages 15 and 19. Her husband is a taxi driver and the income that he obtains remains insufficient to cover all the costs of the home and their children's school. Since Rosa is an enterprising woman, she decided to create her own business with the sale of articles of decoration four years ago, and she included the sale of costume jewelry a year ago, with which she has succeeded in greatly increasing her sales.

To continue growing now Rosa asks for a loan of $475 that she will use on the purchase of merchandise, with which she hopes to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. She promises to repay this amount in six months. For your important part in the life of Rosa and her family contributing to the growth of her business, many thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Elia es casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como taxista y el ingreso que obtiene resulta insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, como Rosa es una mujer emprendedora decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de artículos de decoración hace cuatro años e incorporó la venta de bisutería hace un año con lo que ha logrado incrementar mucho sus ventas.

Para continuar creciendo ahora Rosa solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Rosa y su familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use:
Purhcase of merchandise for a jewelry and decorations store

Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Gloria Nelly

texts.es:
Since ten years ago, Gloria Nelly has dedicated herself to the sale of tamales and tacos. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 17. After the company Gloria was working for closed, she began her own business to be able to settle the costs of her home and of the education of her children. She started in a rented booth and thanks to the good quality of the products that she makes it grew rapidly. Now in order to cover the demand of her customers, she relies on the aid of her children and one employee.

Recently she has acquired a station wagon that will permit her to have more agile transfers and optimize time. Gloria desires to continue growing and requests a loan of $650 that she will use in the purchase of a larger capacity stove to increase her production. She commits herself to repay this amount in six months. For your important part in the development of this business, Gloria and her family give many thanks for your confidence and aid.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años Gloria Nelly se dedica a la venta de tamales y tacos, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad. Después de que cerró la empresa para la que trabajaba Gloria inició su propio negocio para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, empezó en un puesto que le prestaron y gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora fue creciendo rápidamente, ahora para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y de un empleado.

Recientemente ha adquirido una camioneta que le permitirá agilizar los traslados y optimizar el tiempo, Gloria desea continuar creciendo y solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de una estufa de mayor capacidad para incrementar su producción, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Gloria y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of a larger stove - 
Compra de equipo de trabajo
