loans.name: Teresa Josefina

texts.en:
Teresa Josefina Gutiérrez is 30 years old and weaves special belts called fajas for women. The Mayan women wrap them around their skirs. She can make one per hour and usually can produce 24 in a week. The fajas are a beautiful multi-colored design and she can sell them in the Totonicapán for about US$2.75/each.

This is Teresa's first loan, and will be used to buy the yarn that she requires. Because she'll be able to buy in bulk she can increase both production and profit.

Teresa is single and supports herself and her 12-year-old daughter. Both of them have had chronic sinus infections for the past year. She explains that where she lives it rains for six months out of the year and her concrete block home never really dries out. Medicines for the infections are quite expensive and she must travel an hour to get them. She's on her third change of medicine, but nothing seems to help.

Written by Kiva Fellows: Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay

loans.use: yarn for weaving various hand-crafted fabrics

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina G. C. is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Catarina has one of the largest plots, still small at 3 cuerdas, but many of the women have only a single cuerda. She rents her plot for about US$474/year, and grows onions and ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only a part her income, so like the other women she has to work extensively in the fields of others to support her six children.

Catarina, 36, has kids aged 4 to 18.. Four of them are in school and she herself finished the second grade, so she can read and write, and speaks pretty good Spanish. (Day-to-day conversations are all in her native Quiché language.) She has her own house, with electricity and light. Her long-term dreams would be to buy a plot of her own and to build a better house. A single cuerda of land would cost more than US$1000, which will require a significant reinvestment of profit down the line.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana C. Pelicó is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Juliana rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only about 15% of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others to support her five children.

Juliana, 45, has two children aged 13 and 17. The oldest did not go to school, but the 13-year-old is now in fifth grade, a major step forward for the family, and a significant economic sacrifice. Juliana herself never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela C. Pelicó is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Manuela rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only about 15% of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others to support her five children.

Manuela's school-age children are not in school due to lack of money for the required supplies. The oldest (20) did complete second grade; Manuela, 40, never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Pelicó P. is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Maria rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in less than 15% of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others.

Maria, 23, is married with no children. She never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language. Working the fields is her life, and at least now with this plot she can do a bit of it for her own profit.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Petrono

texts.en:
Petrono Pelicó P. is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Petrono rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only a small portion of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others to support herself and her 16-year-old.

Petrono, 32, is separated from her husband and has just the one son, who did complete fourth grade. Petrono herself never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language.

Petrono dreams of somehow prospering in her business, renting larger plots of land, and maybe buying her own land someday. She thinks that next year she may be able to rent two cuerdas of land and double her income.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase sedd, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María G. is a single 34 year old mother of a 1-year-old son. She weaves cubrecamas, a very typical Paraguayan bedspread mostly crafted in the city of Carapegua. María has been working in this business for many years now. She started over 13 years ago, working at very young age with her father. Her father now lives in the house across the street and still weaves cubrecamas.

She has more than 50 clients who purchase cubrecamas from her and she works from her house. Her clients usually buy a few cubrecamas to resell to other clients in other cities. In minimum, she sells about 15 each week. However, it ranges depending on the season, selling more during the winter and less during the summer. There are three types of cubrecamas made of different fabric that she sells: trapo, hilo, and poyvi.

María need a loan of US$400 to invest in more material, especially thread.

loans.use: Purchase thread.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B., 35, and her husband, Carlos, 48, started their business, Mercería San Cayetano, three years ago selling clothing. They have a huge selection of long-sleeve shirts, tank tops, and a variety of panties, bras, and briefs. They purchase their merchandise from Mercado 4 in Asuncion, a large outdoor market that is a two hour bus ride from Carapegua.

Carlos works as a builder, while Mariana looks over their stand in the Mercado Municipal, a small flea market, of Carapegua. Mariana works everyday of the week and at times she also travels around the city to sell their merchandise.

The couple is seeking a loan to buy more female underwear from Asuncion to resell in Carapegua.

loans.use: Purchase female underwear

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia Orihuel, 53, is the wife of Cristino P., 47. Ignacia is retired and works around the house. Cristino works as an electrician, bus driver, and builder. The couple has a 3-year-old daughter.

The couple own more than 10 cows in a farm close to their house. For over 15 years, they have been selling their cows' milk. They have someone that lives on the farm and watches over the cows. Unfortunately, this year they are not selling as much milk as other years because, due to the cold weather, the cows are producing less milk. As a result, this season most of the milk is being used for personal consumption rather than selling it to other people.

Ignacia is asking for a loan to construct a better farm area for their cows.

loans.use: To construct a farm area for their cows.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 43, married to Esteban C.. Hermelinda make all types of typical Paraguayan clothes, bed covers, and hammocks. They are parents of three children of ages 14, 9, and 6. Having started their business 10 years ago, the couple works very hard every day to complete as many products as possible. During this winter, they are selling about 70 per week. However, during the summertime they sell more than 150 per week, since they make clothes that differ from the ones they make in the winter.

The couple works at home and travels to other cities, but mostly to Asuncion that is a two hour bus ride away, to sell their products. On average their clothes sell for about US$10 each. They are seeking a loan to buy more thread, fabric, and dye from Asuncion. They need to buy more dye because they take the neutral color fabric that they purchase and dye it into different colors in order to make a variety of women's clothing. In particular, many clients prefer the dyed fabric and the wide selection of colors for their clothing.

loans.use: Purchase thread, fabric, and dye.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca L., 33, is married and mother of two children. Her business includes making cubrecamas, a handcrafted bedspread that is very typical of Carapegua, and also a retailer of cubrecamas. She purchases cubrecamas from artisans in Carapegua and then she travels to Luque by bus in order to resell the cubrecamas to other clients. She travels to Luque every Saturday on a 2 hour bus ride from Carapegua.

Francisca started her business over 20 years ago. Besides acting as a retailer, Francisca's husband also makes on average about 10 cubrecamas per week and he only makes them per order. They works from home on a homemade loom that they have behind their house.

The couple is in need of a loan to purchase thread to complete their orders and also to use as capital to buy cubrecamas from other people to resell.

loans.use: Purchase thread and cubrecamas.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco T., 40, started his business 10 years ago. He works with his brother in making stones that are commonly used in Paraguay to build houses. By using a very efficient method of tying a horse onto a pole that is connected to a bucket of ingredients to mix, it saves a lot of time and labor for the brothers. Afterwards, the brothers take the mixture and place it into a mold that can make four stones each time. Then they lay the molded wet clay onto the ground for it to dry, which usually takes two days. The final process after it is dried is to fire it in a large kiln. Each day they make about 3000 stones.

Francisco and he´s brother are a hard workers; they work from 7 am until 5 pm everyday. Francisco and his brother have a stable group of clients in Carapegua that depend on them to supply the stones that are use in constructing houses. They are in need of a loan to purchase lumber for the kiln in order to fire the stones.

loans.use: Purchase lumber.

loans.name: Silvia Alejandra

texts.es:
Silvia is a single mother with two daughters. She began her own catering business 14 years ago in order to support her daughters and pay for their schooling. Since she is responsible and always completes her work her business has grown a lot and she now has many customers.

Silvia is requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase supplies, in order to help her business continue to grow. This will allow her to meet her clients' demands and offer them great service. She is willing to repay this loan in 3 months. Please help Silvia continue to expand her business so that she can improve the lives of her daughters; she would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia es soltera y tiene dos hijas, la necesidad D. sacar adelante a sus hijas y poder costear sus estudios la motivó a iniciar su propio negocio hace 14 años, donD. ofrece sus servicios D. preparación D. alimentos para banquetes y eventos especiales, poco a poco fue dándose a conocer y gracias a que es muy responsable y cumplida con su trabajo ahora tiene muchos clientes y ha hecho crecer mucho su negocio.

Para continuar creciendo ahora Silvia está solicitando un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra D. insumos, esto le permitirá cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes y ofrecerles un buen servicio, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Ayuda a Silvia continuar creciendo y a mejorar la vida D. su familia, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of Supplies

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
Enedina is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has a daughter; her husband is an assistant in a workshop. In order to improve the quality of her family's life and offer her daughter a good education, Enedina began her own business seven years ago selling cosmetics. She started out by giving away samples; thanks to their high quality, her sales increased.

Thanks to the experience she's acquired thus far, Enedina knows that this is a very good time to increase her sales and is thus asking for a loan of $200. She will use it to buy merchandise so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products. She is committed to repaying the loan within 3 months. Please decide to help Enedina and her family; they would be very grateful for your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Enedina es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene una hija, su esposo es ayudante en un taller. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecerle a su hija una buena educación Enedina inició su propio negocio desde hace siete años con la venta de cosméticos, comenzó regalando muestras de sus productos y gracias a su buena calidad pronto fueron incrementando sus pedidos

Con la experiencia que ha adquirido Enedina sabe que esta es una muy buena temporada para incrementar sus ventas y está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares con los que comprara mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Decídete a ayudar a Enedina y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana is a married woman with one daughter. Her husband works as a truck driver. Two years ago, however, he was unemployed. For a while, Maria Juana did domestic work for the mother of one of the town's teachers; after that, she began her own business. Over time she acquired better customers, which caused her sales to increase. Currently, she has a list of steady customers and hopes to continue to expand her business.

Maria Juana is requesting a $200 loan to purchase merchandise for her business so that she can increase the volume of her sales. She is committed to repaying the loan in three months. Maria Juana and her family would be grateful for your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

María Juana es una mujer casada y tiene una hija, su esposo trabaja como chofer de camión actualmente, hace dos años él estaba desempleado y fue en esa época en la que María Juana se encontraba trabajando como empleada doméstica en casa de la mamá de uno de los maestros del pueblo, quien la invitó a que se dedicara a la venta de sus productos y fue en ese entonces cuando ella empezó con su negocio propio. Poco a poco fue teniendo mayor clientela y por ende sus ventas comenzaron a mejorar, ahora ya tiene una cartera de clientes fijos quienes le solicitan de sus productos y ella desea continuar con el crecimiento de sus ventas.

María Juana está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $200 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así poder incrementar el volumen de sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es:
Maria is married and has two children. Her husband is a day laborer, a job which is not particularly stable. Indeed, he is often unemployed and thus cannot pay for household expenses. Consequently, in order to support her husband, Maria decided to start a business selling snacks. She began by only selling one to two types of products. As she added more products, though, her business began to grow.

Maria is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase merchandise to resupply her business and thus help it continue to grow. She is committed to repaying the loan in three months. Maria and her family would appreciate your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y tiene dos hijos, un hombre y una mujer, su esposo trabaja como jornalero, y es un trabajo que no es estable, por eso en muchas temporadas él no tiene empleo y no puede cubrir los gastos del hogar, por ello, María decidió poner su negocio de venta de frituras, para apoyar a su esposo en la economía familiar. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo muy pocas cosas hace un año atrás, empezó vendiendo de 1 a 2 tipos de productos y poco a poco fue surtiéndose de más productos y comenzó a crecer con su negocio.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $200 para comprar mercaderías para abastecer y surtir su negocio y continuar con el crecimiento del mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda is a married woman who has two daughters. Her husband is a laborer whose salary alone couldn't sustain her family; consequently, Esmeralda decided to start her own business to help her husband with expenses. She began selling a few basic items a few years ago; the fact that many children pass by her home then inspired her to put up her own store. Due to these same children, she began to do very well. She has thus been able to help her husband with basic household expenses.

Esmeralda is requesting a loan of $200 because she wants to offer her customers a greater variety of products. She will use the money to buy new items. She is committed to repaying the loan within three months and would be very grateful for your help, which would help benefit both her business and, as a result, her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Esmeralda es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijas, su esposo es obrero y con su salario no alcanzaba para el sustento de su familia, por lo que ella se decidió por poner su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos. Empezó con su negocio hace un año atrás vendiendo cosas básicas y la idea de poner su tienda fue por que vio el flujo de niños que pasaban por su domicilio y por ello cuando empezó le comenzó a ir muy bien, así poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio y ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos básicos de su hogar.

Esmeralda está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en tres meses y te agradece mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma is married and has three daughters. Her husband works as a mason and his revenues vary. Since it is not the most stable form of employment, Norma decided to start her own business in order to help her husband with household expenses. During a rainy season when her husband did not have much work, she actually placed a snack vending business in her home. Over time, she became successful and the business grew. She has many loyal clients, most of whom are her neighbors.

Norma is requesting a $200 loan to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her business and thus be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products. She is committed to paying back the loan within three months. Norma and her family would be very grateful for your support were you to help them improve their standard of living.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijas, su esposo trabaja como albañil y sus ingresos son bajos y variables ya que es un trabajo que no es estable, por ello es que ella decidió poner su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y mantener a sus tres hijas, en la época que ella empezó con su negocio fue por que eran épocas de lluvia y las obras escaseaban para el trabajo de su marido, por ello fue que puso en su casa un negocio de la venta de frituras, que poco a poco la ha ayudado a salir adelante y comenzó a crecer, teniendo clientes frecuentes que por lo general son sus vecinos.

Norma está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para comprar mercadería y poder surtir su negocio y así mantener a sus clientes y poder ofrecerles más variedad de productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en tres meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia is originally from Victoria, Tamaulipas. She is married and has five children. Her husband works in another city and he isn't always able to send that much money. One of her children has special needs and requires special treatments whose costs cannot be covered by her husband's salary alone. For this reason, Elodia decided to start selling used clothing five years ago. Over time, she has added more merchandise and thus expanded her business.

At present, Elodia needs a loan of $200 in order to continue expanding her business. With that amount of money, she could acquire a metal structure that would allow her to better organize and display her merchandise. She is committed to repaying the loan in three months. Today you can choose to help those who need the aid most. If you decide to help Elodia, she and her family will be very grateful for your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Elodia es originaria de la localidad de Victoria, Tamaulipas, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad y el dinero que puede enviarles es muy poco, uno de sus hijos es de capacidades diferentes y requiere de consultas y tratamientos especiales cuyo costo no podría ser cubierto sólo con el salario de su esposo, es por esto que Elodia decidió comenzar a vender ropa usada hace cinco años, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo más mercancía y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Elodia necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares para continuar creciendo con su negocio, con esto podrá adquirir una estructura metálica y acomodará de una mejor manera su mercancía para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Elodia y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives in the VIctoria, Tamaulipas area. She is married and has two daughters. Her husband works as a chauffeur; to obtain extra revenues Martha began her own business six years ago. Observing that people in her community needed to bring construction materials in all the way from the city (a very costly process), she decided to make the construction materials herself. She began by using a manually operated machine that limited her production to 20 blocks per day. Recently, she was able to acquire an automatic machine.

In order to meet her customers' demands, she now needs a loan of $200, with which she will buy supplies. She is committed to repaying this amount within three months. Please be an important part of this business' growth and thus help Martha and her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Victoria, Tamaulipas vive Martha, ella es casada y tiene dos hijas. Su esposo trabaja como chofer y para obtener un ingreso extra Martha inició su propio negocio hace seis años, observando que en los habitantes de su comunidad tenían que transportar desde la ciudad el material para construcción y resultaba muy costoso decidió empezar a elaborar ella misma los blocks, comenzó con una máquina manual que limitaba su producción a 20 blocks diarios y recientemente pudo adquirir una máquina de motor.

Ahora lo que necesita para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes son los insumos y esta solicitando un crédito por $ 200 dólares que empleará con este fin, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, y decídete a apoyar a Martha y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of Supplies

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía is single and has two children who are studying. She has had to put great effort to carry her children forward on her own, and to obtain the resources her family needs, she started her own business fifteen years ago by selling novelties. She has set her heart on improving her business and has made it grow little by little. Today she has three business areas: she sells groceries, stationary products, novelties and makes traditional costumes. It has not been easy for Sofía to carry all this responsibility, but the well-being of her children is her best reward.

Sofía needs a $ 650 loan which she will use by purchasing seasonal groceries in order to increase the variety of products that she offers to improve service quality. She hopes to return this amount in 6 months. It contributes to this business’ growth and to the well-being of this family. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofía es soltera y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola y para obtener los recursos que necesita su familia inició su propio negocio hace quince años vendiendo novedades, ha puesto todo su empeño en mejora su negocio y poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer, ahora ya tiene tres negocios, donde vende abarrotes, papelería, novedades y también elabora trajes típicos. No ha sido fácil para Sofía tener tanta responsabilidad pero el bienestar de sus hijos es su mejor recompensa.

Ahora Sofía necesita de un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía de esta temporada para incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ella espera regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Mirzaga

texts.en: Mirzaga lives in the Salyan region,  Yenikand village. He is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. Mirzaga has his own vineyard, where he grows vines. He has 15 years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan $725 to buy orchard medicines. He wants to improve his vine growing and get more income.

loans.use: To buy orchard medicines

loans.name: Makhluga

texts.en:
This young girl is 27 years old, single. She lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village.  
Makhluga grows vines. She started this business 3 years ago.  Her vineyard is a small. 
Now she is applying for a loan of $725 to buy a vineyard. She wants to expand her vineyard and to get a bumper crop.

loans.use: To buy a vineyard

loans.name: Kainat

texts.en: This 26-year-old man has his own orchard. He is single and lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has 2 years experience in this business. Kainat is applying for a loan of $375 to buy  orchard medicines for improving his orchard.

loans.use: To buy orchard medicines

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa is a hard-working woman. She is married, and has one son. She studied public accounting, but as she faced unemployment, she decided to begin her own business in order to obtain the resources necessary for her family. She established a stationary store 12 years ago. With great effort, she has been able to put forward this business as well as open a new grocery store which her husband runs with the savings they gathered in three years. Both stores have grown much and thanks to the good service they offer, they have been able to improve day by day.

Now that back-to-school is around the corner, Teresa wants to supply her stores and offer her clients a good service, which is why she is soliciting a $ 750 dollar loan that will be destined to purchase merchandise and refurbish her store. She is committed to return this amount in 6 months. Teresa and her family are gratefully thankful for the support you can give them.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa es un mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene un hijo, ella estudio contabilidad pública pero ante la falta de empleo decidió emprender su propio negocio para obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia , abrió una papelería hace 12 años y a base de esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante, con el capital que logró ahorrar hace tres años pudo abrir otro negocio donde vende abarrotes, del cual se hace cargo su esposo. Los dos negocios que tiene han crecido mucho y gracias al buen servicio que ofrecen han logrado mejorar día con día.

Ahora que se aproximan el regreso a clases Teresa quiere tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecerle a sus clientes un buen servicio, para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y arreglar un poco su local, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Teresa y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: Merchandise purchase and store refurbishment

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza is 52 years of age, she is married and is the mother of three youngsters. Her husband has a grocery store, yet the income he obtains is not enough to cover all the basic needs of his family. As Lorenza is an enterprising woman, she started her own taco store. Her taste for cooking and her personality have helped her build relationships with others who have helped her build her business. Little by little she started earning a good reputation, and thanks to the good quality of her products, her clients have multiplied.

Now Lorenza needs a $ 925 dollar loan which she will use to refurbish her store. She wants to improve the service offered to her clients and to continue to grown. She is willing to return this loan in 6 months. You can be a part of this business and help this family. They thank you very much for your trust and support.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenza tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres jóvenes. Su esposo tiene una tienda de abarrotes y el ingreso que obtiene no cubría todas las necesidades básicas de su familia, pero como Lorenza es una mujer emprendedora e inició su propio negocio con la venta de tacos, su gusto por la cocina y el su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos sus clientes se han multiplicado.

En estos momentos Lorenza necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local, porque quiere mejorar el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes y continuar creciendo, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes formar parte en este negocio y ayudar a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Taqueria Refurbishment

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesús is from Cadereyta, Nuevo León. She is married and is the mother of three children. She began her own business three years ago by selling groceries; her husband’s salary for working as a chauffeur is very low and not enough to cover all the home expenses. She began selling a small amount of merchandise, but little by little and with great perseverance, she has supplied her store with a greater variety of products and has made it grow.

In this hot season, Maria de Jesús wishes to offer her clients ice cream and water ice products, high in demand these days. She is asking for a $ 250 dollar loan which she is committed to return in only 3 months. Maria and her family thank you for the trust and support you give them.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Jesús es originaria de la localidad de Cadereyta, Nuevo León, es casada y madre de tres pequeños. Desde hace tres años inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes ya que el salario que su esposo recibe como chofer es muy poco y no cubría todos gastos de su hogar. Comenzó vendiendo muy poca mercancía, pero poco a poco, con base en su perseverancia, ha surtido mejor su negocio y lo ha hecho crecer.

En esta temporada de calor Maria de Jesús desea poder ofrecer sus clientes helados y paletas de hielo que son productos muy demandados, para lo que está solicitando un crédito por $ 250 dólares, mismos que se compromete a retornar en solo 3 meses. Maria y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 30 years old, divorced and has two children, ages 12 and 5. Being left alone to take care of her oldest daughter and without anyone to take care of her, Alejandrina saw the need to start her own business selling groceries seven years ago. This business is the only source of income she has to cover the basic needs and education of her children, and she has worked hard and would like to keep expanding it to improve her family's quality of life.

Now, to be able to offer a greater variety of products to her clients, she is asking for a $200 loan to purchase merchandise. She will pay it back in full in 3 months. Be a part of the growth and development of this business, Alejandrina and her family are very grateful for your support.

Alejandrina tiene 30 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 5 años. Al quedar sola a cargo de su hijo mayor y no tener a nadie que cuidara de él, Alejandrina se vio en la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace siete años, éste representa su único ingreso para cubrir las necesidades básicas y educación de sus hijos, por lo que ha trabajado mucho y desea continuar creciendo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ahora para poder ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos a sus clientes está solicitando un crédito de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo y crecimiento de este negocio, Alejandrina y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Juana Inés

texts.es:
Juana is 36 and married. Her husband is a taxi driver and does not have a steady income. The have purchased a home, but the mortgage payments considerably reduce their income. To help her husband, Juana decided to start her own business and take advantage of her previous stylist studies. She opened her own beauty salon, offering her services first to neighbors and relatives, and now to a good clientele.

Juana would like to keep her business growing, and since she has many clients but few places for them to sit in her salon, she is asking for a $250 loan to purchase furniture and mirrors. These things will allow her to provide better service to her clients, and she will pay it back in just 3 months. Be a part of Juana's achievements and help her expand her business. She greatly appreciates your support.

Juana tiene 36 años de edad y está casada, su esposo es taxista y no obtiene un salario seguro, adquirieron su casa propia pero el pago de las hipotecas reducía considerablemente sus ingresos, para ayudar a su esposo Juana decidió iniciar su propio negocio, aprovechando sus estudios de estilista, abrió su salón de belleza ofreciendo sus servicios primero a vecinos y familiares, ahora ya tiene una buena clientela.

Juana desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y como sus clientes son muchos ya no se da abastos con los muebles que tiene en su local, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de muebles y espejos, que le servirán para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Juana y ayúdala a crecer con su negocio, ella agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use:
Remodeling

Remodelación

loans.name: Lino Ventura

texts.es:
Lino is from Cadereyta, Nuevo León, and he has 12 years experience as a blacksmith. Previously, he worked in a workshop for somebody else, but his desire to move forward inspired him to save money to go off on his own. And this is how, two years ago, he came to open his own blacksmith and soldering workshop. He started with very few tools and material, but thanks to the high quality of his work, he was quickly able to increase the number of orders and clients. Now he has someone to help him meet the demands of his clients.

Currently, Lino needs a $475 loan to purchase material to finish his pending jobs and, thus, offer good customer service and continue expanding the business. He will return the loan in 6 months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Lino greatly appreciates the opportunity to improve that you can provide him.

Lino es originario de la localidad de Cadereyta en el estado de Nuevo León, tiene 12 años de experiencia en la herrería, anteriormente laboraba en un taller para alguien más pero su deseo de salir adelante lo motivó a ahorrar para poder independizarse y así fue como hace dos años abrió su propio taller de herrería y soldadura, comenzó con muy poca herramienta y material, pero gracias a la buena calidad de los trabajos que realiza pronto logró incrementar sus pedidos y clientes, por lo que ahora cuenta con la ayuda de una persona para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Lino necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de material para poder realizar los trabajos que tiene pendientes, con esto podrá ofrecer un buen servicio sus clientes y continuará creciendo, el devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Lino agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar.

loans.use:
Purchase of materials

Compra de material

loans.name: Bernarda Patricia

texts.es:
Bernarda is a very hard-working woman. She is married, has three children and her husband works in construction. Because his wages are not sufficient to cover all the family's needs, Bernarda decided to start her own business making and selling tortillas. Little by little she has expanded her business, reinvesting her profits to increase production. Her family, since they all work together, has been fundamental in the business's growth.

In order to meet her client’s demand and expand her business, Bernarda is asking for a $925 loan to purchase the ingredients she needs. She will pay this amount back in just four months. Be a part of this business and improve the lives of Bernarda and her family. They all truly appreciate it.

Bernarda es una mujer muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo se dedica a la construcción pero con su salario no puede cubrir todas las necesidades básicas de su familia, esta es la razón por la que Bernarda decidió iniciar su propio negocio elaborando y vendiendo tortillas, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio reinvirtiendo sus utilidades para incrementar su producción. La unión familiar ha sido fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio ya que toda la familia colabora.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y hacer creer su negocio Bernarda esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos que necesita, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo cuatro meses. Forma parte de este negocio y mejora la vida de Bernarda y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients

Compra de insumos

loans.name: Jesús Salvador

texts.es:
Jesus is a very responsable man. He is originally from Creel, Chihuahua, north of Mexico. He is divorced and he has full custody of his 3 children who are his main reason and motivation to work hard every day. He has a truck that he uses to transport wood. His great customer service has helped him in getting more clients and making his business grow.

Fortunately, he has already schedule many trips, but he needs to repair his truck in order to avoid any type of accidents. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD. He commits to repay this amount in 2 months. Today you can help someone who trully needs it. This family appreciates your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús es un hombre muy responsable, originario de la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua, al norte de México, es divorciado y tiene a su cuidado a sus tres hijos, los cuales son el motivo por el que sale a trabajar y a esforzarse más cada día. Tiene un camión en el que se dedica a transportar madera, el buen servicio que ofrece le ha ayudado a incrementar sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Afortunadamente tiene muchos viajes programados por hacer pero le hace falta comprar refacciones para reparar su camión y evitar cualquier tipo de accidente que pudiera presentarse por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en solo 2 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, esta familia agradece mucho tu colaboración.

loans.use: to purchase car parts

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es:
Alba Lorena is a widow and she has a son who is 10 years old. She started her own business because she needed to pay for the monthly bills and for her son's schooling. She opened up a day-care which was greatly needed in her neighborhood. This way she can take care of her own son at home while earning an income.

In order to expand her business and to provide day care for more children, Alba needs to make some improvements(modifications) to her locale. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 USD. She commits to repay this loan within 3 months. You can really help this family. Don't hesitate and give them your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Alba Lorena es viuda y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad. Ante la necesidad de obtener lo recursos que necesitaba para el sustento y educación de su hijo decidió iniciar su propio negocio, observando la necesidad de las madres de su localidad para que alguien cuidara de sus hijos mientras ellas trabajaban decidió abrir una guardería, de esta manera también podía estar al cuidado de su hijo y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso.

Para hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar la capacidad de niños que acepta en su guardería Alba necesita hacer algunas modificaciones de su local y requiere de un préstamo de $100 dólares que se compromete a devolver en solo 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To remodel

loans.name: Mario Edgar

texts.es:
Mario is married and he has 2 little girls. His daughters were his main motivation to start his own business by opening up a car wash in Creel, Chihuahua where he is from originally. Little by little, his business has grown due to his great customer service. Since he has been getting a lot of business, he had to hired 2 employees.

Mario wishes to offer an even better customer service. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD which he will use to buy the basic things he needs to run his car-was business. He commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of this business by lending your support! Thank you very much!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo su servicio de lavado de autos en la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua de donde es originario. Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleados.

Mario desea que su negocio pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio y para esto solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos que necesita en su trabajo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To purchase basic cleaning supplies

loans.name: Raúl Fernando

texts.es:
Raul is married and he lives in Creel, Chihuahua, Mexico. His wife is a teacher. They have 3 children. To provide a better quality of life to his family, Raul decided to start his own business selling used parts (junkyard). He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients, and his business keeps growing.

In order to satisfy the high demand, he now needs a loan in the amount of $200 USD wich he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repay this amount within 2 months. Be part of of this business and of Raul's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl es casado y vive en la localidad de Creel, en el estado de Chihuahua, su esposa es maestra y tiene tres hijos. Para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ante la falta de empleo Raúl decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de refacciones usadas, él conoce de este negocio y esta es la razón por la que puede ofrecer un buen servicio, con lo que ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 2 meses. Sé parte importante en la vida de Raúl y su familia, apóyalos en el desarrollo y crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Yanina Berenice

texts.es:
Yanina Berenice is married and she has a little girl. Her husband works in construction, but his salary is not enough to cover the basic necessities for the family. Since Yanina is an entrepreneur by nature, she decided to start her own business by opening up a bakery. She specializes in baking cakes for any occassion. Due to her passion for baking, she has acquire many clients. She wants to offer to her clients only the best and high quality products.

In order to increase her production and to continue growing, Yanina is requesting a loan in the amount of $375 USD which she will use to purchase baking cookware and baking ingredients. She hopes to fulfill all her cake orders and to continue to offer the best customer service. She will repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of this business by helping this family! They greatly appreciate your trust and support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Yanina Berenice es casada y tiene una pequeña hija, su esposo se trabaja en una refaccionaria pero el salario que obtiene es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, como Yanina es una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio elaborando pasteles caseros, su gusto por este oficio le ha permitido realizar un muy buen trabajo y ganar muchos clientes, ofreciéndoles productos de excelente calidad.

Para incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio Yanina está solicitando un crédito de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de utensilios de cocina e insumos, con esto espera poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar ofreciendo un buen servicio, ella regresará esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients and baking cookware

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela lives in Creel, Chihuahua located north of Mexico. She is married and her husband lives in the United States. Her husband sends her money whenever he can. Marisela started her own business selling used clothes to take care of her monthly bills whenever her husband is unable to send her money. She started selling a few items of clothing at first, but due to her friendly nature and her motivation, her business has grown. Now she has a bigger inventory and her sales have increased substantially.

Marisela would like for her business to continue to grow so that her husband can one day return home and they can be together. She needs a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD which she will use to purchase more inventory to offer a variety of products to her clients and increase sales. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of this business by helping this family be reunited! They greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Al norte de México, en la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua vive Marisela, ella es casada y su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos, en ocasiones le es muy difícil enviarle dinero a Marisela y para poder cubrir sus gastos ella inició su propio negocio vendiendo ropa usada, inició con muy poca mercancía pero sus ganas de salir adelante y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio, ahora cuenta con un mejor surtido y sus ventas han crecido considerablemente.

Marisela quiere hacer crecer su negocio para que su esposo pueda regresar y estar juntos, ahora necesita de un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a que esta familia pueda estar unida, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles is originally from Merida, Yucatan. She now lives in Union Libre. She has 2 kids. She started her own business about 7 years ago to help her husband pay the monthly bills and to offer their kids a better quality of life. She started her business by selling chickens at first, but later she began selling other food products (groceries) which has given her great results. She currently has a mini-grocery store which has grown over the years.

To provide better customer, Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of $925 USD which she will use to purchase display cases and to remodel her store to give it a better image. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part Maria's success! She and her family greatly appreciate this opportuniy you give them to better their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de los Ángeles es originaria de la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos, la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida la motivo a iniciar su propio negocio hace siete años, comenzó vendiendo pollos y fue incorporando la venta de abarrotes obteniendo mejores resultados, ahora solo se dedica a los abarrotes y ha hecho crecer mucho su negocio.

Para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de un mostrador y en la remodelación de su local para mejorar la imagen de su negocio y continuar creciendo, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Maria, ella y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: To remodel and to purchase display cases

loans.name: Alis Atocha

texts.es:
Alis is single, 29 years old and lives in Mérida, Yucatán. She's a teacher and also works in childcare. To improve her quality of life, she started her own business two years ago. Her love of children motivated her to open daycare center in an air-conditioned room in her home, where, thanks to her experience, she's been successful in offering a high-quality service and, from recommendations by her clients, has been able to take many children under her care.

To improve her service and grow her business, Alis is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to remodel her daycare center by giving it a better appearance and enlarging it to take on more clients. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Alis is very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Alis es soltera, tiene 29 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán, es maestra y puericultora, para mejorar su calidad de vida desde hace 2 años decidió iniciar su propio negocio, su gusto por los niños la llevo a abrir una estancia infantil acondicionando una habitación de su casa, donde gracias a los conocimientos que posee ha logrado ofrecer un servicio de muy buena calidad y por las recomendaciones de sus clientes ha logrado tener muchos niños a su cuidado.

Para mejorar su servicio y hacer creer su negocio ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la remodelación de su estancia con lo que podrá mejorar su apariencia y ampliar su capacidad, ella espera devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Alis agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Remodel daycare center

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Angela is a married mother of three. Her husband works as a security guard in San Juanito, in the Mexican state of Chihuahua, which is where they are from. Angela wants her children to have a good education, something which would be impossible with only her husband's salary, so seven years ago she decided to start her own business selling shoes. She started with a small amount of merchandise, but little by little she has increased her sales.

Now, in order to grow and reinvigorate her business, Angela is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase more shoes so she can offer a wider selection and better service to her customers. She plans to repay the loan in just a month. Help Angela and her family by contributing to her business. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ángela es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como velador en la localidad de San Juanito, Chihuahua, de donde son originarios. Ángela desea que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación, lo que sería imposible solo con el salario que recibe su esposo, por esto decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo zapatos hace siete años, empezó con muy poca mercancía pero poco a poco se han estado incrementando sus ventas.

Ahora para hacer crecer su negocio y darle un nuevo impulso Ángela solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, con lo que podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y mejorar su servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en sólo un mes. Ayuda a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Caritina

texts.es:
Caritina is a single mother of six children, which 30 years ago motivated her to start her own business selling cosmetics. She has had to work very hard to move her family forward all by herself, and she puts her children's well being ahead of her own. She started selling door to door, and now has a long list of clients. Thanks to her experience in the business, she has been able to offer a high-quality service and has grown her business a lot.

Now, to meet her customers' demands, Caritina is requesting a loan of $925, which she will use to purchase cosmetic supplies. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can contribute to the growth of this business and improving the lives of Caritina and her family. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Caritina es soltera y tiene seis hijos, los cuales han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio hace 30 años con la venta de cosméticos, ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola y pero el bienestar de sus hijos es lo más importante para ella. Comenzó vendiendo casa por casa y ahora cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes, gracias a la experiencia que tiene en el negocio puede ofrecer un muy servicio de calidad y ha hecho crecer mucho su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora está solicitando un crédito por $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar la vida de Caritina y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by six women of the Regroupement des Balayeuses de Ndayane association, led by Madame Louise N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The 'balayeuses' or sweepers number 65 members and are divided into four smaller groups. They often suffer from the lack of financial resources. The sweepers take charge of improving living conditions by regularly sweeping the streets and main boulevard of their neighborhood, because the local government does not provide garbage collection services. With time, this citizen practice of taking responsibility for improving local living conditions has spread like an oil stain to the surrounding localities.

Objective: To support these women in their retail trading activities.

Specific objective: To provide the members of this group with the resources they need to strengthen their trading activities, allowing them to continue their neighborhood cleaning services as well.

Brief description of the activities to be financed by the loan: The members of this group engage in retail sale of all types of common consumption items [i.e. food products, clothing, etc.]. With the loan funds, the group will buy such products in bulk and resell them among the members of their association and to other customers, and the profits earned from all these transactions will be used to repay the loan and to reinforce the purchasing power of the group.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

« Contexte du projet :Les balayeuses sont au nombre de 65 membres reparties dans quatre petits groupement, elles souffrent le plus souvent de la rareté des ressources financières. Les balayeuses prennent en charge la gestion pratique du cadre de vie a travers des actions de balayages périodique des rues et boulevard de leur quartier, faute d un système régulier de ramassage des ordures par les autorités locale. Avec le temps cette forme citoyenne de prendre en charge la gestion du cadre vie a fait tache d huile et sera repartis dans les environnants.

l’objectif : Appuyer les femmes dans leurs activités de petits commerces.

Objectif spécifique : appuyer les femmes membres à bien assurer leurs propres activités a fin de periniser le nettoiement périodique des zones ciblées

Bref description des activités à mener avec le prêt: Les femmes membres achètent et revendent tout matériel de consommation courante Avec le fond prêté le groupement achètera des produits a revendre entre membres et a d autres demandeurs et les bénéfices issu de toutes ses transactions servira aux remboursements et aux renforcement des pouvoirs d achat des femmes membres..»

loans.use: Bulk purchase of goods for retail sale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Diamano Plateau association, led by Madame Fatou N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Objective: The purposes of Diamano Plateau group include the following:

to supply the market with local products to ensure adequate consumption;

to strengthen the financial power of the women who are members of the group;

to improve the living conditions of our members

to increase the income of the women; and

to participate in the development of the local community.

Activities: The group plans the following activities:

Retail trading: this consists of buying diverse products that are scarce in the local market, and reselling them in Fatick [where Ndiaye Ndiaye is located] and in the surrounding area.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Le es GIE Diamano Plateau t un groupement de femmes de l’éco village de Ndiaye Ndiaye vivant dans le quartier de plateau à Ndiaye ndiaye enregistré à la date du Fevrier 2002 à la chambre de commerce de la région de Fatick sous le numéro RCN° 086/C

Objectif : Le GIE Diamano Plateau s’est fixé entre autre objectif :

de mettre sur le marché des produits locaux pour une consommation suffisante ;

Renforcer le pouvoir financier des femmes, membres du groupement ;

Améliorer les conditions de vie de ces membres,

Augmenter le revenu des femmes, et participer au développement de la localité.

Activités : Le groupement se propose des activités suivantes :

Petit commerce : il s’agit d’acheter des produits divers qui se font rares dans le marché local et les revendre à Fatick et dans les localités environnantes.»

loans.use: Bulk purchase of local products for household consumption and furnishing of a store area for retail sale

loans.name: Younous

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five women of the Daw Thiow association, led by Younous D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The Daw Thiow group is a group of young tailors in Oussouye who have long been active in local development, having chosen as their business sewing and the sale of clothing.

Objective: To contribute to the care of our families and assure continued development of our association.

Business activities: Purchase of cloth and production of clothing for sale in the local community and region.”

However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Contexte : : Le groupement Daw Thiow est un groupement des jeunes tailleurs Oussouye qui travail depuis très longtemps dans le cadre de développement et Ayant choisit pour activité ; la couture et l’exposition vente..

Objectif : Contribuer à la gestion de nos familles et assoire une bonne politique de développement dans notre entourage.

Activités : Achat de tissus et confection d’habit vendu dans la commune et dans le département»

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, lace, etc. for traditional clothing production

loans.name: Amsatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six members of the Khourwi association, led by Mr. Amsatou G.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The gardeners of our village who have cultivated the Valley of Sin for a very long time plan to increase not only their production, but also continue to cultivate their fields in every season, twelve months of the year. We need only to obtain a powerful irrigation pump in order to alleviate the hard work of watering the fields by hand. A large reservoir will also be constructed for the storing of a large volume of water, with a proper distribution system to carry the water as far into the fields as possible in pipes.”

Background

Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

« Les membres de l’éco village maraîchers installés depuis très longtemps dans la vallée (de Sin) visent à accroître non seulement leur production mais continuer à exploiter leur périmètre en toute saison ; douze mois sur douze. I l s’agira tout simplement de trouver une motopompe très puissante pour les alléger du dur travail de puisage à la main. Un nouveau basin très grand sera construit pour le stockage d’un très grand volume d’eau, avec une bonne technique de distribution dans le périmètre aussi loien que possible en tuyaux.»

loans.use: Purchase of an irrigation pump, reservoir and pipes to irrigate vegetable field

loans.name: Mahe

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the women of the association, led by. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The Takku Ligueye group has the following goals: to improve the living conditions of its members, to reactivate our business activities which were abandoned due to lack of financial means, to increase women's earnings, and to participate in the development of the local community.

The group plans the following business activities:

Retail trading: This consists of buying fish in Foundiougne [a nearby village] from the fishermen and resell them in Fatick [the town where Ndiaye Ndiaye is located] and the surrounding areas.

Sewing: The group will buy cloth and sew it [i.e. producing traditional clothing] before selling it in the local area.”

However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Le GIE Takku liguéye s’est fixé entre autre objectif : d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ces membres, ravivées les activités délaissées faute de moyens, augmenter le revenu des femme, et participer au développement de la localité.

Le groupement se propose des activités suivantes :

1Petit commerce : il s’agit de l’achat de poisson à foundiougne auprès des pêcheurs et venir revendre à Fatick dans la commune et dans les localités environnantes.

La couture : le groupement achètera des tissus et les coudras avant de les vendre dans la localité.»

loans.use: Purchase of fish, containers and ice for marketing of fresh fish; purchase of cloth for traditional clothing production

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Tessito 1 association, led by Madame Fatou S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The project is located in the village of Oussouye located at 40 km from the regional capital, Ziguinchor. Oussouye is a touristic village and commerce is the main livelihood of its inhabitants. The women engage in commerce by exporting local products such as dried fish, palm oil, and wild fruits such as made and tole to the cities.

Purpose: The Tessito 1 group has the purpose of improving the living conditions of our members and alleviating the housewife's burden.

Business activities: The principal business of the group is trading, which consists of purchasing and reselling seafood, fruits, and palm oil from the region of Ziguinchor. In order to succeed in this business, the Tessito 1 group sollicits a loan of 600,000 francs (about $1200) in order to undertake these activities.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Contexte : : Le projet se situe dans l’éco village de Oussouye situé à 40 km de la capitale régionale ( Ziguinchor) Oussouye est un 2co villave touristique et le commerce est la principale activité des populations Les femmes se donnent surtout au commerce en exportant vers les grandes villes des produits locaux tel que le poisson sec, l’huile de palme, des fruits sauvages comme le made, le tole etc.

Objectif : : Le groupement Téssito 1 s’est fixé entre autre objectif : D’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres ; D’allégé le panier de la ménagère ;

Activités : la principale activité du groupement est : le commerce ; il s’agit d’achat et de vente de produits halieutiques, fruits, et huile de palme venant de la région de Ziguinchor. Pour réussir ce projet, le groupement Téssito 1 Sollicite un prêt de 600 000F afin de bien pouvoir mener ces activités.»

loans.use: Purchase of dried fish, palm oil and fruit from local producers; transportation to cities for sale

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five members of the Khalobe association, led by Mr. Mamadou D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The project is located in the village of Boucotte Ouolof, a village whose people have been confronted with difficulties of survival since the local hotel closed in April. This is why the Khalobe group is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs [about $1050].

Objective: creation of employment improving the living conditions of the members of our group lightening the burden of the housewife

Business activities: The business activities of our group consist of buying and reselling local products in our village and in surrounding villages.”

Background Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Le projet se situ dans l’éco village de boucotte ouolof ; village qui à la fermeture des hôtels au mois d’avril, les populations se confrontent à des difficultés de survie. C’est pourquoi, le groupement Khalobé vient sollicité un financement de 500 000f

Objectif : Création d’emploi

Amélioration des conditions de vie des membres du groupement

Allégement du panier de la ménagère

Activités : Les activités du groupement consiste à acheter et à revendre des produits dans le village et dans les villages environnant.»

loans.use: Purchase of local products such as dried fish, palm oil, and fruit; transport and resale in villages where they are scarce

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: "I have lived in Pakpattan all my life, a small town in Pakistan. It is difficult for me to conduct business outside the house so I sew at home for local townspeople. My husband used to work as a sales agent in a small medical store. He left the job because the salary was not enough and brought a Rickshaw five years ago. Now we need some money to have our Rickshaw refurbished. A fully operating Rickshaw will make help attract more customers for us."

loans.use: Refurbish Rickshaw

loans.name: Shamin

texts.en: “I have six children, four of whom are in school. I spend most of my day taking care of the children and housework. My husband used to work in the city and but his left that job to operate his own Rickshaw about four years ago. We now want to purchase a new Rickshaw (three wheeled vehicle) by pooling in some of our savings and now require a loan.” Shamin B., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase a Rickshaw

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: “I am from Pakistan and have three children. I live in a small conservative town and have trouble working outside my home. My husband used to work as a plumber before, which did not yield much income but then he began providing transport service to people on a Rickshaw (local three wheeled vehicle). We would like to borrow money to have it repaired. Hopefully the additional income will help make ends meet” Parween B., Pakistan

loans.use: Refurbish Rickshaw

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: “My husband and I run a sewing business together in a rural area in Pakistan. We make embroidered clothes and sell them in the city of Lahore. We want to expand our business and purchase an additional machine and hire a worker in order to increase our income. We are looking for a loan, which we will repay in a year.” Samina B., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine
